oDDrUJJRDHt41OHVzzt-gQ.text: This is a hidden gem inside the Tuscany. The prices are fantastic, the menu is solid across breakfast lunch and dinner. It is part of the reason I use the Tuscany any time I come to Vegas.  Lunch is my favorite meal - the personal size pizza is huge for 1 person, and the soups are awesome. I love the beef barley soup. The sides and aka carte items are reasonably priced, so if you don't see what you want as a combo, you can craft your own without paying a penalty.

N1Lyj3LEZNM0oChhnoMtpA.text: Thanks to Yelp, I found this 24 hour place in the middle of the night after a major party at the Cathouse.  We ended up going here twice a day during our four day trip.    Good prices on some good food.  See my pics!    The ribs were falling off the bone, WOW!  The Frisco burger was yummy juicy.  The steak n eggs were fresh and full filling.  AND the Lasagna was oozing over with deliciousness!!!!!  It was a great way to start off the day and end the night.  This place can be found in the Tuscany Suites less than 5 mins away from the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nz_nk7OwVj7szc07DfhmNQ.text: We have been here many times over the years.   Before moving to Vegas we use to come stay at Tuscany and we would eat here all the time. When we moved to Vegas we would come for the  AUCE  crab legs.   We started going when they were much cheaper and they have been raising it up since. Still not bad of a price. We use to wonder how they were doing it for so much less.  We have had breakfast, lunch and dinner here and never had any complaints.  The prices are reasonable and its a good place if your staying at Tuscany.

ELoRQ1AtVikjnnlaZ6tOdg.text: We came to Marilyn's Cafe on a tip from a local (THANKS HOLLY!) and we were satisfied. The decor is very pleasant reminiscent of an outdoor cafe along the coast of Greece.   The food is great. It was so good we ate here two days. On our first day we came for breakfast. My hubby had breakfast and I opted for a patty melt. The patty melt was de-lish-ous! It was well seasoned and just enough of a portion where I didn't feel like I was overeating.   On our second day we came for lunch. I had the shrimp skewer (which came with 12 very large shrimp). The prices are very reasonable also. You will not be disappointed visiting the place. 2 thumbs up

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My delicious patty melt
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gKcFjuO--d2YPIWCAfkKGw.text: Once upon a vegas weekend, I really wanted some steak, eggs, and a mimosa. Although this place is a little far ways from the strip(you'd probably have to drive/cab here) but it was so worth it! I came with my boyfriend and my friend and her boyfriend on a Tuesday afternoon after the advertised deals. But our waitress was SO nice to us. She was friendly, she joked with us, and she hooked it up!   Instead of paying $12.99 for New York steak and eggs, she let us have it for the special price of $6.99 even though it was 3:30pm before any of the deals started. My boyfriend and I both got this deal and it was worth the out of way trip here! The steak was nice and tender and I can't complain for the price! The servings were generous, and the buttered toast was to DIE for (: My mimosa was originally $6.95 I believe but the bill showed it to be $5, so she definitely hooked that up too! It was just the right amount of bubbly! The meal total came out to be about $20, which I think is a really good deal!  I heard that there's a $3.99 deal for steak and eggs between 12am-6am so I'll definitely come back for that the next time I'm in vegas! Good food, even better prices, and amazing service !

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York steak and eggs for $6.99!

tlwfw_SwG_as58HAgx43KQ.text: Good food for the money.  Located inside the Tuscany Casino.  We ate here over the course of our three day stay while attending a convention.  Average price ranged from $7-10.   You can't go wrong.  Pros - plenty of seating.  Solid American food.  Cheap and plenty.  Cons - food served fairly lukewarm like my pancakes and corn beef hash.  Opened 24 hours daily.  Lots of to go orders.

fp6Jnb_w1VBrn6XYRZZczw.text: Okay. So it's no Morton's or Flemings, but for $8.99 for a decent 8oz steak cooked perfectly MR which I was actually shocked. Two eggs toast and potatoes it was most differently worth the money. My server was very obliging and polite.  I give it a strong four stars.

4THNebpLbKQhIYZHpGPaig.text: Over an hour wait for breakfast from the time we ordered. The waitress acknowledged our wait time 45 minutes since the waitress waited to put our food order in our food ticket only showed we were waiting 25 minutes. I spoke with the manager and she said with our food ticket in hand we had only been waiting 25 minutes so I told her the waitress did not put I order in when we ordered. The only thing offered was would you like me to box up your food? Unacceptable !

_hMB1eBbwffSVk8Fz4ICvg.text: Another friend in town and stayng on the strip...need to find someplace nearby and not overly priced or overly crowded. Who do I turn to...YELP! TADA...Marilyn's Cafe is chosen as the nearest and bestest in reviews.  So we meet here on a Sunday morning and the place is packed.    Pros: Hostesses were very polite and professional.  Food was good and very cheap. I got the Big WInner and I ate half of it. It came with pancakes, sausages, bacon, hash brown, eggs n toast. Oh and ham... Server was polite and server's assistant punctual as he got us drinks asap. Busy-which is always a good sign.  Cons: Server never checked back with us, until it was time to drop the bill. No refills on water, juice? They gave us a highchair that had a broken strap which someone tried to fix by stapling them together? Really? Little kids sit in them..use your brain!  Would I give this place another try. Sure, why not. Cheap food and it was quick. I just won't ask for a high chair, and if I need anything I'll just get it when I order my food...

mHRKU8X4CfbiwT0zkdZliw.text: This is a good spot depending on the servers of the night to have steak and Eggs with friends after going out. This is my least favorite place to eat steak and eggs or eat in general especially how there are a lot of late owls roaming this casino wanting to grab a bite to eat. They do not split checks at night and they only take two types of payments: one card and the rest cash. I think it's ridiculous that they have to implement the rules that we can't split checks and on top of that we can't have multiple payments?! It makes it stressful on my group and other customer's groups, and it strongly deters people from dining in here. The cashiers sigh and roll their eyes when a group has difficulty arranging the payment method, and I'm just standing in front of them like you guys are just standing and taking payments, no need to roll your eyes when customers are struggling to pay because of your unnecessary rules/ limitations to big groups. Some servers are sweet and I appreciate that but other employee's just don't know how to hold customer service. When we dined in one time, my cousin put her head down because she had a headache and an employee comes up to our table to let us know that she can't be laying her head on the table... why not? We are paying customers clearly waiting for our food, what else should we resort to while sitting down?! I've only had steak and eggs here and it's good but never will I ever make this a go to spot due to the bad customer service and attitude.

pdN3NHlKMTfZGx-BGFlqvQ.text: We were looking for a good place for breakfast and found Marilyn's on yelp. I ordered Eggs Benedict and they were perfect. Large servings of food and great prices. We were here around 9 am and it was busy but no wait to be seated. Our waitress, Rebecca, was very friendly and kept our coffee cups full! I'd definitely come back again for breakfast! Compared to other 24 hour Vegas cafes this is one of the best - clean, comfortable and a great value.

4RlYIQuV67mSnjprRUvakA.text: Just terrible, even for a 24 hour cafe.    I came here because, well, just LOOK at these other reviews.  This place looks great, right?  Fellow yelpers, how could you fail me so miserably?!  I made a special trip.  Not there to gamble, just to have breakfast.  I've had better food at nursing homes.  The eggs Benedict was unrecognizable as such.  Is that megaplex nacho cheese?   I didn't even want to try it because it looked so hideous.  Like congealed latex.  And the eggs were not even remotely poached.  More like hard boiled into some thing beyond a solid.  As in, like maybe something one would find on the surface Jupiter.    And the grits?  Well, I guess I should know better than to order grits in Las Vegas, but   these were somehow both watery and grainy at the same time.    I kept looking for the hidden camera, because surely I was being punked.  Top it off with a bloody mary that was basically clamato juice and (a half shot?) vodka with a touch of tabasco.  ie. about the most uninspired version of a bloody mary I've ever had the displeasure of drinking.    I rarely send back food and then not give them the opportunity to try again.  But this place was clearly beyond all redemption.

E5MMwZTzH9XfnMP9RV7q0w.text: A great place for early morning steak and eggs. $4.99 from 1am to 5am, $8.99 till 11am. Servers were fast and efficient, but very busy most of the time so you'd need to catch their attention. Cafe's furnishings are dated but in the middle of the night, you'd wouldn't really care. Menu is huge, i've yet to try anything else. Came here twice in a week to have their steak and eggs. Well cooked steak (medium), sunny side up eggs with potato hash. Will be trying the all-you-can-eat crab legs for $19 tonight. (only on Fridays for dinner).

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs at Marilyn&#39;s Cafe.

xO9LcnfsVV1J1GTcBec56w.text: Great food and good prices but the server was rather neglectful. He never checked back after we got our food even though he walked by us numerous times. The real downside was having to walk through a smokey casino to get to and leave the restaurant.

5HxiwJYxxMG1-iiu28bxgw.text: Had late night dinner here last night with my wife. Food was great, HUGE potions at super price. Reminded us of old school Vegas pricing. We had James as our server and will be back many times thanks to him! He is great...

0sn-QB4XXGD7gim2YeWWkw.text: Located at the Tuscany Suites, less than 5 minutes away from the strip. And less than 5 dollars to give you the best drunk munchies experience you'll ever have.  For $3.99 from 12 am-5 am, you'd better not think twice to enjoy their steak and eggs. It's the perfect remedy after a long night of drinking. The steak is actually very flavorful, hash browns are crispy and lots of it too, buttery toast, and 2 eggs any you want it! I got loaded has browns (a dollar more) this has gravy and cheese all over it. My medium rare steak with a sunny side egg on top of it to let the yolk just oooze all over it, was so freakin' bombbbb.   Honestly, one of the biggest reasons I made my recent Vegas trip was solely to have this deliciousness. And I'm lookin' forward to have my fix again.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. view of the casino. look at that plate!

lNMmZx596sn58nJFKDEDyg.text: Solid 3 1/2 stars. My friend always raves about this place, (he usually goes Friday nights for the all you can eat crab legs) so he brought me here for lunch today to try. Friday, around 11am, no wait to get in. Restaurant less than half occupied. They were going to seat us right next to (and almost on top of) a huge, obnoxious group of people, although there were other close tables in that same little section. I wasn't going to ask to sit at a different table, but my friend did. Hostess moved us 3 tables over from where we were going to be originally sat. Menu offers breakfast, lunch, dinner, and dessert, and had a lot of options!! Also several options for us herbivores! It was a good 10 to 15 minutes before anyone came over. I figured service might be a little slower since we moved to possibly a closed table/section, but this was extreme. Especially since we were located very close to the kitchen walkway and servers were constantly walking past, ignoring us. Eventually a server strolls over and flatly says "do you know what you want?". No "hi, how are you, sorry about the wait", nothing. She was very unfriendly, borderline rude. He ordered the special, steak and eggs with pancakes and cottage cheese, (huge meal) for $8.99. I ordered a personal size (7 inch, $5.99) veggie pizza. You have the option of thin or regular crust, to which I ordered regular. We both ordered waters at that time also. She brought our waters, and then we waited. And waited. And waited. A good 45 minutes passed. He ordered medium for his steak, so it shouldn't have taken that long. Our food finally arrived. This is the only reason I gave any stars at all. His steak was cooked correctly, and said everything he had tasted good. My pizza (cheese, green pepper, onion, olive, mushroom, and tomato) was great!! They did burn the outside of the crust, but everything else was fresh and full of flavor. Never were offered refills. She did ask at one point how everything was. Took a while for her to drop the check. We were at a 2 top, very small, yet our table was never prebussed. (We had several plates due to his big meal). Cashier at the front wasn't friendly at all, either. All in all, the food was so good, and menu so large, at such cheap prices, I definitely want to come back and try other things and hope for better service. Maybe their wait staff was having an off day.

JZVAkZ59IQEefJnMWnV9IA.text: Sometimes you want some greasy basic diner food. This is a great place for that. Perfectly crispy hashbrowns and scrambled eggs. You can also get one slice of French toast or one pancake on the cheap. Also breakfast served all day and it's open 24/7.

kIQ1b9Eru27RrFVL1IQCLA.text: Marilyn's is one of my favorite go-to breakfast/brunch spots in Vegas because it's the perfect amount of food for extremely fair prices! Friends I've brought here after a late night of adventures all agree that Marilyn's hits the spot! See you in October :)

jvCkTptrKIdDc_b5Ss76JQ.text: Many years ago a friend of mine got a gig at the Tuscany as a Cher impersonator. She made me come and all I remember is the old people with walkers blocking my way and the place looked old and terrible. Since then that's how I knew Tuscany looks like. So with all the good reviews about Marilyn's Cafe I really pictured an old hole in the wall Cafe.  I was in the area and starving so I thought let's try it here.  The casino looks great. It's remodeled since I've been here and for a minute I thought I'm at the wrong place.  Marilyn's Cafe is very nice. I didn't expect servers with ties. Anyways,  I ordered the T-bone dinner ($16.99) and added half a Caesar salad ($2.99). It was pretty good. The meat wasn't bad at all.  I got tiramisu for dessert and it was excellent.  Service was wonderful too.  I'm gonna come back one Friday to try their all-you-can-eat crab legs special.

QtoNHZb8JBTVj3bEj4w-6A.text: Came here for an early dinner at around 5 on a Monday.  Had the prime rib special...prime rib not flavorful at all, glazed carrots were not glazed, although you could taste the brown sugar.  Broccoli tasted old.  Decent prices though!

gEbFyPU6q5aguQxr9CPogw.text: I miss Tuscany ever since I moved. This place was a late night favorite for me after all the geeky magic get together a. Everything is fairly priced and delicious. The steak and eggs are a must!

88tVjQjspO3afeXFlh2_jw.text: I feel like their midnight and after steak and eggs deal price went up, but whatevers since it's still around $5 haha!  Every time in Vegas I NEED to eat here or somewhere that has steak and eggs because it almost feels like tradition.  If I didn't it'd be taboo or something and my weekend wouldn't receive a blessing haha jk I'm just being a dork.  The service is always good and my boyfriend says that he feels like the steaks are shrinking in size or getting thinner, but $5 food is $5 food and I'm not complaining!

WFs8Qk8XPEJvEOTaRVGUUw.text: This place was such a horrific experience that it inspired me to write a review and to actually join Yelp just to try to have some say in helping others know to stay away from this obvious 13th level of Dante's inferno.  This is where all the bad people who do really, really horrible things are forced to go after they die.  Trust me.  As a person with 26 years of management experience in all manner of retail and restaurant, I can tell you that this place is falling apart and has lost its bearings at ALL levels.  The food comes out cold and with the attitude of "I have been under a heat lamp for 7 hours, dear God please help me!"  I have been here once and already know that their mantra is "we can't do that, sorry we can't do that, sorry you can't do that No NO NO."  This is the complete opposite of customer service.  Want some specifics?  Okay:  Breakfast for Dinner?  Eggs cold and mixed with what appears to be Rico's Nacho Cheese from a 1985 General Cinema theatre.  Sausage out so long it has a hard outer shell like an armadillo.  Vanilla Milkshake that has all the right ingredients - milk, ice cream - but they aren't mixed up right, so you basically have 2 balls of ice cream floating in milk.  Nice try to deconstruct that dish my friends!  Pancakes were ok.  Hashbrowns were ok - ketchup can cover up all manner of sin.  My son ordered that awesome "milk float" and it took over an hour to finally get the thing.  He said, "Dad it doesn't taste good, but I am SO thirsty!" and promptly drank it.  I tried it.  Yep, ice cream in milk without being mixed.  We saw our waitress whenever she wasn't helping the other three hundred guests.  The drink guy understood a few words.  He made it with the water a couple of times.  Then we asked for separate checks and the waitress told us we could pay separately at the counter.  Then we were told they don't do that.  That would be ten times were couldn't do something.  The customer is always wrong at Marilyn's.  After a long discussion and working our way up the chain of command the manager, the wonderfully non-delightful Dana gave up arguing with us and told us flatly "we will not separate your checks, just pay."  I gotta tell you, I've never been arrested for a thing, but I really did want to just walk away without paying.  I wouldn't even use my card because I don't trust this place enough to give them any information.  And that is ok, because they will never be getting another penny from me.  The casino either.  Oh, and did I mention I have some pull, some blogs and some juice here in the Valley?  Yeah, word of mouth is gonna grip tight on this one.  I guarantee it.  Go at your peril dear friends.  Better yet, get better service and some decent breakfast food just up the Strip . . . at Denny's.

v1CjIOhr4mPMv3unqaVL_w.text: Steak, 2 eggs, and toast 5.99. Waiting for the food as we speak, don't imagine it being bad for the price.

0BVvnz1Ey70R1hwA6capTw.text: Had the eggs benedict eggs cooked to perfection hash browns on the side I highly recommend this place very good food the coffee is very good too

lKC856FMJgeEspkIk8ojAw.text: I loved the $4.99 steak and eggs... A lot better than some other chains out their ihop, dennys, etc. Best deal in town too. Their blueberry pancakes were delicious as well... I also ordered the grits - do not order. It was very watery and bland.

AcC7Mp6JaNuqjNx2njbrPA.text: I've heard this place has steak and eggs that are to die for.. um not so much. Food was ok. Service lacked. Experience wasnt horrible but it was great either.

DGWqEAjW0kLUvJozG9tboA.text: The service is terrible and I didn't like their breakfast , coffee and their cleaning conditions. The restaurant is old and dated. They even don't deserve one star.

8dUK8AWADdz_kVSfsh1rsw.text: I went to Tuscany on Flamingo Rd the restaurant there Marilyn's served us cold food. Under my steak was a short black hair. Right away less than 10 mins after getting our food I told the front cashier since our server was no where in sight after waiting 10 mins more she came to our table. I showed her the hair and she did not apologize but asked if I wanted something else (obviously I said no) and she walked away. Me and my friend sat there for 15 mins and decided to just leave. We walked outside and security came after us. I explained what happen and they said I had to speak with the manager. When we asked if the manager could come outside so it wouldn't cause us an embarrassing scene they threaten to call the police repeatedly. We went back inside. The manager was not waiting for us. It was the waitress with our check telling me that we walked out on our bill and I put my own hair into my food.  I told her my plate was barely touched. My hair is very long and black and my friends hair is very curly long and brown. The hair is pretty short, it was found under my steak and it had the root on it. This is why I was sure it was not my own hair. After accusing me the waitress walked away and I had to ASK a manager be called. I ASKED the cashier to call the police since my food was tampered with but he stated they could not call the police we would have to (after we were threaten several times that they would call on us). The manager arrived and wasn't told that a hair was in my food or that I notified two people before we left. He had to go find the waitress and confirm that information. He returned and told me no one in the back has long hair. At that point I asked him to look at the plate with the hair on it. He immediately looked at the hair and the food that was completely untouched and apologized and told us the bill is covered. We demanded security stop following us. It was a horrible experience. The customer service was terrible. If they sent security after us then a manager should have been notified, if a guest complains a hair is in the food a manager should be notified. I should not have been left at a table for 15 mins with no indication that the waitress would return nor resolution. It is poor customer service. Disrespectful to patrons. I will NEVER go to this place again. I will let everyone I know travelling to Vegas this year not to go here.

lUTZ6dkFIPH9hivb5xLmZg.text: If you stay at Tuscany Suites in Vegas, you can get 50% off coupon. Not fancy but good enough. The taste of grilled tilapia and prime rib were OK.

lVtPXvqQoCInNdpqGeUbhg.text: We decided on this place because they had 4 out of 5 stars! What we experienced was a 2 star restaurant at most. Very slow service with no one really in the restaurant. Food took a long time to come out, silverware had food stuck on them, soup & salad came out wrong. The only good part was the homemade potato chips were good.

4U5HZXjvxr81Wv09-tDJhQ.text: The food compliments the service. Kudos to Arnold, great customer service with a sense of humor. Food is reasonably priced. Overall good experience!

1YFheHGMfYf3V68uUe5CTw.text: You can't beat the $3.99 steak and eggs after midnight, but I like going in the morning M-F btw 6-11am for their $6.99 steak and eggs special with pancakes because the service during those times are awesome!  I can't remember her name, but our server was one the best servers I've ever had...and I'm not just saying that because she was cute.  The party in my table came one after another so we all ordered separately.  Our server didn't mind at all coming a multitude of times to take orders and run the food.  She was the best!  The other servers during that time slot rock also.  As for the food, surprisingly the cut of the steak isn't that bad.  I only had to slice off a bit of fat strip on the end, but after that the steak was pretty good.  On the down side, this cafe doesn't have A1 steak sauce.  They have Lea & Perrins which is sweeter, kinda ketchupie, but it isn't A1.  Pancakes were delicious and plentiful.  So plentiful I shared half my stack with my little niece.  Can't wait to come back in Christmas time to take advantage of their $3.99 steak and eggs!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $6.99 Steak &amp; Egg Special M-F 6-11am

rnZFsAB0kLihiwlPDYJtGw.text: Yum. Good breakfast and cheap beer. Staff was a little slow but pretty good food for cheap Vegas food.

H3_zwYKT4Sedl86OE38rKg.text: Tried out this little gem on a whim.  I was staying at the Ramada next door...and when I tried to get some food via room service, I was told they no longer carry food for room service.  Bummer.  The front desk attendant told me to try out the cafe next door, and that a lot of their clients like it there.  Five minutes later, I am ordering a meat lover's skillet type meal for dinner.  It was good.  If I am in this area again, I will try this place again.  They serve diner type food plus alcohol...so its a decent spot.

T0rtEIK7tmbd8hsCJey3NQ.text: I was recommended to this place for some cheap food by my friend. I think he comes here when he's drunk/hungover. I was too sober for this. Our entire table got the steak eggs for $5.99 at around 12am when we had just arrived in Vegas. My dining experience was pretty much ruined by weirdos and loud skanky girls.

EMR0j3LzLRYSLttD7kNIHQ.text: Tasty, but random.  Do not order a chocolate shake it is kinda cold watery chocolate milk...  the pizza is good though.

MpMR5LMLby8KVGovW6asGA.text: Went here twice, once for lunch and then for breakfast the next morning. Everything I was soaked with grease and had little to no flavor..-all in all it was Mediocre service and bad food.

cKcEyrfFAhUBTPHTpRQ4XQ.text: $4 steak and eggs special during midnight graveyard hours. Its not on the menu but you can ask the waitress about it and they will tell you about it. NOT bad for the portion they give you, it comes with hash browns and toast as well. What a deal! I only go here for their steak and eggs specials after a long night of clubbing and partying. Inside of the Tuscany suite at Marilyn cafe.

jkuE2aUQtAeZ-UNQjrHx2Q.text: Pros: Friendly service Fresh ingredients  Cons: 25 minute wait for omelet, steak on a non-filled morning Food was not seasoned

wsHFW4S7SzxwKHKWmm7uaA.text: Very Very Very Good Country Fried steak & eggs! Park near the casino not the main entrance.

hIV90RGeXlXuDxHtx_BC4A.text: $5.99 steak and egg special!  We came here because it was cheaper than at Ellis Island haha (only by $1 though).  It was pretty great to finally try a midnight/late night steak and egg meal, and we are happy we came to this restaurant.  The meal came with steak, eggs, hash browns, and buttery toast, with plenty of jam to go with it :D  It was definitely a great meal and a great deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dJMrSprSk6FUSkl8-BM3Mg.text: Man this place is great. Loved my chicken fried steak. My buddy really like his senior portion steak and eggs too. Will be back next time I am in Las Wages.

b3hF2eviZ0SQQnR3TeZ5hw.text: 5/5 stars for great customer service!  [SERVICE] I came here around 4AM on a Friday night/Saturday morning with a group of 10 and we were seated immediately. The servers came by to take our drink orders and patiently took our food orders while we tried to figure out what everyone was getting. They also made sure to check on us throughout our meal. Thank you to the servers that were so kind and friendly, it was definitely the best service I've received in a while, and especially at such a weird dining hour.  [FOOD] I ordered the NY strip steak with scrambled eggs, hash brown, and wheat toast. You can't get good steak and eggs at any time of the day for such a great price anywhere else! I ordered my steak medium well and it was cooked perfectly. Very satisfied with my order.  To summarize, the place is worth coming to for steak and eggs on your weekend Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak, eggs, wheat toast, and hashbrown

GybDPlm2Fcu3EaStyxxQrw.text: The food was good but the service was AMAZING! The food came fairly quickly considering how busy they were. The server was so polite and patient with me. I had to send one of my chicken breast back due to it being overcooked but he took it to the back with a smile on his face. NOT a fake smile. He talked and chatted, he was quick getting our drinks filled and our bill taken care of.   MILITARY DISCOUNT was given to us.   Me, my husband, and our three kids all left with half of our meals. The servings are fairly big for the price. The lemonade is really good too.

xeR7mCbQm4gS2-h08xKHxA.text: Terrible experience with their to-go service. Order took 45 minutes to be ready when person taking the order said it would take 15 (I ordered eggs). Staff was too busy chatting amongst themselves to pay attention to customers. Plus, food wasn't that great. Will never order from here again.

tNsYrR-upanC3c2u2INf3g.text: Food was great. My cousin and I ordered the unlimited crab legs for $23.99 each. Service was nice but slow. Our original waiter was quick on it but he went home and the girl we got next was the slower one. She wasn't quick on refills. And when we got tired of waiting we asked for the check. She charged me over $77 for a completely different table. Then to fix it she charged me for my table $59. My money is still in limbo. So, if you eat here PAY CASH!!!!

u2VGJN_b86lejDbxIqeWYA.text: All you can crab legs on Friday night.  You get the legs with two siDes.  $23.99 ayce crab legs.

k3S_QrQwz9_U-T5asI6UCQ.text: Good inexpensive food.  Nice casual. Not trashy. Very clean. Good service.  Was very impressed

5fYVjY_Qu0LX6JzgdswzcQ.text: I love that they have AYCE crab legs here but her are the pros and cons. 1) only 4-10pm on Friday nights AYCE snow crab legs $24 per person and it comes with two sides. 2) there was a wait for us (25mins) they don't take reservations and limited options for large groups. 3) not that I needed to but they don't do split checks. 4) first plate was cold crab but the butter sauce they provide is over a tealight candle so that got warm. 5) my butter sauce began to boil and would pop up at me distracting me from eating- call it personal but I don't want hot butter popping my face. 6) took over an hour to get napkins. I know they're busy but I had to ask three people. 7) overall great price for snow crab legs but the atmosphere had me uncomfortable at times. Plus there's seating next to Casino and people love to stare at you while you eat. So that was uncomfortable too.

MYXq3pwCzyX7AUEr7h24rg.text: Very affordable, great breakfast. Take an Uber to save steps for somewhere else. I was looking for affordable food on a sunday morning.  Worth the the extra mile.

lSb2cRmSkRTU1VqqFrKH7w.text: I love this place! Located in the Tuscany casino, this is definitely a hidden gem. Marilyn's is a traditional cafe that is open 24 hours. They also serve breakfast all day. This place has amazing food at very cheap prices. The quality of food is very good, and the service is always above average.   Gluten free options: They offer some gluten free options, such as gluten free pancakes (they are very good), and also have options such as scrambles, omelets, sandwiches w/ no bun. They do not have a specific menu, but they do offer some options, and they are happy to make substitutions.    I would recommend this place to anyone looking for good food at a very reasonable price!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast menu!
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ICPpXdxxHx4Wxto8LF4nyQ.text: Great steak and eggs special!! Short walk from our hotel on the strip and worth it. Food was out in decent time given how busy they were. The Tuscany had another spot, Pub 365, that looked nice as well.

8LhYUcU273afS96VLN-2aQ.text: My husband had dinner here while I was exiled in NJ and he raved about it.  But he couldn't remember the name.  So when I checked on Yelp I figured it was Tuscany Gardens, which has some really good reviews. Big surprise when it turned out to be Marilyn's Cafe.  It's an effin' coffee shop!  No atmosphere, unless you like the "ambience" of a tired coffee shop.  And lots of people who can't talk in a normal tone of voice, along with shrieking children.  And a waiter (not ours) who goes to clear the vacated table next to us, finds no tip, and SLAMS the hard plastic drink card onto the table loud enough to make me jump out of my seat.  To further compound the misery, it was my birthday.  We weren't here to celebrate it, gawd no, but needed a quick bite to eat before an 8:00 pm Lionel Richie concert at PH, so we were captive.    Having said all the negative stuff, I had a Reuben, and it was genuinely good.  I hate it when I order a grilled sandwich and it's floppy and ungrilled, but it actually was perfectly done.  The table had the usual condiments, but I like deli mustard on a deli sandwich.  When I asked if they had it, the waiter brought me a cup of a very drippy Dijon.  Not quite what I had in mind, but it was better than yellow mustard.  I can't remember what my husband ordered, but just as before, he liked it a lot.    The service was pretty good, and if we're ever in the same circumstance, I might consider coming back.  The sandwich was that good.  But I'll bring my own mustard.

hFHwyQaNVGdhWMYdC9sMug.text: Tucked inside the Tuscany's casino, it is worth the hunt!!  Food was excellent, they did an amazing job of altering the menu for me to have gluten free.  The portions are huge and the staff rock!! I will be back for those gf pancakes!!

v4xxcU4V_SfypySUp-a8cQ.text: Surprisingly good food, service and prices. Very convenient if you're staying at the Tuscany and even if you aren't. I really like this restaurant, it's more than just a cafe.

WYGmdH4j_nOSVP2M0LETHg.text: We were looking for a place off the strip to eat breakfast when I came across reviews for this place. It is located inside the Tuscany Hotel and Casino. There was a wait as apparently this place is pretty popular but it was do-able.   Services was ok, it did seem somewhat lacking but not horrible. There were times when I waited quite some time for a refill on my coffee. Also, I got my food before my mimosa arrived which was weird since it's a simple drink to make.   Food was average but you really can't complain because the prices are very reasonable. We walked out spending $30 on two breakfasts, coffee, a soda and a mimosa. On the strip you'd pay more than this for the food alone.   I would go back because it was ok food and service but the pricing can't be beat. You'll leave full without breaking the bank.

EcWi3IjfUSyiN44c3H5T_w.text: The service is great, the restaurant is clean, and the food is awesome.  I am not a pancake person, but I always get the blueberry pancakes and they are perfect.  I also like the biscuits and gravy and les be honest - after a night of partying they hit the spot.    I also like the fact I can walk up and get an OJ to go.

wGKzR_aXTNEHHoBKkEdMaA.text: How has it taken me this long to discover this restaurant?!  The best Steak & Eggs the Strip has to offer!  & what is better is that it is only $5.99!  My girlfriends & I came here after Omnia around 3a after our other girlfriend recommended it & it had quite a few customers.  Great customer service!   Steak & Eggs, served with Hasbrowns & Toast - I ordered it medium & it was juicy, tender, & flavorful!  What a hearty meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Eggs

cW_2rOAY3Fe9sLnFhWq0eA.text: First time at this casino, came to watch the Rat Pack show.  Tried this restaurant and food was amazing.  Best prime rib!!

m4VAbh88--csSZQOjunYFw.text: Not worth it. We ordered the pork chops and they were so dry we couldn't finish them. The place is understaffed so service is extremely slow. Don't recommend this business.

whhZt-9Kk_TRcp-q6bPeFg.text: Took a walk to this nice little restaurant. I was surprised at how nice and clean this place was. It was very nice. I got the omlete George with turkey and was surprised how delicious it was. My wife had Belgian waffle, aside from the pretty slow service breakfast was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OD6HMlIUYg-JVN4EDpwLsQ.text: Really good, inexpensive breakfast. I had the 8.99 steak and eggs breakfast. The service was also very good. I would definitely recommend this place

Xp5syfkzGP051sMW-c_81g.text: Three words: STEAK AND EGGS.   Probably one of my favorite places to fulfill drunchies, or breakfast fill after a long night out in Vegas. From what I can remember, the prices are quite decent, if you're here before 4 am, I think you can get your steak and eggs for about 5 bucks? Don't count me on that quote, but for sure VERY CHEAP regardless. The place is located in the Tuscany Suites & Casino, and seems to always be busy when I'm here.   Menu has a lot of different options, but I come here for the steak and eggs deal for breakfast. With an affordable price, well cooked steaks, eggs and hash browns with toast on the side, definitely a great breakfast for anyone.   They do have other breakfast options to fulfill your cravings, and great daily specials for affordable prices as well. You will definitely find something that suits you. I always enjoy my food when I come here.   I will say that the wait for your food can be a little while, but I tend to not notice when I'm around really good company. Just keep that in mind if you're not the type to wait for a while when hungry!   Will definitely be back again!

SOx8Vg2nxXuG19uU7SyxtA.text: It's 2am in Vegas, hungry like there's no tomorrow. What? Steak and eggs? Sure! $5? That just makes it even more appetizing!   Marilyn's cafe never ceases to satisfy! Located in the Tuscany Suites & Casino, it's just off the strip by a tad. Their graveyard special is just that - steak and eggs for $5. I haven't tried anything else, but this definitely makes a girl like me happy. You can order your choice of white or wheat bread, choice of cooked eggs (over easy is the way to go!), and it also comes with a side of hash. Yum. Steaks are the perfect portion size and cooked just right to your liking! Sure, it may not be the best steak and eggs, but for the price, it's excellent!   Service is great and attentive! Friendly is a plus! Seating is always available which makes it even easier!   Convenient and reasonably delicious! I'll be back for midnight munchies!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ttQCsHu9Cr3SKqqgLex6Mg.text: The CLASSIC FAMOUS steak and eggs places in ALL of Vegas. One of my staple Vegas post-midnight places to eat. They serve steak and eggs until 5am. I miss the days when it was only $3.99, and $5 will get you in and out with tax and tip. It is more like $5.99 + tax and tip now, but still full of all its glory and deliciousness, especially a hectic night of Vegas shenanigans. Definitely will be back next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs

KJqqMp7HgRXoeqozrAuOuw.text: Don't let the Denny's-like decor fool you, this place is the bombbbb diggity.  $5 dollar steak and eggs, SAY WHAT?!  It's not really advertised you just order it, only available from 12am-5am. Soooo either stay up or stay out so you don't miss out on this super awesome deal.    You know what they say, the early bird gets the the worm! Well, in this case...a steak cooked to your liking (medium-rare ftw!), crispy hashbrowns, two eggs prepared on your word (over easy done right!), and two full slices of toast smeared in butterrrr (white, wheat, rye, sourdough).  Hungry hippo, you're welcome. Drunk ass, you're welcome.  (I am both of these, so no judgment here!!)

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium-rare steak, over easy eggs, crispy hash &amp; white toast.....all for 4.99 between 12-5am!!

Fdj_E48wNn4IGEjUd0VOTA.text: $4.99 for steak, eggs, potatoes, break - say what!?  You can't ask for a better deal, especially after a long night of partying at 3 - 4 in the morning.  Don't expect quality steak at this price.  However, the food for sure hits the spot at the wee hours of the morning.  Our waiter was awesome, funny, attentive, and super friendly.

dbcHpjLLcbhuUiZry1MjyA.text: Love the senior menu (50+) with variety of items for each meal (breakfast, dinner, all day 24/7 !!! Great breakfast and other meal selections, found something for everyone on the regular menu at good prices. Loved loved loved the senior menu which includes steak and eggs, turkey dinner. Hidden gem off the strip (mini hike to the Strip on Flamingo) in a cute Tuscan-style hotel. Will have to look into staying here next time ! Graveyard special on steak and eggs at $5.99, but that's too late for us to eat a big meal. We liked the rest of the menu to come back a few times this trip !! Had a late dinner here last night, already thinking of going back TODAY !! Maybe we'll take some pix before wolfing it down (today?) good size portions too !

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow ! We&#39;ve been here every day since.
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast all day !

xauNWuByX_uB4XkOHU0sgw.text: Wandered in around 11 pm and inhaled my yearly dose of second hand smoke in the hour I waited for the graveyard special to start. Totally worth it. Two eggs Two pieces of toast Hashbrowns  Steak medium rare $6.48 including tax. Crazy.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $6.48 for this...I still can&#39;t believe it.
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They don&#39;t have HP sauce bit this comes pretty damn close

TLaqaaYH136Sgy9yEjV4DQ.text: Wow.  What a hidden gem.  Very reasonable prices for a lot of food that was prepared well and all tasted fresh.   The service was really good as well.   If you have a family, and are looking for good value and good food, I'd suggest here.

NYn1YY1mmcwGLec-IEqP5A.text: All you can eat crab leg Friday.....the crab was cold but good, the sides were not as good the first two times we were here and we sat by the beverage station and it had this smell that wasn't pleasant I'm sure it was all the crab legs they were boiling. Still the service was great as always. I would suggest bringing your own cracking instrument as they have this little plastic one that doesn't really work.  My husband was jealous of this young lady at another table, who was eating her crab while she was talking and bringing out huge pieces of crab everytime.  I took a picture of him because he was so hilarious.  Needless to say this was his first time eating crab legs and he didn't get stuffed or even full. Next time we'll bring pliers and do it right so he can get stuffed.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 19.99 all you can eat crab legs every Friday at the Tuscany.
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband jealous of the young lady eating crabs with style.

7JPiejLVvzv76E05eLOcOQ.text: Steak and eggs are $5.99! This starts at 12am till 6am! The steak was okay.. The service was pretty meh. Well they were pretty busy so I understood that part. Oh, and they got some good desserts too! The tiramisu, it's heaven!!! Try to eat here and you get what you pay for.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simply the best.. Yay
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ohh they&#39;re waving at me.. Come and get me!

RZZ1tqIRkm1VWZW-1UHuRw.text: Six dollar steak and eggs. Need I say more? The four times that I've come to Vegas, I've stopped here, if only because I manage to somehow arrive to the city after midnight and it's the best deal around. The place is open 24/7 but after midnight is when you can get the deal. The steaks are fairly thin and when we asked for medium rare, we got medium well. I'd give this place 3 stars for that but since I come so often and it's such a great deal, I can't give it less than 4. Ask for it rare if you want it to come to you pink. The portion is pretty big so you can get full for little money.

wOLgr1Hk_UyQqYdda8NVgQ.text: I'm gonna go out on a whim and say you stumbled onto this restaurant by searching for 'steak and eggs'. High five for you!   Nothing says you've had a good night like some $4.99 steak and over easy yolk-porn.  It's a guarantee that the entire plate will be devoured in under 5 minutes. Time me if you don't believe me. heheh   Don't complain about slow service and stop being picky about the quality. it's $4.99 and you're drunk, so just be happy and enjoy the rest of your night.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. you already knoww!

39EwjGrqa8RqMFhgnRjRTw.text: Good menu selections and open 24 hours. Always has a nice breakfast. The servers are very friendly and attentive. We were even staying at a differentnt hotel (only because of availability) and came back here to eat each day. We like the players club discount for over 50 of 20%. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Senior steak and eggs

shp6Un3LnYq-sIFBnfZJ6w.text: We loved this cafe! Amazing food. Hash browns were wonderful and the senior discount was loved by my grandparents. The country sausage bowl was great, and the croissant sandwiches were huge. Overall we had an amazing experience & the staff was wonderful. The best part was the prices. Extremely affordable.

0ntqqGRR93J9eu7O1V8nuQ.text: I chose this place to go to for breakfast because we had a large family and I was looking for great breakfast deals plus good pancakes. It was to my surprise that none of that really applied to this place.  The customer service was ok and our server was funny to say the most but the food was just OK. Nothing really to call home and tell Mama about . I ordered pancakes for my son and they were just mediocre. I really wish that I had just gone to IHOP but the ones out there received such bad ratings that I was willing to try something new as I usually am.  The bathroom was clean and the restaurant didn't smell completely like the casino so that was a plus in my book seeing as though I'm from LA and can not stand the smoking laws out there.  I'm a foodie but I don't mess around when it comes to my food  I most likely will never go here again.

hoIV1XNgrYcilTRoq6-aMw.text: We stayed at the Platinum hotel so we just walked over to the Tuscany. We were seated immediately and our waiter Arnold was very attentive. He definitely gave us great customer service.  I ordered 2 pancakes (which btw was a very good price) with blueberries and strawberries on top! They were surprisingly better than IHOP! I was very pleased.  My boyfriend had also ordered the steak and egg. For $13 you get huge portions of steak, egg, hashbrowns, and toast. You get a good amount of food and quality for the price you pay.  The setting is very welcoming and home-y! Overall very happy we chose marilyns!

3TJXjMkmITFNszCq2cdDcw.text: The best deals and taste at the same time we are definitely coming back again plus I love gambling here fun 21 is the shit here

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_gIsGsM0hHa3tROTOyBE9A.text: We stay at the Tuscan Suites most of the time when we come through Las Vegas to CA. We usually do eat at this restaurant and the prices are always very good. This night the prime rib was on special so we both ordered it. It was cooked exactly the way I like it. Also there was a bread basket with nice warm breads, with the prime rib I had carrots which I love and mashed potatoes and gravy. Wine we got with a coupon which I believe was buy one get one free. Service is always good and the waiter was very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. warm bread and butter
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. wine
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. prime rib special

KMat-L8htr2L_KYFUQJgBg.text: Late night steak and eggs are the best!  For ~$6 they have a steak and eggs deal that comes with toast and hash browns which frankly cannot be beat! Steaks and eggs are made to order and you can choose which type of bread you would like!  I personally don't care for the toast so I never eat it but for the price, it's not bad at all!  Servers are all great and nice, however, my biggest downside is the wait. The fasted I've gotten my food was 20min with a fairly slow night, avg 45mins, the longest I've waited was 80 mins and half our table was falling asleep!  So biggest thing would be to be wary if you have a large group and or there's a lot of people already there!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c4SONrjAgEPONVAWmJf1Pg.text: Had an omelette for lunch! Very accommodating and the omelette was very good. Good amount of the veggies and a nice, fresh flavor.  Can't wait to go back to try something else.

9y4YzJqC6ChpYEAG3A-ctw.text: standard vegas casino sit down restaurant, akin to dennys or the like. service was friendly and food came out relatively quick. the omelette was good, plenty of butter on the toast. acceptable and convenient if you don't want to venture too far.  cheaper than the strip or downtown,  as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spinach and feta omelette meal

2plLr2A_k7S6tT8vR36zAA.text: Best GF pancakes! Close to the strip. They are open 24/7 with a wide variety of options. You can find good options that are healthy, dairy free, and/or gluten free. Staff is very friendly.

7VwPQlEx2dXkZRbyTUP_Iw.text: Other than blueberry hill Cafe best breakfast in town . Good service and pricing is fantastic.

U-m-Iq-Lit8ixxQeZqTL5w.text: We were staying in Tuscany hotels and had no idea about this restaurant until I searched on Yelp for near by breakfast places. We went for breakfast around 7am on a weekday, so the restaurant was pretty much empty. They have variety of options to choose from, even for vegetarians. Which made me very happy!  We ordered pan cakes, Belgium waffles, and veg omelette. The food was very fresh and tasty. Overall, the food was delicious, the prices are reasonable, the food portions is good, and the staff were very friendly and courteous.  We will definitely visit for a lunch or dinner next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes with cinnamon apples
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie omelette
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belgium waffles

BR5_Qi95c0ES8ISzzjRHKA.text: We stayed at a Tuscany suite and decided to head down to the cafe for a late breakfast. The cafe is near the casino. The service was good. But I loved the food there. The chocolate chip pancakes were delicious, so was the hash brown (huge in size), I wish the sausages weren't so tiny 'cause they were tasty enough too. The cheddar cheese omelette was great though. Would have loved to eat our other meals there because the food items were all reasonably priced considering its Vegas! But we had to check out other Vegas joints too so yeah head over to Marilyn's cafe if you're looking for quick service, decently priced tasty meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ria1NdLBftNcCJucovM0YA.text: Steak and eggs were outstanding, $10.99 for both NY and country fried, with 2 eggs, toast, hash browns/grits and pancakes (NY).  Nice cafe style restaurant inside the Tuscani casino.  NY steak was tender and tasty as was the country fried steak.  Son loved the NY steak.  Good service.

LSKFbAr-y1nqS2hjJbXgaA.text: Prime rib outstanding, pot roast melt in your mouth, dinner rolls fresh baked and deliciously dangerous, the best dinner salads seriously, next day we had breakfast and it was also delightful!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good cofffffeee
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak and eggs the gravy is not good tastes like flour

4lVkUywjGRh3VjFL8lHuVw.text: Some of the best Chocolate Chip pancakes I've ever had! Paired perfectly with the egg white omelette

t1zxXol_iKcO2sdENvO_Vg.text: It's worth the walk off of the strip to eat breakfast here.  I can't do eggs for breakfast, allergies, and have spending $18 for a breakfast entree just for them to remove the egg and end up eating potatoes, onions, etc.  There are a ton of breakfast options and they won't break the bank.  Coffee was refilled often, cup was never empty, and the morning cocktails were fantastic.  If you're doing Keto, have food allergies, or just don't want to spend a fortune on breakfast, this is a great place to go.  It's tucked in the very back of the Casino so look for signs once you enter the hotel.

HUQf27BEwjJ5faJyeOTehQ.text: Food was really good but service was somewhat slow. Prices can't be beat, especially in Vegas! I got the banana chocolate chip pancakes with eggs and bacon and my husband got a waffle with sausage, eggs and bacon and with tip we paid $26! Talk about a steal!  It's located in the Tuscany right off the strip, take an Uber there and walk back, that's what we did and it was perfect!

ePxfLVCB9mEiGCVnzXRShA.text: We had the crab legs Friday night. We kept opening up crab legs that didn't have any meat. We called our server, Angel informed him of the situation, all he did was say sorry and moved on.  Our party came to an agreement on our busser, who served our drinks and kept checking in us, making sure our drinks were filled and making conversation, making us feel welcomed, was  Willy, a Real customer service personnel...he deserves all the accolades and tips, the only reason why I'm giving this a one star....we will redirect friends to Rampart or Mainstreet Station for crab legs on Fridays (which is all u can eat) at least if we get empty crab legs, we can always go back and get more without being charged.....just saying don't waste ur time going to this place.

iHXJ-B5YmFGekFDdYTSpCg.text: I go here at least twice a week after work. Everything I have ever ordered was fantastic! From the pot roast, to the Tortilla soup. So far this is my favorite place to eat in Vegas.Staff are always very friendly and helpful. Prices are great! And if you have a players card you accumulate points for comped meals. Great food!

61gbiNiog8Y1w7mCFOHKoA.text: We stayed at the Tuscany suites for 3 days and every day we came in to eat here and it was DELICIOUS. Usually I would never go to the same restaurant three times but this place was phenomenal and very affordable.  They have a different special every day!  My first meal was the prime rib with the mashed potatoes and it was so great! The gravy on the potatoes was amazing. Must try!! I finished off with the turtle cheesecake but they had a whole tray with all different types of things to try.   The Marilyn's starter breakfast was a great deal and very tasty. I loved the sausage links and the pancakes the most  To finish off on our last night here on a Wednesday they had a Steak and lobster special for 13.99!!! Yes you ready that right 13.99.... the cheapest I've ever seen and it was the perfect amount of food.  Must try the honey carrots and Mac and cheese  Also- if you are a guest at the Tuscany suites they will give you coupons for 2-1 drinks here as well! So pleased with this joint and I WILL be back!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marilyn&#39;s special breakfast!
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turtle cheesecake! 4.99 so good!
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monday night prime rib special 12.99. Broccoli and mash

Lboi9bOHQuYYR_uLdtO6UA.text: Usually this place is great for the price of $19.99 for Ayce crab legs. But  today no so. Legs were cold, butter dish had a chip and crack and should not have put on table.   Server gave the impression that he wish he was not there. I usually have good service here.  The big deal was the price has increased by $5.00.  Only worth it because I can walk there.  But then again maybe not.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chipped dish...bad!
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You get plenty of legs with 2 side dishes.

fITi9JqdjGgtZy780w0DnQ.text: We were staying at the Platinum hotel and needed a quick place for breakfast, so we decided to try Marilyn's.  First of all, you need to walk through a large casino area to get to the cafe. The cigarette smell was not a good way to start breakfast. The seating area is okay, but pretty run-down. Our booth was comfortable though. The waitress was friendly enough.  Everything on the menu is extremely affordable, especially considering it's Las Vegas. The unlimited pancakes option was pretty great and only $4. The pancakes were perfectly soft and fluffy. The french toast I ordered was not so good: too eggy and not enough flavor. Ended up just sharing the pancakes.  You pay at the register, which was good considering we were in a rush. Total for four people was less than $30. There are definitely better places on the Strip. We would not come here again, but it was okay for such a cheap price.

hUzRIus4J895efhH2QVPVQ.text: If you find yourself here, but not late enough for the midnight steak and eggs $5.99 special, the NY steak is a decent alternate. You pick two sides and of course the steak. They didn't have A1, but I guess that's just personal preference.  The layout of the cafe feels a bit weird and the service can't expect too much.  The food itself was great. Ordered the fries with mac & cheese as my side. Since the cafe isn't isolated from the casino floors, there's a lot of background noises going on, but if I find myself on this side of town again, might stop in.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY steak, fries + mac &amp; cheese

lG7Osz7ggI6pu4G_lTt7Qw.text: The food was great , we ate off the 50+ menu and got Chopped Steak with Mushroom Gravy , I got Brown Rice my husband got White Rice, it was Delicious, and the service was great .

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped Steak with Mushroom Gravy and Brown Rice

q4O622DCyRejy8B7CvOwRQ.text: Came here for the late night/early morning special. I ordered the steak and eggs with a side of bacon & white rice. This was my first time here. I usually go to south point for steggs (steak & eggs) but a friend of mines recommend that I go here. Let me start off by saying that it looks nice and decent.   Food 8/10- The steak and eggs came with hash browns and toast. The steak was a good portion for me. I have a small appetite. The white rice was really hard. Being Asian rice is everything and with that being said I was disappointed that the rice wasn't really "edible". Also, I noticed that my other two friends who also ordered rice had a different portion of it. One friend had a nice scoop of it nicely on a plate, while I had mines scattered and half the size of his portion. My other friend had only more than half of my size of rice and it looked like the rice was old and leftover. They tried to trick us is into thinking all the rice was the same by not arranging it into a scoop like my one friend.   Service 6/10- We came here after an event. I felt like everyone kept giving us weird looks because we were "kids". The only guy that was nice and friendly was the one who served us our drinks. Our lady server was ok. I felt like she was annoyed and tried to rush everything. When we got our food, I asked if we could have soy sauce and she quickly left, which didn't get me the chance to ask for lemons.When she got back I asked if we could have lemons also & she asked in a very irritated voice "do you need anything else?!". I felt like she was only acting nice just to get good tip & wasn't genuinely nice or didn't really care about us at all.  Overall, I'm not really sure if I would come back... Maybe....

5GZfezPy8X5QKWIsqqj3RQ.text: I use to go to Southpoint for steggs however when my friends introduced me to this place, I always come here for steggs now!! For the price of $6, it's great because their food is pretty good and the chefs actually take into consideration on how the steak and eggs want to be cooked. I've gotten so many rare steaks and eggs from Southpoint when it wasn't even what I asked for (I always ask for medium rare and over medium) but for $5 how could I complain? Their customer service is also great! They're friendly and they always check up on tables. For a dollar more, it's definitely worth it for me!

9rBQ0_U7MmtRBSWX_TIafQ.text: Good simple food, open 24 hours, best prices in Las Vegas, lots of food at Diner prices, located inside the Tuscany casino, always packed, you can order to go if you like, quick customer service, busy and noisy, but very fulfilling food, highly recommend.

07Ci9sW66wkU7MCFsI9ZMA.text: Food is taste so good,half bbq chicken and half bbq pork.Definetely will come back more.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq chicken and beef is good. Steak is good too.

fP-WC4rnHfGud4PHcnVThw.text: $4.99 Steak & eggs between 12-5am! Comes with 2 slices of buttered toast and hash browns. Service was great and FAST which is excellent when it's 3 in the morning and you kind of just want to creep off to bed before the food coma hits you too hard.  My steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare, and was MUCH more tender than the steak over at Ellis Island. No sawing necessary.   Park to the rear of the casino building for quick and easy access.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs $4.99

JhMlvZMHslq_36X96IaWTw.text: I love finding good & cheap eats!!!   PROS: 1.) Graveyard deal: $5.99 steak & eggs! 12am-6  2.) Big portions perfect for when you have late night drunchies.  3.) They cook your steak just the way you like it & it's perfect every time!  4.) Clean & spacious!  5.) Employees are very friendly!   6.) Steak & eggs meal comes with toast that's already buttered for you!!   7.) Hashbrowns comes perfectly brown! You can ask for it to be extra crispy if you like!  CONS: 1.) The service is questionable. The first time I was here the food came really fast but the second time I was here it took a while for the food to come out.   VERDICT: -You'll definitely see me back every time I'm in Vegas for a good meal!

X1FERkVxWbQ0GczF2R5riw.text: By far exceeded our expectations.  The food comes out hot and fresh. Our server Agnes was amazing she was just perfect in addition to our breakfast.  I would definitely come back the menu selection is diverse and not to mention the prices are not bad at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Fried Stake amazing

mZtMf5MPL-F_wy9mttsWhg.text: The reviews are True, great food, great service and great price.  Had the Veggie omelette and it was one of the better omelettes I have ever had.    My service was always on the ready to fill my coffee cup and she was lightning fast.    Parking is easy making this a much better spot for breakfast then anything on the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie omelette - perfect!

bp1ZsaCRNeFXDEZ3Mwp5LQ.text: There's only reason I come here. STEGGS! I love my steak well done with over medium eggs and extra crispy hash browns with a side of wheat toast. Can't imagine a better end to a long night. Their midnight steak and egg special is just SIX DOLLARS. Like really where else can you get steak and eggs for $6?   Of all the Steggs places in Vegas, this is the only one that you don't have to be 21 to eat at yay! They don't do spilt checks though so bring cash or hope that someone you're eating with got money in the bank that you can pay back later for picking up the tab.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steggs for $6!

R70zd0ZXWEsJ_NVBNGyrdg.text: I got the spinach mushroom and feta cheese omelette and my bf got the steak and eggs special. The omelette was good but his stake was meh. The hash browns however were an easy 5 stars. Coffee was average. Overall I think the food was 3 stars.   We went for breakfast around 8:30am on a Friday morning and the noise level was ridiculous. I guess it's expected for the amount of people at the restaurant but it's a little annoying. Service was ok. Tried to get a coffee refill and I just gave up after asking a couple of people. I guess it's expected for how busy the place is. Our waitress seemed to be handling 20 tables.  Overall, this is your overage American breakfast place. Nothing exceptional. Would probably come here again if in the area BEFORE 7 am.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach mushroom and feta cheese with English muffin and has browns.
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs special

cgrHY63IFDFIQerml3n4Gw.text: Sooooooo yummy! Portions are huge, we still had leftovers enough for dinner. Mmmmmm slppp yum yum   Waldorf Salad and Tuesday special 1/2lb ribs & 1/2lb chicken with two servings of fries   Plussss complementary corn bread, so yummy too!   Always drink lemon water before meal  helps with digestion.  Ughhhh food coma cuz food is so bomb  My tummy is happy and fully satisfied. I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waldorf Salad and Tuesday special 1/2lb ribs &amp; 1/2lb chicken with 2 orders of fries

UWi_rIEnOQevbGy74UE8Ug.text: All you can eat crab legs on Fridays 4pm-10pm. Be prepared to wait 20 to 30min. Well worth the wait! Nice warm tasteful crab legs with hot butter!

XIU0shaEm58BhWrzXEoSEw.text: I was leaving Las Vegas for an early morning flight to Chicago.  I had selected Marilyn's Cafe before the start of my trip and was glad I did. They are located within the Tuscany Hotel and Casino on Flamingo Ave off the Strip.  When I arrived at 4 30 am, it was very empty.  Table seating was instant and so was the table service.  I had ordered the "Big Winner" and it called that because it is a big breakfast!  2 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage, ham steak, toast or grits AND 2 pancakes!  Just what I needed because we all know the airlines don't serve food anymore.  The price was very reasonable for the amount of food and it was NOT a late night special.  It is on their regular menu.

KypugF13DhsbV2JcnvCWXg.text: I ordered the French toast complete with a side of hashbrowns, and my husband ordered the las vegas winner with side of cornbeef hash. The food was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dY_QqoS4ooD4rKLfF16tgQ.text: Pretty decent place to go and have a late night meal...or any time meal really. Decently priced, open 24/7, average service, cozy booths and pretty damn good burgers. There menu is pretty large but I have only been twice so I haven't tried much. I will definately be back and check out more of what they have to offer. I'll keep you posted and update this review as I experience more.

Ng7q0vkQHiV7Vq4eLmBlVQ.text: All I can say is the Friday all you can eat crab legs special for $24 is a bargain. Servers started me off with 2 plates and before I could even finish one they were bringing more!! And the more they brought the portions were still the same they didn't try and reduce the amount of crab legs they brought. Crab legs were nice and meaty and you will never have to ask when are the rest coming. Whenever I'm in Vegas this will be a must stop on Friday night....though due to the popularity I'm sure in due time this price will go up and something will change. I sure hope not though....fingers crossed!!!!

N665q52IPHEPwc_GxDVsGg.text: When here for our last night in Vegas and it was a lovely dinner. 1st a wonder blond lady I believe her name was Leandra she when out of her way to help us with choices to let us change what we wanted and she never ever made us feel like we were bothering her. Food wise there meatball soup is really good and filling, the prime rib taquto we're a great appetizer, dinner wise I had there turkey pot pie which was soooo good and my hubby had the steak which he could not  put down. Next time we're here we will be back, also price was very nice. Get down here and enjoy the meal

DpuAgpE0oDJPodJYHhhaSw.text: Wasn't sure how to rate this place, but it all came down to the service and food we received.   We had an issue, where we sat. You can see the servers come in and out of the kitchen. We had a perfect shot of what was going inside the kitchen. We had noticed a couple of servers coming out to the dining area chewing on something. As it turned out, they were eating food from the kitchen! I get it, things happen in the kitchen all the time. But don't make it so obvious. At least finish chewing before coming out to serve the food.  Besides that everything else was great. I had the T bone steak, it was great! I also enjoyed the mashed potatoes and gravy that came with it. Wife had the baked lasagna. Think she enjoyed it also. Service was great, and when we will stay at Tuscany in the future. Have no problem eating there again.

ylzBizO9UREi5J6e_57kTw.text: MAJOR disappointment !!   went for the Thursday special of a half BBQ chicken and half rack of ribs w/2 sides for $10.99   price good ...food not so good...the food came out of the kitchen so fast I was dumbfounded...and that was because the chicken wasn't BBQ'd it was baked with a load of BBQ sauce poured over it...and the ribs were BRAISED and swimming in some sort of tomato sauce...chicken tasted ok...the ribs ...while the bones pulled clean the meat was really chewy...the cole slaw was a unflavorful bowl of shredded cabbage with s watery vinegar something poured over it, the baked potato while small was tasty...service was mediocre at best...restaurant was not busy yet it took well over 10 min for the waiter to appear from somewhere in back, Marylins used to be good but has definitely gone down recently along a lot of the changes in the casino and the lounge,,,plenty of more worthwhile places to frequent....sorry Tuscany...ya done me wrong

v8zSJdesOqq_HiWgbsjidw.text: Extremely good breakfast. The food was plentiful in portions. My wifes multigrain pancake was delicious, her words, and they are very reasonably priced.... Thoroughly great experience.

FDEQagscNOUGAXMxHOcXfQ.text: My husband and I used to eat here all the time, today we picked up a couple of breakfasts; he had chicken fried steak that taste like flour the gravy was not cooked correctly and the steak was mushy the eggs over easy were overcooked and I don't know what's happened to the food sizes they've gotten smaller the quality of cooks they have now or terrible.

S9wwTjbyGOx5xH9pgwpTKA.text: Well I have eaten at Marilyn's at least ten times and everything I have tried was delicious. The steak and lobster is very good for the price and the meatball soup is the best I've ever had. I love their breakfasts and most of the dinners are exceptional. The San Franciscan burger is fantastic. Chicken fried steak is amazing and so is the lasagna. As wonderful as the food is, the service is just as good.

kft_FkgeT4ke69Wh1wc-Yw.text: We had good expectations about dining here, unfortunately it was terrible. We eat out twice a day at least 5 days a week. Got the chicken cordon blue, it was average and the two sides were cold, and the portions poor. My companion ordered the pot roast, which was above average, both, the size and portion. It was tender and yet dry. Our plates were delivered close to 40 minutes after we ordered and a bread basket close to finishing our meals. The worst service in all Las Vegas area. Server was not interested in providing a good meal experience. Bad waiter. We are not coming here ever again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6H6EYQZ9zbHQ5SL2h9WmkA.text: This place is so good! It's super low key, the prices are awesome, and the food was delicious!

SPa-Npk4HIO1JfT-GjOH2g.text: Food was cold. Biscuits and gravy was bland. Ask for poached eggs runny and the yolk was hard. Go to Ellis Island if u want a cheap good breakfast

_mXZ88mYlHVEyb1FnohobA.text: Do not go to this cafe!!!! A group of friends and I went to this place after a concert and were seated very quickly. It was late at night so the cafe was empty. We sat for 30 minutes before we decided to get up and find a member of staff so we could get started on a round of waters. Finally after 45 minutes we got our waters. Our server hadn't come to our table until after over an hour. We put our order in and waited another hour before we decided to find management and ask about service. Working in the service industry myself, I understand some times service can be slow, but never had I been somewhere with such lack of communication where it takes nearly an hour to be greeted and receive water. I had the unfortunate pleasure of speaking with Ann-Marie (I think that was her name) who was the manager on duty. She was very rude and simply did not see the problem with how slow our service was. As we were speaking about the slow service our food came to the table (almost 2 hours after we placed the order) and she said to me "your food just came out, we will talk about this when you finish eating. I don't want you to complain about something else like the food being cold." In utter shock I walked away to at least enjoy my food. Which was fine. Food was cooked how I liked. My friend's steak was undercooked but no use in sending it back to wait longer. After we finish eating, I return to talk to Ms. Ann Marie and was greeted with attitude. I have never dealt with anybody this blatantly rude, let alone a manager to its customers. Dissatisfied with service, I had a problem paying full price for my meal. I verbalized that to the manager and she immediately called security to kick us out because we "refused to pay". Which was not the case. She caused a huge scene and embarrassed me and my friends in front of the Casino. We went to security to file a statement. I have never ever received such terrible service. I will never go to this cafe again. Terribly slow service and terrible management to match. Very bad customer service.

HxPxmrdKjvspKwGvXcnOiw.text: Fantastic little place! Food came out quickly and correctly, was delicious, and did not cost too much. Definitely worth it!

0u1MGmf5-faXyAomUjtfLw.text: A bit of a walk off strip but good value and way less than right on strip. Get a membership card at the casino to take advantage of s 10% coupon

ZUoL_CyZ4QW4NEK4lIzbqw.text: The all you can eat crab legs are a hit ! There steak and eggs are a bargain and their Pizza is delicious !!!! T bone steak was huge and well worth it ! These prices remind me of old Vegas !! Great spot and the casino is nice !

_U15c-oaF30tNLSfWQ_iqA.text: Ordered the steak & eggs and it was delicious. My eggs were scrambled as requested. Toast was yum, hash browns were yummy and my steak was cooked how I like it. My server was very attentive and stopped by often to check on me. The food came out pretty quick, no complaints with anything. I'll definitely be back. And paid less than $15.

if9rsL3Pdxi-c2X60MXktA.text: STEAK & EGGS ($5) is the reason why I come here after the club in Vegas. So cheap and so good! $5 gets you a steak, eggs, hash browns, and buttered toast. I get my side of rice of course to eat with my eggs. The perfect meal to end a night.  I honesty don't even know where this place is even located in Vegas, I just get in the cab and tell the driver Tuscany steak and eggs haha. The $5 deal I believe is late night only.  This place can be filled with lots of drunk people in the early morning but that's okay - the food is what matters :)

vKsRmmha-veNxUwbATMBdw.text: Good food for a late night stop. Friendly staff needs better coffe it tasted old but i did go their late so i guess i had it coming. All in all nice place.

vSd6hN8-8aExDWi4-FtXRQ.text: Decided to give this place a try on Friday for the crab legs and we arrived a little after 5pm. I noticed the dining area seemed full but not overly crowed and I was pleasantly surprised there was no line like we usually find on crab leg night at other places we've gone to.  We were seated right away and greeted by our waiter. We both order the crab legs with 2 sides I had the loaded baked potato and corn, my boyfriend chose the baked cinnamon apples and broccoli. He loved the baked cinnamon apples says they were cooked perfectly. The baked potato was a decent medium size and came with cheddar cheese, a strip of bacon, butter and sour cream and the corn came in a small sized bowl but filled. I thought the baked potato could have been hotter. They brought us each our own plate of crab legs and the plate of crab legs were a decent size but they didn't come out hot they were room temp and seemed a little soggy my boyfriend didn't agree he said his were fine, they were still good tho.   I liked the touch of the tea light candle to keep your butter warm. They brought us each a second plate of crab legs before I could finish the first plate. I thought the second plate of crab legs was perfect they were warm and not at all soggy. The portion of the crab legs they bring to you is just right at least for us we were to full to get a third plate.   I like the convenience of them bringing the crab legs to you and not having to get up to get more crab legs. Overall pretty good and I think from now on this is the go to spot for crab legs.

coyfZTLprn-Ci9GzWy5NDQ.text: Let me start by saying "I Love sea food". So when my husband takes me to an all you can eat crab legs im in heaven.   The restaurant was very clean and it was nice, Tuscany Casino is a small casino compared to what you expect to see near the strip. I wasn't sure on what to expect, but i was very pleased. If you order all you can eat crab legs and you want bread, you need to ask. They will only bring you bread when you ask.  The crab legs where delicios and warm/hot, which i love. You get to pick 2 sides. I got green beans and mash potatoes, both were great.   I'm giving them 4 stars because it took them a little while to bring more crab legs and also for soda refills.
