The waiter was really nice, I could tell that she got very busy and she was going back between tables. It's fine with me, i worked at a restaurant before and i understant how that can be. Over all great experience and the price is only $19.99 per person. *plus drinks

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So ready for all you can eat crab legs, only Fridays from 4pm-10pm
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They only serve bread when you ask for it (it&#39;

5yzGT4EGCYVHZfN3SeLKNg.text: Cheap breakfast place, it's inside to Tuscany so don't think it's a diner by itself. Self-parking is plentiful, great location since it's a very short drive from the other big hotels on the strip.   Everything here is fantastic, I don't know how people had a bad experience. No problems with my breakfast combo, and my friends enjoyed their meal too. Pancakes are perfectly golden brown and fluffy, eggs made as ordered... bacon even made extra cripsy when requested. There is really is nothing to complain about: inexpensive pricing, service friendly and attentive with clean tables!  Just love places in Vegas that don't shaft you just because they can. Like when you go to a theme park and they say, fork you! we have you trapped pay $6 for this small bottle of water! Thank you Marilyn's Cafe, keeping this place in mind whenever I'm in this area of Vegas for breakfast.

GuLIKT9n-FB6uIuUDHqLYg.text: This place is the $hit!!!!!!!!!!!!! I honestly can not give this place enough stars. We came here as a second option and boy howdy I am glad we came. Service was friendly and quick. Food was PERFECT. Pancakes were so dang good. The price, my god the price. I have 4 kids who all eat like little monsters so finding cheap meals has become an art form in our house. This place has the BEST FOOD and for the price the food just taste even that much better. Here is a comparison. My wife and I got a 1 breakfast plate(big portions), FOREVER pancakes(all you can eat), tea, and a coffee for less than 2 large cups of coffee and a breakfast pastry at Starbucks. The night before, yes we went there multiple times, got a breakfast bowl and my god it was so delicious. I pushed my stomach beyond what any human should ever do but it was so DAM good!!!!!! This will forever be a must for us if we come back to Vegas. It may be the reason we do come back.

OdWE1nSeQUh45v5fdVTzrg.text: I'll start with the food. I had the supreme omelette which was good and very large. Coffee was also surprisingly good. So overall, for the quality and the price it's not a bad choice.   Now for my experience with the staff. My waitress was great! Very attentive and friendly. However, my experience with the manager on duty did not make a good impression. I was waiting to be seated and a waiter walks up to the hostess and asks her a question in Spanish. So the hostess responds to him in Spanish then the manager walks up. She then proceeds to say "English only please". I can't understand what it matters. As I get seated I then hear the manager continue telling the waiter now, "if your customer speaks Spanish that's fine, other than that I want everyone to speak English". First of all, this is Vegas, I hear tons of different languages here a few it's awesome to have so many people from all over the world descend here for work and pleasure, a True melting pot and that's part of what makes Vegas so much fun. Second, I wasn't being responded to in Spanish, my entire conversation with the hostess was in English so she was speaking English, the manager just butted her way in on a conversation and made assumptions. I don't understand why a private conversation can't take place between two co workers in a language that they want. I don't need to know what they're talking about and I doubt that they're trying to hide what they're saying from guests, a ton of people speak Spanish. Lastly, what if I was a fair skinned Spanish speaker and I initiated a conversation with the hostess before she arrived? Isn't that kind of dumb to make an assertion that I speak English? I really didn't appreciate how she spoke to the hard working staff.   So for that reason, unfortunately 3 stars.

ipNdV-wSr0KVwyIGcr2I5Q.text: Prime rib delicious. Yummy me and my hubby loves it juicy don't like it any where else the employees are so nice and very helpful.

QCP8vVuwiOdfsI9czD85qg.text: Took my girlfriends here for one of their birthday's. We went early in the morning for breakfast and I must say the breakfast was wonderful. Now I do have one complaint the mimosa's were ok not very good. I usually order a lemon drop martini and they are bomb. But I ordered breakfast and it was sooo goo, french fries were awesome as well. Pancakes were fluffy and good. NO COMPLAINTS JUST GOOD

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another view of the birthday platter !
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was the birthday girls platter!!
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was my breakfast skillet,very similar to a meat lovers it came with 2 fluffy pancakes and hash browns very good.

62spcGYexLRiS38OqULPow.text: I came here a number of times while staying at the Tuscany. The service was soooo slow each and every time.  One day, I sat down for breakfast at 8:35 and was almost late to a 9:30 appointment next door because of the slow service. The next night, my friend ordered a salad while I ordered the pizza. I understand how one would take longer to make than the other, but it would be common courtesy to bring them out around the same time. Instead, they brought my friend's salad, and then brought my pizza over 20 minutes later. I sat there starving while she finished her whole salad. And then it took them another 10 minutes to bring the chili flakes and ranch to go with the pizza. By the time I got the condiments, the pizza was cold. And then the next morning, it took them almost a half hour to scramble two eggs. Two eggs!  The food itself is hit or miss. The pizza was good, even though it was cold before I got to enjoy it with the condiments. But I got the mac and cheese one time, and it was lame. It was like saucy noodles with shredded cheese on top. Needed more salt. This should not pass as "mac and cheese." The eggs benedict was okay. I'll give them points for being very generous with the hollandaise, though it had a slightly odd taste to it. It didn't taste like classic hollandaise.

uAy95tQzdkCxyka5lZmmoA.text: Great restaurant off the strip. The prices are low and they have a good selection of items to order. The staff was friendly and attentive. We ordered the steak and eggs, and the chicken parmigiana. The steak was surprisingly juicy and tender. The chicken parm was huge and very cheesy.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nuNzpmyU872r_2uiXdFwDQ.text: Great food and service. Every time we stay at Tuscany we always eat here!! This time around we were served by Julian and he was amazing! Him and the staff were amazing. REALLY bummed to hear the philly fries are gone so I hope they bring them back!

61bdKCZXdEfWXmf--BAhUw.text: If you're looking to save some Money in breakfast, brunch or lunch, this could be you kind of place. Good service, fair amount of food for the dollar, but quality wise, not as much, but who cares, right?! If you are in Las Vegas, close to the strip, os valid!

pd1rmGzvd2Skr00x9oH3rg.text: Located in Tuscany Suites Hotel a little off the strip. Marilyn's Cafe was a good dining experience for me. For late nice and/or early morning breakfast food,  I like to go to Ellis Island for their steak and eggs etc.   Marilyn's impressed me however. The menu options are just as good as Ellis island, prices hovering around $9! Tried this spot cause it was new to me. My family enjoyed their steak and eggs and other breakfast options as well.   For this visit, I decided on the "Las Vegas winner" breakfast. With was 3 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage, 2 pancakes and hash browns. Perfect combo and totally worth it for $10! Good portions here, and good service. Definitely would come back and eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Las Vegas Winner&#34;: 3 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage, hash browns and also 2 pancakes! ( ^_^)b
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes! ( ^_^)b
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10/28/17

FUebq1foQ8jc2h-e-e85yw.text: Two blocks off the strip tucked away in the Tuscany Resort and Casino.  The prices of everything is mostly under $10 and the food is excellent.  Wide variety from steaks to eggs to sandwiches to salads.    We had a great visit. Our server, Jose, was friendly and was always present when we needed anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N6FKHmiaIEjNdzhLE-3K4g.text: Good food with interesting service.  Must wait behind a barricade  to be seated.  Appeared to be some type of seating priority/discussion from hostess desk & serving staff. Restaurant was basically empty @ 7am.  Seated in a very peculiar  place. This am breakfast server was in a meeting so we needed to alert front hostess desk for the need of a server.  We were on our way to the airport!   One person started our order & then assigned served appeared. Good breakfast but could have been much better on coordination of staffing.

F9w9D9pTGV8oVOATrCm0AA.text: Great food at good prices. Very attentive staff, we came here twice for breakfast and once for a late night meal. The menu is clearly marked gluten free which is a big deal for us since my wife has an allergy. Plenty of GF options and friendly staff that are great with kids

DEB4GTP_rUlHtoxceq5O6Q.text: Disgusting! I've been here a few times, but this time they really grossed me out. We walked in for their famous steak and eggs late night dinner, and we were barely greeted. The place smelled like vomit and bleach. Service was extremely slow and the waiter was rude. He simply said "what are you ordering?" in a very blunt manner..We ordered and waited over 20mins for our sodas, after another 15mins of waiting for food, we got so disgusted with the smell and the ridiculous wait time, paid for our sodas and left. Overall this place is unclean. It's almost the same poor service for their crab legs day on Fridays. Save yourself the disgust, there's better diners in vegas.

Wpi40uAxb0Bk0q3HVhFwVA.text: Fantastic service and very, very clean!  Food was fantastic!  The French toast was to die for and the portions were huge!

WEapn48oFmWmjz2TLPu6Ng.text: Was my favorite place for five years till The guy that used to run it left now prices have too not happy

qvrHROZgqvSltCZ3-KftPA.text: This cafe is the gem of Tuscany suites and casino. First of all, I love staying at Tuscany because it is super close to the strip, very cheap compared to the hotels on the strip, & extremely spacious!! So much room to fit huge parties. And of course it has Marilyn's cafe. I'm pretty sure this place is open 24/7. They are known for their steak and eggs and it is under $10 I think! So cheap!!! It comes with some toast and hash browns as well! Pretty delicious, I mean of course it isn't some fancy steak but it definitely does the job for your late night hunger after the club!  I usually always order the steak and eggs but today I decided to try something else. They have a pretty large variety of items including breakfast and I was definitely in the breakfast mood so I decided to get a vegetarian omelette, a blueberry pancake, and a banana pancake. Yes, I definitely ordered with my eyes.  The wait was kind of long for the food.... but once it came I legit vacuumed my food up!!! Everything was delicious! Our server was also very friendly and delivered excellent customer service.  I would recommend the steak and eggs for sure and after what I tried today, I'm sure there are other great items too!

GVSbUb-48q4seQ48KggvEA.text: My son and I came for brunch, the service was prompted and friendly.   The food was hot and very good.  The amount of food is very large portions.  I had the big winner I think it's called,  needless to say I couldn't finish even half of it. My son had the steak and eggs and it was cooked perfectly for him.  The prices are great,  the atmosphere is new and clean. I would highly recommend you come very hungry,  you won't he hungry when you leave.

ehpgXJYIWJCPFaIpOqkqZw.text: The sausage omelet was recommended by the waiter and he was correct, very tasty. The staff was friendly and very helpful. My husband had the veggie omelet and thought it was also good. The price of the meal was reasonable,highly recommend for a good breakfast.

c3lZXy-opcn55Ic3AlQu0A.text: This was definitely an unexpected gem to find in the hotel we were staying at. It was so great, that we ate here twice within a long weekend. Their menu is ginormous and you can find something on the menu for even the pickiest eaters. The service is pretty quick, as expected since it is within the casino walls so people either have somewhere to be or they want to get back to gambling. You can come here for breakfast, lunch, dinner, desert, or even a snack or drink. They have it all!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosas

g14VXS_EDIqNSyfAaO0_IQ.text: Omg eBay a horrible experience.  It took 45 minutes for my fried chicken. The chicken was dry. No gravy was served and flavorless corn. Ugh. Nasty !!!

v0xjAGRo0ad92a7pDij9ZQ.text: We came for the all you can eat crab, so as you can expect it was super busy. We were told Our wait would be 30 minutes to an hour, which we waited the full hour. The cafe is located Inside a casino so you can also expect it to be loud and Smokey. The AYCE crab came with two sides I got the garlic green beans Which were ok, they were canned green beans with a tiny bit of garlic and slivered almonds, and a sweet potato which was served in half with a side of butter and brown sugar. The crab legs were little, like baby claw little served with warm butter over a tea candle. Wait times in between servings were about 20 minutes long.   As far as the service goes, I'll say the server assistant was more of assistance than our actual server was. She got our drinks, placed our ordered, got us refills on both drinks and crab and after we asked our server for the tab and he never returned, the "assistant" was ever so kind to bring us the bill!   Is this place on my destination for awesome food list? Not so much!  Would I come here again? On someone else's account.

w0e43IN3O3PyMyomx1CGrQ.text: Consistently superb food. This is a top cafe and a must for tourists.  My favorites from here is the thanksgiving meal and the pizza pie.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty tasty shrimp plate.

FVDv0_4KMTxMRuoviVXw9A.text: You get what you pay for, so when you get the munchies after a long night this is the place to be. Not too fancy but the service is great once you get seated and the food didn't take too long to come out either.   The restaurant is known for their steak and eggs special which at least one party of our group got. I like to explore the menu and last time I got a club sandwich and frie, tasted average and nothing special. This time I decided to be a little "healthy" and get the spinach, mushroom omelette with feta cheese. It was cooked perfectly and I love the taste the feta brings because it elevates the dish. But the all time winner is the sourdough toast.. its the perfect toast... It's warm, crunchy, and you can always always taste the butter..mmm mmm mmm, slap on strawberry jam and you won't be able to stop eating... I had no guilt what so ever eating those carbs, well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom spinach omelette with feta cheese and hash browns.. peep the toast, yum!

yMgx6JaJryAK1q0eT7ToMw.text: Marilyn's Cafe is located inside the Tuscany Hotel & Casino.  The restaurant is 24 hours and they're known for having the best deals, especially for their crab legs.  I recently stopped here because I has starving and behind on my calories.  A little over $20 can get you a lot of food at Marilyn's Cafe.  I got the New York Steak & Eggs, Marilyn's Starter (2 eggs, 2 sausage links, 2 strips of bacon, and 2 pancakes), and a cup of Marilyn's chili.  I debated on getting a burger in addition to my meal, but felt that maybe I'm over doing it with the calories.  The bacon was the highlight and the chili was good too.  As for the steak, I guess this is where I state "you get what you pay for".  Overall, I didn't find anything special about Marilyn's Cafe.  The restaurant is just A-Okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mel C was here!
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cup of Chili
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hamburger Patty

T7AxXHtMcT6QoPEuf1Ruug.text: I went with my niece & her friends, they wanted the all you can eat crab legs for 16 dollars. I like crab, but I don't LOVE it so I opted for the fried chickend, brocoli & mashed potatos. The mashed potatos were soooooooooooooo good! Everything else was ok. Now our waiter, Victor...was thee worst. I think he was having a bad day to begin with because when we got there he was having trouble with the previous table. Red flag #1 He was very quick with us, rude, impatient. I asked him if I could have the basket of bread that comes with my meal...he proceeded to tell me that I could not have it unless I requested it... Ummm sir that is why I am requesting it :) Some people at our table wanted to swap out their rice for something else because they didn't like it, he told us he was going to get in trouble with the chefs...etc.... And he also brought out an extra plate of crab legs and by the time they were ready to be eaten they were cold sooo unfortunately no one wanted them...he was really mad about that. I stayed as polite as I knew how to be before I went to management and let them know what was going on. I woould maybe go back to try something else, but I WILL NOT sit in Victors section #NOMAAM

rf5PXL84NOXF_ovrdE_abw.text: Great place to come after a night of clubbing. Cheap food, the quality is just OK. Last time I went, service took forever. I mean ridiculously forever. Our waitress kept on apologizing for the wait. i think shes new or just overwhelmed. They usually have their steak and eggs special, which is by far a popular dish amongst my friends. Biscuits and gravy is pretty good too.

Dxsy5FCf-LCLxEZUeqAU6Q.text: it's all about the graveyard special.  $3.99 steak and eggs!!  The steak is actually alright and the service is good.  Drunk people everywhere would like it because it's cheap and its fast.

JuEtQ78tNmwGlTud-LpHLw.text: Originally came to the Casino, and stayed to have late dinner.  Pleasant surprise.  Now, I go for the food, majority of the time its early Saturday breakfast or Thursday late evening dinner.  This place is open 24 hours.  Ample food for the price. If you gamble, you can use your Tuscany Players Club card and use your points for payment.

qq6UohwBvsGxVc_VM71zvw.text: open 24 hours, the have a great selection of food, and the servers were all so nice, They have a burger and drys special for $5.99 its WAY WORTH IT.

MyOvd2vf1-uLyUzfVnqurQ.text: Really solid spot. Pancakes were to die for. Skip the biscuits and gravy. Can't comment on the lunch menu, but for a cheap breakfast or brunch ($8-10), you can't go wrong!

Px2arXFsRASZXOMEsLnDTw.text: The crab legs for 12.99 along with two sides on Friday are delish.. also the 16 oz steak is great. fast service and the food is so well prepared for the price.

qrReTycwT73tfIpIfdtlIg.text: Service: SLOW! Our waitor was SLOW! Big Turn OFF!  It was like as if I were watching a slow motion video. SLOOOOOOOOOOWWWWW MOOOOOOOOOTIIIIIIIIIIOOOOOOOOONNNNNNNNNNNN FOR YOOOOOOOOOOOUUUUUUUUU!  My chinese chicken salad was mediocre, but I heard the steak was pretty good.  Restaurant is clean and spacious.  Heard about the $3.99 steak and eggs after midnight so that's pretty awesome.    Service is very important at a restaurant.  Bad service makes me not enjoy my food as much so 2 stars and that 2 stars is me being generous.   I can't even think of anything else to say because I was so distracted by the service. SLOoooooooW!

NAePoXibmpBmq96CfyiBUg.text: I change mind, this place is the BOMB BAY! The steak special is cheap and delicious!

AvzY2KM1gwKP-_1_2Sba8g.text: The wife and I both had the $6.99 steak, eggs, pancake special that offer from 6am - 11am M-F.  Tasty all around.  We were glad we walked down from the Westin.  Christina, our server, was very nice and attentive--5 stars for her.  Everything was great, but the hash browns really stood out.  Would go back again without hesitation for a hearty breakfast!

M-hOdRXetowu42M8fRmnJg.text: Not great but not bad at all I actually think they deserve 3.5 stars but thats not an option here on Yelp. The prices were decent the food was pretty good but the service was sort of slow. I think this is a good place to go if you're with a group of people because they had a very large selection and the prices were reasonable. Oh and I must mention that they have Sweet Potato Fries.... yum!

TV9z4RybEHGHlwyf4gmNkA.text: Went for dinner. Good honest food. Great prices and service. Casino also has good low bet tables for those of us that dont wont to gamble away heaps!

MHwrquByYmtXn9KdFkE8yw.text: what can you say about this place besides the $3.99 steak and eggs.  It used to be $2.99 but i guess you can blame gas prices.  Its a really good meal after a night of partying at the clubs and strip joints.  i always end up getting two orders and always hits the spot plus the service is always good.

AHh_cSg-LYDz15yJ_rIMwA.text: We read the reviews and thought we would try it.  The wait staff was super friendly and efficient.  They have a Sunday night special, Tbone for 9.99.  They rolls and cornbread is awesome.  We will definitely go back.  The casino was not that smoky.  That is an added bonus.

63Suxc0sulyfqmd-4C1XLQ.text: woohoo! late night steak and eggs!  4 stars just for that!  ever since the one at gold coast turned into a TGIFriday, i have been looking for a late night steak and eggs.  victory!

zfd8cu1ZzRR8GlVOmB6RWw.text: Didn't go on crab night. Had some of the best food our entire trip here. Dessert was the only thing a little on the basic/mediocre side. Prime rib was amazing and so was the liver & onions! Try their homemade potato chips! YUM

QhOEn8pZX_NziXMlTxAZMw.text: service was pretty shitty here. besides "hair" as i liked to call him, the servers would consistently mess up our orders, give us corn (why??) instead of the actual veggie sides we'd order and didnt know about any drinks they make. anyway, the chicken fingers and taquitos are good for appetizers. the cajun shrimp pasta is fantastic. the fish they had was nasty and tasted dirty. but the breakfasts! deleecious!

Y2lHYw3Miou7i441EvCSTQ.text: From my friends who went tonight - me and my folks went to Marilyn's Cafe in the Tuscany for all you can eat crab legs like we have done lots of times. This time we had a terribly embarrassing experience. After we finished eating, and while we were collecting cash from everyone(they don't split checks), security was sent by our table and asked if we were enjoying our meal. First off, all the food was gone and table was cleaned. So we thought that was weird. We paid our bill ($256.xx) and proceeded to leave, when Daniel the manager and security stopped my husband and my sis-n-laws and asked who was going to pay the bill?!! When my husband said the bill is paid, he told him "I don't think it is?" And proceeded to say my husband fit the description of someone who walked out on the bill. He then lied and said that security must of seen something on surveillance that made them come over. We later found out from the security manager that Daniel called security before we were even done with our meal! When confronted, Daniel was very condescending and rude and just kept saying "I'm sorry you feel that way." Anyway, we got our money back and won't be going back there. It's so sad that even though every person at that table works hard and honest everyday, we would be considered criminals based on the color of our skin. #RACISMSUCKS

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What will be done to address this
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Racist staff, racial profiling and injustice

iQZb_3sSNmarK-rGGtyOqw.text: Any time I can get steak and eggs for under $10 and the place doesn't make me worried I am going to acquire a food borne illness, I count myself a winner. That's what I got at Tuscany.   Good and cheap food, friendly and quick service. Can't really bring myself to give more stars since nothing is all that impressive. It's just pretty much what you would expect and hope for given the price. I would certainly recommend the 10 minute walk off the strip for a bite to eat here if you are on a budget and want decent food at reasonable prices.

WZIPvDsEE1ZqzgU-SxTrpg.text: Came here while waiting for the Rat Pack show. Ordered the pork chops,mac n cheese and mashed taters. Let me tell you that this was a wholesome homecooked style meal. So flavorful and filling. Loved everything about my meal.service was a bit slow...but all in all a great meal.

Fxx5f5T8mRmInOh3xM9jhA.text: After a successful night of clubbing in early October, my friend said he was going to The Tuscany to get $4.99 steak and eggs and offered to bring some back for me. I'd never heard of such a thing and was skeptical about how good a $5 steak would be. I also don't like eating late at night but he told me I'd regret it if I didn't.  I was starving by the time he got back since I stayed up waiting for him to return. My take-out box had steak, eggs, hashbrowns, and toast. The steak, to be honest, was barely edible and had a ton of fat. Another friend, who was also starving, thought it was delicious and ate most of it. The eggs were scrambled, pretty bland, and could've used some salt. So... why 4 stars?  The Loaded Hashbrowns -- it's $1 more to get them loaded, but do it anyway (uh, it's only a $1). I can promise you you won't regret it, because it's the most delightfully delicious concoction of hashbrowns, gravy, cheese, and only God knows what else (crack?); especially when you're starving at 4 AM. I'd pay $5.99 just for these hashbrowns alone.  So, go. Marilyn's steak obviously won't be the best you've ever had, but for $5, who's complaining?

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $5.99 steak, eggs, toast, and loaded hashbrowns

QPcTQRaPfO0ULFC9Nd3-Cg.text: Stayed at the Tuscany and we walked to this cafe. We got to know about this "secret deal" on Yelp. Thank you thank youuuu!!! $4.99 for steak and eggs! It's not on the menu so we had to ask anyways JUST IN CASE! lol. Yes, it's LEGIT! Special price after midnight to 5am.   The steak is thin, tender, tasty and just right. Had a couple OPTIONS for bread!! As if it's not cheap enough. I had the RYE and husband went for wheat. Medium done. Came with shredded hash browns. I ordered hot chocolate as well.  Overall a great place for cheap and good supper!

HRedu63S2zLssr2aauFGKQ.text: First time I came here for $5 steak and eggs it was bomb.  2nd time it was good, but the first time was better.   $5 steak and eggs though.  Eggs, steak, buttery toast, hash browns, 67 sauce.   Vegas: Drink, party, clubs...4 AM....Steak and eggs.

xRsif922pbCXrZRp7HTydg.text: Steggs - steak and eggs.  After a long night of clubbing and shenanigans in Vegas, stop by Marilyn's and have their $5 steak and eggs special. You get steak and eggs prepared the way you want them, hash browns (order them extra crispy!), and toast. Very delicious, filling, and cheap - just the way I like it!

8-2ozNWxyHTpBJBn4jzvDw.text: Great food. Great service. Great prices. Clean restaurant. It is located inside the Tuscany hotel and casino. It was crowded and the staff was still attentive. They have daily specials and you can order breakfast for dinner or dinner for lunch or a late brunch, whatever!  We didn't stay here but am glad we came across this cafe.

IG-CnGaYukviHgHNEvVnaw.text: Busy - reasonable prices with good food and nice sized portions. Service is non-existent. Two stars

H-t6PmUnHipd6GzD26NibA.text: The service was terrible beyond our servers control. Quite frankly seemed like a shortness of staff and poor management. Environment was dirty and not welcoming. Even if you're looking for a cheap breakfast in Vegas it's not worth it. My friends whole meal was cold along with 80%of mine. I was hung over and my pancakes still wort worth eating.

dtMc7YxFlkcNc82fy-CZSw.text: I'm a Fan!!  The first morning that we were in LV, we came in for Breakfast. I had the 8oz steak and sunnyside Eggs with hashbrowns. It was DELICIOUS!! The service was friendly, and quick.   We came on Friday 8/15 for the AYCE Crab Legs. The wait was about 30-45 minutes (which was not a problem being a Friday night in Vegas), and there is so much commotion and noise (OH, but SO worth it for $19.99).   **** Can I suggest a quick weekly STAFF MEETING to organize the chaos to be expected on a Friday night AYCE Crab legs meal??  It really was sheer chaos. We had several different waiters take our order, bring our order, refill our cups, etc.. I was confused on who the hell to tip @ the end of the night so We ended up leaving the $$ on the table, and let them fend for themselves.    Upon my next return to LV, I will be visiting Marilyn's again

XJK2qpJf6XvK4fouQ9Gtrw.text: On my last day at Vegas I wanted to eat somewhere affordable. I found Marilyn's at the Tuscany and I can't believe how amazing the food is. Their steak and eggs are great and my kids loved the pancakes. Even my wife left vegas happy because of her breakfast there. Thank you Marilyn's and staff we will be visiting the next time we're in

7ThgXqgFX7BWVixLn_xUXA.text: One of the best bargains we have found in Vegas.  Good quality food at a reasonable price.  We ate here twice during our recent stay, for dinner and lunch, on 03/11/18 and 03/13/2018.  Stand-outs were the prime rib, shrimp cocktail, and meatloaf.  Our waitress Wendy was great.

fs_3SdWq3T-ZZ45894gKKw.text: Loved the customer service.. on Friday they have all you can eat crab legs and omg soooooo delicious! Must have. My mom had club sandwich and really enjoyed it. I had the Cajun style Alfredo and I wouldn't order it again :/ it was really sweet and had some weird kick in the end but wasn't worth it. The Fries were really good and the cornbread/rolls were yummy. I suggest this place it's cheap and pretty yummy.

vQaDLKmGhGb2ZHyBk6b4Qg.text: Good stuff. The prime rib special was great. The 10 oz portion has to have been at least 14 oz. I left stuffed and happy.

dVnp_27gwkv-hbCDv6BooQ.text: Went here to try their Wednesday special , Very friendly stuffs here but the food just average.

Xah23iueOZn1ciBfCsuHdA.text: Just a few blocks away from the strip and a whole lot cheaper! We came here to have breakfast with my mom. It had great reviews and close to her place. I wouldn't say that this place was out of the world but it hit the spot and was on budget. Our table was full of plates of food. The hot cocoa and pancakes tasted great. Waiter was efficient but didn't come around all too often.   Lots of locals which is always nice to get away from tourist. Parking lot is fairly empty late morning and just a short walk to Marilyn's when in the casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Feast

2pv1MA_izfmlq9Ip_IJ43w.text: I think some previous reviewers of the Friday Night Crab Leg Special must be deaf. If not, they will be if they continue to visit here. Wow, so loud we could not hold a conversation at our table. Crab legs were so-so. Decent portions, but the legs themselves were smallish. Service was spotty. They were busy, so I'll cut a little slack. Overall, I'll be looking for a different crab leg spot.....

jDpSb1sebPO6pAxupLWHOA.text: Graveyard special. Hash browns, steak and eggs all really good. Was at south point and their deal was 4.99. This was 5.99 and was a lot better quality of steak. Just have to try.

PsVYpdBUHbdCZBNrwRyXug.text: This place has good, no nonsense food.  The price is amazing.  In fact, the quality is on the upper end of food I've had in Vegas.  I will definitely be back if I'm even in Vegas again.  I had the turkey pot pie, and it was awesome.  I picked up the tab for my partner in crime, and it was lower by half what my next lowest dining bill was on this trip, just for me.

-5v7lkvXYE6aeX7SP6NO-A.text: This place is a reminder of what Vegas used to be. Great food, good prices, great service, 24/7. Friday crab night is always a great deal and Cassandra is awesome.

dkKu7ntl_zDMRavuCq5loA.text: At a very expensive city, there is this place that has a very affordable menu items. Their service is super great, fast and accommodating. Staff is friendly and will assist how ever possible with no questions asked. Ordered their steak and eggs and it was hecka cheap for a piece of steak ($13). Also had their specialty cheesecake and that too was super yummy. Although you'd have to really make your way just to get here, it's definitely worth it. You will not find anything else like this in vegas. So it's a must try.

WK-3ffVwAOC9_q_XQUlrEg.text: Located inside Tuscany Hotel and Casino off the main strip, this place is a great place to get breakfast especially their $8.99 steak and eggs combo made to order. It comes with shredded potatoes hashbrowns and your choice of toast or pan cakes. The food was excellent and the servers were nice. Highly recommended.

lEPhVr_m73dSoyLdTJEtyQ.text: To be honest I have never actually seen their full menu and I've probably only ordered only their steak and eggs BUT They've got the best deals for steak and eggs near the strip!! Definitely one of my go-to places for a late night meal or drunchies (haha).   Their steak and eggs come with 2 eggs (sunny, scrambled, over easy, over hard), 2 slices of toast (sour dough, wheat, white, rye), and hash browns! I typically end up leaving more than half the hash browns just cause it's just THAT much food!   Service is definitely a bit slow in that time of night, so please bear with the wait times if you have a big party.   Located towards the back of the hotel, make sure your uber/lyft/cab drops you off at the 2nd entrance (not towards koval).

X_f8cDTjJZN8WgayrAdABA.text: Wonderful service and large selection of food options. Starting with the delicious coffee, everything was good with very reasonable prices.

tpK3hYggxwJsgJVF_gVsYw.text: This is the best kept secret going. Their appetizers were meal size portions, then came the main course, there is no way to eat all of this food. Here is the kicker, you know how you go to some restaurants that serve hefty portions but the food is bland; not here, their food is excellent, the staff friendly, and their hospitality was out of this world. We will come here every time we visit Vegas.  McGill

fchNyjhx1KsuBuN-oSINcw.text: We wanted a reasonably priced breakfast so we came on over. Price wise, couldn't be happier. Service was marginal though. We ordered 2 appetizers, only got one. Ordered pancakes and they weren't completely cooked. Waiter and manager sided with the chef saying they were cooked but obviously they weren't or they wouldn't have been spit out and inedible. We were offered a one dollar discount. So overall the experience was lackluster; probably won't be returning.

kiujhVOf8bCRqFncRbLVMA.text: We came here for steaks and prime rib dinner. Service was great however you have to be patient to eat here because they are always busy. Getting seated is not a problem...it's getting the food is a little wait. Which is normal when you come with a big party. I love the service we got from our waiter and busser...I wished I could've got my waiters name but I didn't catch it.   What I don't like is having to pay up front at the cashier. I think it is inconvenient. I did go and tried to pay for our dinner but I did not like how I had to wait there without be acknowledged by Sonia (the cashier...and could be the manager. I was standing there for a while...she could've at least say she will be right with me or one moment please. We sat all the way at the back so...I did walk up front and forgot to bring my ID because I'm paying with my debit/credit card. I was already annoyed by Sonia so I told her that I'm already having to come up and pay for my bill...now I have to go back and get my ID plus come back up. I took my card from her and went back. I asked our busser named Enrique which was nice of him if he can take my bill up front. He helped me out with no complaint.   Good service comes a long way and I appreciate good service! I gave our busser and waiter a good tip because they deserved it!
