c0ZzkUfdjk2QuG_fIx6BJg.text: Very very good food and service just off the strip  Nice surrounds too  Large breakfast portions  Staff were amazing and super friendly  I'll be back

Y05pUiNhn3Wzlq56gQ9jaQ.text: Did you even go to vegas if you didn't get $5.99 STEAK AND EGGS?? Now you're thinking the steak has to be low quality, right? NAH, THE STEAK IS SO TENDER AND PERFECT BRUHH.. It even comes with hash potatoes and your choice between toast (Either wheat, white, or sourdough), or pancakes! I didn't really like the pancakes as it tasted a bit like rubber, so I go with toast now. It comes with butter and jelly but I also like to eat it with my over easy eggs.  They have plenty of different condiments available but I stick with A1 and tobasco yummy !!  The texture of the steak is always consistent every time I come back too!   My friend wanted to try something new and got the baby back ribs for only $14 and got the side of salad and mac& cheese. He let me try both and they were both pretty good. The mac & cheese dish was fairly large--I'd get full just from that. He had leftovers for the next day! :)   This place is always my go-to when I'm in vegas.  Service: I always have a good time here and the servers are always friendly and attentive.   Location: It's in Fremont Hotel.

dVkikQk5XJr_1hP7a5yXNA.text: Our waiter's name was Jose. He did a great job... very knowledgeable and friendly. Our youngest son has food allergies......The kitchen staff cleaned the grill before cooking my son's food to prevent cross- contamination. Everyone enjoyed their food... we are coming back tomorrow for breakfast!!

HDZCVyO7NZYBVH2ixvaGYw.text: Stayed at the Tuscany Suites and had breakfast at Marilyn's. Really good, lot of food for the money.

oT3ixIyBnMYkcqADqv0lkw.text: This is the spot for late night steggs! I feel like there aren't a lot of people who know about this place. Wayyyyy better than south point steggs for sure.   When they say medium rare, they really make it that way! You ask for your hash browns crispy, they don't come out semi burnt. Eggs scrambled, it's not watery. I love love love this place! Doesn't smell like smoke and not too much belligerently drunk people.   The servers are attentive, and some even remember my face and my order. It's almost embarrassing that I come here so much but I do appreciate those who value and remember their repeat customer.   The only thing I dislike about this place is how they don't split checks and how they leave the dessert on a tray out in the open. I get that they want to display it but that seems kinda unsanitary to be when it's in the walkway where everyone passes by. They need to find a better way to feature their delectable dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another perfectly cooked meal.
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KAR2djWYpK9klPCE6Es08g.text: Best steak and eggs around. Like everyone said. It's only $4.99 for the night owls (12am-5am). It really is a perfect place to eat.   It tastes like heaven literally ... Literally after coming from a club it's the best place to enjoy delicious hot meal.   They ask you how you want your steak and how you want your eggs. Yum!!!   The waiters are so nice and so helpful.... It makes a really big difference when you're tired from being out and your feet hurts from the heels and you have someone so wonderful serving food and always has a smile from their faces.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs

DzZqiihSrw_L4EcJYJcVgQ.text: $5.99 steak and eggs. Comes with toast and hash browns. Super delish after drinking and dancing at the club!  Service was fast and efficient. A+! I love hidden gems off the Vegas strip.

-uryK4huyMbdP3x2Vqs2pw.text: Great for the Price Ok - I am rating this for what it is -  a cafe.  The service was fine and the food very good. I had the Wednesday Steak and Lobster special - it was really pretty darn good.  The veggies were not very flavorful, but edible.  The food came out very quickly. Drink service was a little slow, but again, not a problem.  Everyone was friendly.  I would definitely eat here again!

asB5POO3TYybkDinFd_95Q.text: We came here on a Friday night after going out clubbing on the strip at around 2:30am. For some reason it was PACKED. I think when I normally go on Saturday nights, it's not this bad, maybe people don't go to late night steak and eggs on Saturday, but they definitely went this Friday night!  Service: 5/5 - our waitress was dealing with a full house but was hospitable and friendly. She checked in with us once and assured us that our order was coming out despite waiting about 40ish minutes for 4 orders of steak and eggs. She then came out with a basket of delicious cornbread for us to eat while we waited, which was a first for me! Amazing service, props to this lady who took her customer service seriously. Even though we waited close to an hour after sitting to get our food, it was worth it.  Value: 5/5 - Great value, can't beat $6 steak and eggs (also comes with toast and hash browns). I always make it a point to come here every time I'm in town.  Taste: 4/5 - Not bad, not the best I've had, but good enough. I don't expect much but definitely gets the job done and leaves me satisfied. Can't really complain about the food, I always leave happy and satisfied.  Overall, fantastic service, can't argue with the food, and one of the best value places on the strip.

p-ZUYyohjPYXoYViBCmmFA.text: The food is great here. Late night steak and eggs after midnight. The service is great. We usually went after 11. Sadly when James (the best waiter ever) left we no longer went back. Even after a year went by, he always remembered what we ordered. We always took different family members with us and always recommended to see him. Even though we no longer go here I still recommend dining here, ask for Sadie she is another wonderful waitress!

Tp_lztTRVvEdlOgQyGw_gQ.text: This is a review for take-out only.  I stopped by at 8:00pm on a Friday night and the cafe was BUSY!  They do have a take-out counter where you can order separately.  I ordered a MYO omelet with onions, turkey sausage and provolone.  Hashbrowns and wheat toast on the side.  The waitress said it would be 15-20 minutes, so I went back to my room, dropped off my stuff and came back.  When I returned, my food was ready to go.  The omelette was terrific.  With tax it worked out to just under ten bucks.  Easily the best non-mexican food deal that I found on this trip.  Hash browns were average, as was the toast.   Next time I'm staying at the Tuscany, I'll definitely stop in.

E6Z9RUBjYEbdCXf3jlnQrA.text: Marilyn's is a traditional American restaurant located in the Tuscany Suites and Casino ( yelp.com/biz/tuscany-hot... ) on Flamingo Street in Las Vegas. It was pretty late in the Evening last week, and we heard about the popularity of the $3.99 Steak & Eggs - there really aren't any more CHEAP Breakfasts around Las Vegas any more - this is one of the remnants from the good ol' days. The inexpensive Steak & Eggs, from what I understand, are especially popular with Students. Marilyn's is named after one of the original owners of the Tuscany Casino... even though presently, the Tuscany is corporately owned. Decor is laid-back 50s, especially with the dim incandescent tube lamps over each table or booth. Reminded me of a Spanish Hacienda or an Italian Villa themed restaurant with the dark woods and dim lights.... in keeping, I guess, with the Tuscany theme of the Casino. On the menu... Prime Rib (**** $10.95) Meat! That's what I like! The only qualification of a good cut of Prime Rib, IMO, is... leave some Fat in my cut of Prime Rib! And that's what the Chefs at Marilyn's accomplish. Quite a bit more than the 10 ounces stated on the menu... that's alright by me! Side of Cauliflower (** 1/2) - way, way over-cooked, though. And a side of Baked Potato (*** 1/2)... pretty hard not to mess this up. Prefaced with some Dinner Rolls with Butter - OK. Also came with a tin of Au Jus - kids were asking why I wasn't dipping - I never mess up a piece of good meat with anything else! At less than $1.00 per ounce of Beef - a very, very good value, especially with some Fat left on the Prime Rib. Lucky for me tonight, Marilyn's didn't try to get "Healthy" on me... Ate the Whole Thing! Nothing left on the plate! Fried Bananas (****) The low rating for this Dessert was primarily my fault... took a little longer to finish the Prime Rib than I thought it would. Therefore the Fried Bananas just sat for a few minutes longer than it should have. I'm a meat guy... wanted to finish off that Beef before starting on the Sweet Stuff! Don't "mess" with the Fried Bananas with a side of Ice Cream... liked it the way if was... just Fried. Really, really good finish to the meal. Iced Tea Value (**** 1/2) As with most restaurants in Casinos, the value factor in a restaurant is usually pretty high because the losses you incur at gambling usually will cover the expenses that most Casino restaurants incur. Not crowded on a late weekday evening, just three tables occupied when we dined here... BUT, as with any restaurant associated with a Casino or Hotel in Las Vegas... there WILL be lines and lines of people on the Weekends! This is a basic Casino Coffee Shop, if you don't equate Marilyn's to Fine Dining you'll be OK.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

APYEodNg2Fx52FfCZab8uA.text: You can't beat $4.99 steak and eggs cooked just as you would like it. Come right after you go out - no wait, quick and friendly service, and BUTTERY toast. Seriously... $4.99. Yesss!

BzhwQTnfmm7kpJmAZYQrZw.text: What a joke! Service is way too long for 1:00am (not pm) and basically empty. Still it took more than 15 minutes to bring out breakfast food. I got up and left, disgusted! Overpriced...$8 for a breakfast bagel! You must be kidding. I will go to Starbucks instead and pay 1/'2 that for the same plus coffee.

w9hxWAZJDUWtUq8fW4PW0A.text: Came here again this past weekend for the steak and eggs and I noticed they now had $3.99 unlimited pancakes. So for $8 bucks you can get both and the pancakes are pretty good. Or you can split them like we did and just keep ordering more plates!

QxZBcwhW0blwkBTBKB5bKw.text: Only been here once for their $3.99 steak and eggs after clubbing with my best friends. First thing, the server was nice and friendly (and also very pretty). She was taking three drunky people's orders and she was patient and didn't show any annoyance (at least not to our faces), since we were being loud and constantly laughing. Our orders came fast and for the price the serving was HUGE, almost couldn't fit three plates on a table that seats four. The steak wasn't dry and they didn't give us scrap meat either. I'm really impressed how delicious it was for only around $4.

mIiQVKYU6wKLhVUszdRDQw.text: I thought I already wrote a review of this place, but I guess not.  Great place.  I ate here twice while staying at my new favorite hotel/casino, Tuscany Resort.  This restaurant is open 24/7 and the food is great.  The presentation is wonderful too!  Even with just $2 steak and eggs, it is served up in a fashion fit for a king!  The pizza's were pretty good too.  I would definitely stop eat here again!

sAicvF69NixjIAq_KzIg4A.text: Food was amazing!  Try the apple spread thing, whatever it was called.  Hashbrowns are usually bad at restaurants but this place knows what they're doing.  I would've never known about this place without Yelp.

utPWw-Ie9TFMQK6Q35WSKw.text: Great food, drinks and service. Best place we've had breakfast while staying in Vegas. We will definitely be back again.

nzbuNkbvnediFNAlqjLGKA.text: 4am, alcohol induced munchies, $3.99 steak and eggs.  Enough said.   No but really-- prompt & friendly service, deliciously cheap grub, and the price! This is where I go for steak and eggs when I'm too lazy for a trip to downtown.   Quick tip: don't be sober.

D-ZPFT5DQWkfkDc52fBlJQ.text: This is one of Vegas' best hidden gems! The last 3 times I went to Las Vegas, I went to Marilyn's each time after each night of clubbing. The $4 steak and eggs here are as good as it gets. It definitely satisfies your drunchies - it comes with toast and hash browns too! I've also tried the chicken pot pie, but it's $7 and still not as good as the steak & eggs. I've never had to wait in line, but then again I only come here around 2-4 AM. Every single time, we see a certain waiter - James - and he is the absolute best! I don't know how he manages to stay to happy and friendly and perky at 4 AM to all of us drunkards. I will be coming back again, and again, and again, every time I come to Vegas, and each time with new friends, so long as there are $4 steak and eggs here. This place is an essential part of all my Las Vegas memories.

UBeGWBrODYLSZvaHF5QmFg.text: Our server was Tara. Amazing service! So friendly and helpful to our party of ten. We all had steak and eggs, and so bomb dot com for the price of 5.99! Hosts were also friendly!

AR-gMm3u4Pd-XyFznlUmRQ.text: All our food was good. Esther was pleasant and paid attention to the kids and made sure our orders were delivered promptly. Good experience and would come back again.

o-wuGWY4WpsLxHqUahnvKQ.text: Umm, no.  Yelp fail.  I feel bad for taking my friends here.  Sure, I should know better than ordering steak and eggs ever, but this was, at best, a mediocre rendition of the breakfast classic.  I have had better biscuits at Popeye's; this isn't to denigrate Popeye's, but rather to note that if you can't beat low-end national chains, then you probably haven't reached a threshold bar to a three star review.  By far, the most enjoyable part of the meal were the oversized drinks.  While one of my friends foolishly ordered an absurdly sugary pina colada, our bloody marys were decidedly average.  Here, that is a good thing.  Unless you are looking for super cheap food, I wouldn't recommend the trek over here.

zcMxCgEEXEkSNg06s7-mtQ.text: The food was terrible.  Everything we ordered had absolutely no flavor, very bland.  I would have rather gone to denny's or IHOP and gotten way better food.  It didn't really seem like some other people in the restaurant were really enjoying their food.  The service was not really the greatest either.  I will definitely not be back,  I'll spend my money elsewhere.

eoWgxpAxWQ4vs8lC-f6vBQ.text: Maybe I should've kept to the meals that other yelpers recommend from this place. I stayed at the Tuscany Hotel and decided to eat a late lunch here the day we arrived. The restaurant has no ambiance whatsoever and the service is almost nonexistent. Even so, I figured the food might be ok since it has good reviews. Unfortunately my friend and I went with the prime rib dip and it was just Meh. The fries were good though. The main issue was that we both felt kind of sick about an hour later, thank goodness for pepto bismol chewables!  Not likely to eat here again unless I'm pretty desperate.

PlIIk2Awbcjisnuhm3Hg4A.text: Denver omelet was great. Top notch service, reasonable price for an in-casino restaurant, and good food.

GIA9vj7-uS9nNGrkmzR2Pg.text: Honestly, I've only eaten at Marilyn's on several occasions-- and each encounter was between the late (or early) hours of midnight- 4am. They are known for their late night steak and eggs special... for the very low price of $4.99! For $4.99 you get an order of steak, eggs, hash browns and toast. Portions are not huge, though satisfying-- option for a double order steak and eggs available for about $10. The late night steak and eggs special is not on the menu, but very much so available. Their thick, creamy clam chowder is also tasty and very filling! Despite being open 24 hours and numerous drunken encounters throughout the night, all of the employees here are wonderful! In addition to this, if you are sober enough to drive yourself here (don't drink and drive!), Marilyn's parking is easy peasy-- located right outside the Casino. No complicated parking structure to venture through. Marilyn's is perfect for late night, cheap eats.

LUKu3h2u37pMH0jrpNMzwA.text: Loud loud disco Muzak. Dirty table camouflage pattern. Artificial creamer. Terrible and luke warm coffee. Sent back to microwave. Seriously?  One pleasant waitress. Water was good and cold in a sparkling glass. Coffee mug was cracked and chipped through. Strange square shaped cup and saucer. Eggs cooked well. Steak watery as they tend to be after being thawed by it worked. Plenty of Heinz catsup on table.  Grits were watery and tasteless but at least not over cooked and lumpy. They also did the job. English muffin was toasted to perfection and buttered.  All in all an ok breakfast but wouldn't bother with a return engagement. Not sure why first review listed was 4 years old and sold me on "cheap eats". "Steak and eggs" for $3.99. Ooooh, those were the days!  At least after being microwaved the coffee retained its heat for about 20 minutes.   I've had worse but next time I'll spend the $10 of breakfast tab on the tables. LOL!!   Hello Las Vegas!

k3W3tbgabpuYTAuo3HOLGA.text: This place and the management are a joke. I argued with the staff for a good 15 mins about having French toast. Asked to speak to a manager and was refused. Instead the manager sits and stuffs his face while he tells the server to go tell me he's unavailable.  The strangest part about it all is I even offered to pay the difference from the start of the whole argument.  No mater what I had to take the meal the way it was served on the menu.

jaFgI06hwre0JMw1lLnxGg.text: Disappointed! Pot roast dry, mac&cheese is out of a Kraft box, clam chowder tasteless. Service awful, server not rude, she took our order, brought our food, gave us our chk, & nothing more! & even though we sat near a main aisle, where she passed ever few mins, she never asked how things were & how we were doing, she didn't even refill our drinks. There's a flip menu on the table, saying u get a free dessert if a dessert tray isn't brought to u, I have never turned down a free offer, this time I did, I couldn't wait to leave. First & last visit ever.

ZUmzeE26j6NtIHZYxYw0tg.text: Wife and I were looking for a good breakfast, but something more affordable than the $40 per person buffets at the Wynn and the like.   Marilyn's had good reviews, and was a $8 cab ride from where we were staying, so we made the trip.  It's inside the casino at the Tuscan hotel, and the restaurant itself is a perfect match for the food - simple, comfortable, and good.   My wife had the meet lovers bowl, and I had the NY steak and eggs. The food came quick, the temperature was good, and almost everything tastes great.   The only food item I didn't like was the steak, as it lacked flavor - very bland. But the grits and eggs and toast were all so good, I kind of ignored it.   The service was fast and friendly, and we recommend Marilyn's to anyone looking for a decent breakfast at a decent price.

k-PoNmFgY3-Au8tDJ4TdyA.text: I came here twice during my two day stay in Vegas. Good prices for a lot of food with pretty good service. It's like a hidden gem! It wasn't crowded at all both times that I went, at 1:30 PM and 5 AM.   First time I got the 12 oz steak with loaded hash browns and potato salad. Potato salad was ok, so were the hash browns. I devoured the steak, I wanted it cooked medium well and it came out just the way I wanted! You can also request bread rolls but they ran out so they gave us corn bread which was delicious. For $12.99 it was a pretty good deal.   Service was pretty good, the server came by to check on us a few times, refilled our water, gave us extra napkins...   I don't have anything bad to say about this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheap lunch!
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cooked perfectly!

C6xaQS6jeKDBlP6cP0TefA.text: Don't bother! My husband and I went late on a Friday evening, well late for dinner that is, we were seated at 905 I order wasn't taken until after 925 and by 945 our table was still empty no bread no one checked on us, what made it worse was two women that walked in after us we served immediately and we're eating when we finally decided to leave with out our food coming our. Worst part is we informed management and all they said was that terrible so sorry as we were walking out, needless never again.

KD6YCzrH2l2kc_Cxw7OseA.text: After a successful night of clubbing, we all had some late night munchies and took the cab to Tuscany for some steak & eggs! We came around 3am and the place was pretty empty. All 10 of us ordered the usual steak & eggs (steak, eggs, toast & hash browns). Along with 2 cups of coffee. I'm not sure how much each plate was but the end total for all of us was $62 - probably including gratuity & tax. Not too shabby :)  The waiter was friendly and took our order quickly as well as refilled coffee whenever needed without us having to asking.

Kuk4F_2onAdty0aMS_l1mg.text: We stayed at Tuscany Suites and ate twice at Marilyns. Customer service was phenomenal. Price was great. Dinner for two, steak and 2 sides, 2 pork chops with 2 sides and 2 soft drinks = $45 plus tip. Breakfast under $20. They have dinner specials that are ridiculously cheap but we ate too late for those and they have ayce pancakes for $3.99. Wait staff was attentive, friendly....restaurant clean and nice Tuscan theme. Also get 2 for 1 meal on Thursdays with reasonable casino play.

JnqBEh9sPQF2yEE9LacJCQ.text: *ONLY REVIEWING THE STEAK AND EGGS, VENUE, AND SERVICE  Very very impressed with the remodeling of Marilyn's Cafe!   I only came here for the extremely inexpensive steak and eggs and they were significantly tastier and cheaper than The Steakhouse at Bill's. The steak was cooked well with larger portions compared to Bill's, hash was delicious, and the best part was that Marilyn's had A1 sauce (YESSS!!). A cheaper quality steak without A1 sauce is just not amazing to me.   I truly believe that Marilyn's renovation did nothing but benefit them. The food quality has improved leaps and bounds and the dining area is spacious enough for late night dining and extremely clean.   Also, I went here three times in the 9 days I was in Las Vegas during this past summer and I always had the same waiter. I wish I remembered his name because he was such a sweetheart. He was peppy at three in the morning and was extremely polite. He made the experience even better!  I am confident enough to brush off my prior statements of the Steak and Eggs at Bill's being better than Tuscany. Fellow Yelpers, Marilyn's Cafe for Steak and Eggs is the way to go! You wont regret it!

RYbNGV4RTHEiWjYIoFcyNg.text: Also had the steak and eggs everything was cooked as ordered , Seemed a little dis organized on taking orders , bringing  food mixed up on plates and not bringing somethings,Just ordered coffee and water to drink but had to flag down someone to get them after sitting for awhile. Asked for salsa and was almost done eating before it was delivered to the table. Ordered a Cinnamon roll it didnt show so asked for it to be taken off the bill it was and was delivered no charge.. A little unorganized for the shift might have been a turn over going on at the time..All in all it was a good experience..Will go back when in Vegas.

oJw9dpYvPvJIFP9zFl4pCA.text: Breakfast was great.  I got 3 scrambled eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage links, hash browns and 2 pancakes.  I asked for my scrambled eggs to be cooked "soft" and the waiter understood what I wanted. Just about every restaurant I go in and ask this, the waiter questions me as to what I want.  And when I got my food, my eggs were just like I wanted and tasted very good.  Hash browns we're much better than other breakfast restaurants.  Brown and yet tender--very good.   Bacon and sausage we're just ok.  Pancakes were light and fluffy with very good flavor.  I recommend this restaurant for breakfast.

GphbVikBs0GpOjzTQSW7-w.text: I am staying here at the Tuscany Suites for the first time and was glad that they had a 24 hour restaurant on site. Unfortunately, the wait staff is completely rude and forgetful. They will gladly seat you without ever sending a waiter over. They do not smile during service and only come around to take your order, drop the food off, and pick up the plates. No refills and no inquiries as to how the experience is going.

2UxVY3vYzDmp-WG2_gFiQQ.text: $5.99 for a (approximately) 12 oz. steak, 2 eggs, hash browns, and 4 pieces of toast. Whether you win or lose on the strip, it's a great place to celebrate or eat your sorrows away, respectively.  I don't know if there are better locales and how Marilyn's compares, but if I'm ever back in Vegas, you'll find me here after midnight.

fRgiBUnXN8bEUQLZYQjePQ.text: Steggs.  That's pretty much all I need to say about this place (joking), but honestly though. Whenever I'm trying to sober up from a night of drinking, this place comes on top of the list next to two others. Besides the actually steak and eggs themselves, I love that this place is located near the Strip. It comes in handy when you've spend a long night drinking whether it be in a club or at a hotel party.   The ONLY thing that keeps it from becoming a full 5 stars is the fact they have a certain time limit and day when parties aren't able to do split checks which kind of makes it inconvenient when you're sobering up and forgot to carry cash on you and your card limit has been completely maxed out due to heavy drinking.  All in all, definitely a good sober up place.

-cWy6YG9y9IPJ5xHf3_-iA.text: This is based off my second visit the first time I wasn't too impressed with the service but they made up for it tonight !!! All u can eat crab legs for $20 Friday night can't beat it !!! Come early there will Be a wait. Food is good service was Great !!

6gSafmp4AwgfOGZXF-nvpA.text: The service was kinda slow.  But portion sides were huge!!  My coffee came out a little on the cold side. So make sure u ask for super hot coffee.

Nj9W6RDPOQJdl0Sl3RLoBg.text: Me and my wife had the prime rib and turkey the prime rib was very Bland tough the turkey was what I over-salted dry the food I'm pretty sure food served at a homeless shelter would have tasted better than this it was overpriced and then I had to wait 15 minutes at the register while three attendance sat there and ignored me didn't say a single word to me with no one in front of me in the line I highly recommend that no one ever eats at this restaurant

SaFmzHiT33d7bFKTSkH_vQ.text: This place is a hidden gem!! I'm preggo and stuck in Vegas for 5 days working. This equals ZERO for me to do or look forward too. A couple days ago I started craving a Mouth watering grilled steak. I ordered one from my hotels room service.... I almost cried. Such a waste of $40. If you've been or are pregnant, you know that craving will NOT go away until that spot is hit perfectly. tonight I decided to walk next door and give their cafe a go after hearing the food was decent. To my surprise- it was amazingly more then I would have ever expected for $14. Perfectly cooked meal, extremely friendly staff (thank you Rueben!) and desert decedent enough for the most lavish bakeries.     All in all. I highly recommend if in the area. More then worth the price and great staff. I'll be back for sure.

uMIwoq5_q1Yd_acN-oQYIQ.text: Lives up to the hype! Fresh food and great service. Why eat on the strip when you can pay and get exactly what you pay for. No overpriced meals so tip well because your server deserves it.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Waldorf Salad I&#39;m devouring

7NnTv1oKtQ4QiQAnp3-vnQ.text: This cafe is tucked away inside the Tuscany Casino, and it's well worth the trip even if you're not staying there. The have breakfast, lunch and dinner specials every day including a steak and eggs breakfast special that you just have to try to know how delicious it is. I've been here many times after finding this place when staying at the hotel and everything I've ordered here is cooked to order and tasty. They're open 24 hrs and their pricing is very reasonable even when not ordering a special

HYfg-iw1F5IYGHMj4svA-Q.text: I ate here 3 times on a recent trip to Vegas. Had I not been staying at the Tuscany, I would have never gone back after the first trip.  Twice I went for breakfast. I will say the hash browns were good, but that is the only thing that was good. They use a disgusting version of cheddar cheese that tasted like powder and was almost not edible. The pancakes were obviously sitting in the heat lamp too long and the top of the top pancake was hard as a rock (and the plate was extremely hot which is usually a sign of heat lamp exposure).  The third time we went for dinner. I was between the chicken fried steak, the chicken cordon blue and the ribs. The waiter told me not to get the chicken fried steak (never a good sign when the waiter tells you not to eat something), and another guest told me not to have the chicken cordon blue. So by process of elimination I was stuck with the ribs which were also bad.  The ribs came with two sides. I chose the mashed potatoes which were okay but the mac and cheese was absolutely horrible. Probably because they use the same cheese as I had on my eggs at breakfast. Guess I should have anticipated that. Another person at my table also had the mac and cheese and also hated it.  The service was okay for a coffee shop, but overall, this place is crap. I will never go back.

MIA8o29k9zqxZjHS7w6fdQ.text: Nothing like on the Strip. .. you get what you pay as always a rule of thumb. ... staff was not friendly,  was as a inconvenience to them to help. Food was not good quality.

WcQPB9m06rwQJwT2s3vtbw.text: Did you have a raging night and you're hungry?  Cheap steak and eggs! $5-ish plus tax, plus tip. Service is okay. Don't expect them to be on top of it. They're short handed and trying to be quick and efficient.  I seriously just come here for the steak and eggs. Don't ask me how the other food tastes like.

uW6qPJujiBSILn55rqZphg.text: I think my expectations for this restaurant were a little to high.... for someone who was completely sober and hungry at 6:00a. I ordered 1 multi- grain pancake with fruit. I literally waited 25 minutes for 1 pancake. It was 100% tasteless. I even douzed it in syrup and butter to taste a little flavor... still nothing. Service friendly but definetly not efficient.

q9wom1_oOyiBPeQUHbK7Yw.text: When you can finally get up from the blackjack table and slot machines....... Give this cafe a try.   The staff is the most kind and helpful group you will ever meet. The manager that runs the place is the most fun loving and cheek kisser to boot.. I love how clean an organized the place is.     OK on to the food I love snow crab legs, but since I move here I have only seen cold snow crab legs that got to be a sin (checking my bible lol) This place right here let me repeat this place right here.  Awwwwwwsome snow crab legs!!!! The legs are fresh, large and precracked.......... ALL YOU CAN EAT!  So give a try if you are a seafood lover like myself.

-FnN2bgj9_dx2CtAK9VxQQ.text: Our waitress was the best!! I don't remember her name, but she had us call her "Auntie." She was so nice and accommodating. One of us don't eat meat or the other prefers something else, she'd tried to make it more suitable for us and was very attentive.  Food was fast.  I ordered one of the hash bowls: hash browns with cheddar cheese, spinach, mushrooms, and sunny side up eggs on top - SO GOOOOD, such good comfort food served as breakfast, not too heavy, comes with 2 pancakes so you get that sweet as well  NY Steak and eggs - Senior special $8, steak is tender, comes with hash browns $4 after 12am  Chicken pot pie - good, my friend ate it all but kinda small  We came here because Ellis Island's line was too full. I heard the food is better, but I definitely don't mind coming here either. Ellis Island is mainly meat and eggs I believe, whereas this place has ALL the american food you can think of! from breakfast, lunch, to dinner, anything you want or craving, so come here!

x3XmF_X7N1_pngAwrH9fXA.text: Staying at the Tuscany Suites, my family went down to Marilyn's for dinner to kick off our Vegas vacation with a square meal.  We were seated immediately in a booth at the back of the restaurant.  The staff was very happy to have us there.  I am certain of this because the waitress said to us in a genuine way, "We're so happy to see you!"   I ordered fried chicken ($8.99 + $1.99 for side salad); the Mrs. ordered chicken fried steak ($10.99), and the kids agreed to share an order of lasagna.    The adults drank water and the kids "made their own lemonade" with water, lemons, and sugar packets.  Our waitress brought fresh warm dinner rolls and cornbread.  All of the dinners were very good, as were the sides.    The only thing I would have changed was the side salad came with shredded cheddar cheese on top.  This is unnecessary when I order blue cheese dressing.  Service was also very attentive.  At one point my son spilled water onto the table, and a staff person was right there to wipe it up.  Total with the coupon we got at check-in was about $24.  I left a good tip on top of that.  Not bad at all.  Thanks Marilyn!  and kudos to your staff as well.  You haven't seen the last of us.

0BSE-5_oYLFsSAKOZE9k3w.text: Good food fast and great service. No kids menu but one order was great to split between the two kids. No wait to sit down.  Leaving happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3yNYK8R5xGceThnjOWu9MQ.text: I've eaten here several times and the food is generally good.  Last night, I had the Grilled Chicken Salad with Blue Cheese dressing.  The salad was fresh, tasty, and a good sized portion.  Drink service was handled quickly.    There have been times when slow service has been an issue.  Last night was OK.  With the restaurant about 1/2 full, one of the other servers was watching other tables.  He came over and asked what I was drinking and brought me another iced tea.  Later, he brought some rolls.  Although he was not our server, it was great of him to keep an eye out for us.  Prices are moderate.  I enjoy Marilyn's.

5IwOWs6JNFUY3ekLtD5e5g.text: The lady at my hotel gave Marilyn's a good recommendation for dinner. So I checked the reviews at yelp which were also good. Unfortunately it was not good at all.  The restaurant is in the back of the Tuscany Casino. It looks nice, sort of like an upscale coffee shop. The server was a little slow to take my order, which was surprising since there were only two people in his section at the time. I ordered the chicken parmesan, which came with garlic toast and spaghetti; no other sides. The wait for the food seemed a little long; again surprising since the crowd wasn't very big.   The meal was a huge disappointment. I never thought there could be too much cheese on Chicken Parmesan but boy was I wrong. It was completely smothered in goopy greasy mozz. The chicken was obviously a frozen reheat. The pasta was overcooked and soggy (honestly I'm usually okay with overcooked pasta, but not soggy). The sauce was the worst; it definitely tasted canned, almost Chef Boyardee-ish. Yuck!! The only positive was the dinner rolls that were brought to me half way through the meal. The service throughout the meal remained mediocre.  I was tempted to give them a one star... but to be honest, most of the people around me were ordering the prime rib (which was on special) or breakfast items. The prime rib with the salad and baked potato looked delicious and everyone seemed to be enjoying their breakfasts. And as you can see there is a multitude of positive reviews here at Yelp.  So I gave them the benefit of the doubt and TWO STARS.  Update: Not sure why, but I went back for breakfast a few days later.  The breakfast wasn't bad.  Again, the place was busy and everybody seemed to be very happy with their meals.  So, maybe I was just unlucky with the Chicken Parm.  However, the two stars still stands.

DJYzl4jBzPWXtzwc50jeAg.text: I fought with my boyfriend about coming here for over a year.  He kept telling me how amazing it was, and a favorite with the locals, but I was unconvinced.  About a year ago I gave in, and feel like an idiot for not coming earlier.  This restaurant is located off the floor of Tuscany casino.  Don't let that bother you.  If you want a home style meal, whether breakfast, lunch, or dinner, Marilyn's is perfect.  I have had both breakfast and dinner here.  The menu is extensive, there is something for everyone.  I always get the half-chicken dinner (it comes with big fluffy rolls and 2 sides of your choice (a list of anything from potatoes, veggies, salad, fruit, etc).  Dinner is always super fast and delicious.  The breakfast menu is expansive, as are the portions.  They serve a very high quality of food here.  I have never had a bad meal here.  It is not a fancy strip restaurant, more of a diner ambiance, but that is part of the charm.

7DPPpejmLRUmNbFwJTLCag.text: Fantastic! It's located in the Tuscany Suite & Casino. Incredible quality food for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Excellent service. Ate nine meals here! Great prices.

NAsjuwB490WhuDRYaV7ryQ.text: @TuscanyCasino #Vegas Friday Night All-You-Can-Eat Crab Legs $12.99!!! WOW  A small diner located in this off the strip casino offering 24/7 dining with breakfast,lunch and dinner plus DAILY specials. Great Prices, Great Service and good food....Plus Food Coupons for locals in the newspaper:)  We decided to dine out for Crab Night and enjoyed 4 plates (probably 5+lbs) of HOT crab legs with HOT drawn butter plus I ordered a Prime Rib with Baked Potato.  The food was good. The crab was really good nice and HOT!! :) The Prime Rib was a little bland however-no real seasoning but still decent. 3 people dining out for under $40!!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0NiRb3Pt5tsZWMIHFOwL6A.text: This diner-style restaurant is located inside the Tuscany, a casino where few younger party-folks venture out, and let me tell you... this place is freaking amazing as a 12-5am pit stop after the club for the $3.99 steak and eggs special.   No, it is not the most gourmet quality steak you will ever eat, but it's a healthy-sized, juicy cut without tons of fat. The taste is decent, made delicious with lots of BBQ sauce. And when it comes to the drunchies when all you want is a satisfying meal for a low price, it's def a great value. Comes with two eggs cooked as you like, hashbrowns (and they're good!!) and with toast of a bread of your choice - makes for a HUGE meal for the price.   Haven't tried anything else, but that deal alone is worth the trip. And the time window is pretty big - 12am is early in Vegas time!! If steak/eggs isn't your thing, they have plenty of other menu items and a couple other specials (I think  $5 monster burger?) but really, if you realllyy WANT something else, you're better off elsewhere!

A77C8GUI5S1YHykv02sroA.text: Didn't fucking split checks and the waitress was a straight up bitch. Like wtf let us know what the fuckin policies are instead of lying and saying that you told us. Stupidest service, never coming here again wish I could give them half a star.

-_S4B7oh4VWZbs-0pTZ-aw.text: Every time I'm in Vegas, Marilyn's Cafe is always the place I go to for amazing food at great prices whether or not I'm staying at Tuscany Hotel.  It's a nice little restaurant plugged next to a casino inside a hotel; just a 15-minute walk off-Strip. The atmosphere can be for casual or romantic occasions but, as far as I've noticed, a lot of people eat there after partying so expect a few energetic crowds. That could be because I always arrive at odd hours after clubbing or raving--anywhere from 3-6am. The decor is warm, the furniture placement is spacious, and the whole setting is inviting coupled with some of the best service experience I've had. With the right friends, this place is perfect. I remember a couple years back, after my friends and I drunkenly collected handful of escort cards walking down The Strip, we played our own version of 21 with the cards and the staff didn't bat an eyelash. The waiters and waitresses are very charming and friendly. Once, they even warmed up food I got from Earl's Sandwiches. Ask for something nicely and they'll return in kind. So overall, the staff and environment is really great.  Their menu is so vast--spanning at a whopping 127 total entree choices for Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner (~40 each; not including beverages)--yet they don't lose the quality of their food and their portions are very generous. Each entree comes with your choice of bread and butter or jam. They gave me enough (delicious) baked ziti to last me a couple of days. I've also had their vegetarian omelet a few times which was a little more bland than I would have liked but, luckily for me, I like dousing my omelets in spicy sauces or dip it in ketchup so it tasted just perfect. My friends always, always, always order their Steak and Eggs which I would recommend for anyone who loves Vegas' meaty breakfast foods at affordable prices--sometimes they have Daily specials for this at $6.  Whether you're pumping yourself full of food for a hard night out, hungover, or just hungry, this is the place to be. With the friendly environment, great company, delicious cuisine, and college student-friendly prices, it's a perfect dining experience. My friends and I always visit here whenever we're in Vegas and we have some really great memories here. It's a tradition we plan on continuing for as long as we hang out in LV together.

OnARsHALtC_ICPFH_gKD5Q.text: It was a Monday morning and we were staying at the Hard Rock, so we went right around the corner and I got the Steak and Eggs, and my girlfriend got I believe an omlette.   We paid about the same for the orange juice as we did our meals, haha and they were pretty good. Obviously not 5 stars, but there was 0 wait, good deals, and a tasty breakfast after a night of going out.

MU6dHQoXREPBKXNrJxU1Ow.text: Food is so goooooddddd. I went here 3 times on my trip to Vegas. I had the chicken and waffles, french toast breakfast meal and chicken Alfredo. All three meals were so good. Can't wait to go back to Vegas just so I can eat here.

6jkmN1iYh0Lhh0ux9vCrmA.text: Had 6 oz Steak& eggs. Soooo good. Wheat toast, French toast were delicious as well. Servers are attentive & friendly. Hash browns eh not so delicious.

pT3NO3d4UQwJL5A479VCzQ.text: $3.99 steak and eggs! AMAZING! This is definitely where you'll find us after clubbin in Vegas. Like many said, the service is poor and slow... but hey, you can have steak, eggs, hash browns and toast for $5 (that's including tip and tax) Nothing hits the spot in Vegas quite like steak and eggs at Marilyn's Cafe in the Tuscany!

FMYRJF9C6HWrZBrP_b36eQ.text: I picked up Togo food prime rib. Tara the graveyard shift manager was extremely friendly and helpful. I was just amazed how much she cared about someone picking up food Togo. Oh yeah the prime rib with 2 sides and corn bread was only 14$... Delicious! Will be back with my co workers considering they're open 24 hours

C2TEun-cuW1hCiTFD9_Hjw.text: Need cheap place to eat at 4am?  Come here. It's a little hard to get to since this is located in a janky hotel+casino off the strip. Ask taxi driver and he will tell you this is a place to get steak+eggs for the best price.

f1OqOUFa-o17kTV-TTP71g.text: We had dinner here and it took 2 hours, making us almost late for our flight. A couple of things went wrong: one of our orders was messed up, the rare t-bone was medium well, and the service was extremely slow. It took us 10-15 min of waiting to get our check because after we asked for it our server went to take orders from another table, which took forever. It was an unpleasant experience because of all the things that went wrong. The food was decent but not enough to make us come back. All we got was a bunch of apologies and no improvement!

9Xqta4xVDdLRY6FGD7vItw.text: This is your run of the mill Vegas cafe, but my review today will be based on their Friday offerings. Because of Friday, it's Friyay, and that's because you can get Cr-cr-craaaazy with their all you can eat CRAB!  Currently priced at $23.99 it includes two side dishes (mashed/baked/french fry potatoes, mac n cheese, fruit, veggies, etc). It's actually an impressive list of side items. Frankly, if you're there for the crab, like me, they just get in the way. My absolute favorite thing about their all you can eat crab is that it's served to you. That's right. NO BUFFET LINE!!! How awesome is that? They are steam crab legs, so buyer beware. In my opinion, they are outstanding. Much meatier than the Station Casino offerings, they are served with a little cut in the shell in them making them easy to break via hand. Almost all of them are juicy and not overcooked, which often happens at buffets. They even give you butter with a little candle under it doesn't harden. They must know that guys like me are in it for the long haul.  Oh yeah, and you always get complimentary dinner rolls and corn bread. These are really good too - the dinner rolls are always warm and fresh. The corn bread is surprisingly good, sweet, very much like my Mom's corn bread. Make sure to ask for it!  The one negative is that it can occasionally take a little while to get your crab refills. Because it's not a buffet line you have servers running around like crazy trying to keep up. They do the best they can, but often it' takes a good 4-5 minutes to get some additional crab. On a non-crab night their service is spot on, but I definitely give them some leeway given the demand they have on Friday nights.   In my opinion, this is up there with the M buffet for best all-care-to-eat Crabbing, if not a slight notch above because of price point.   Speaking of run-of-the-mill cafe's, they're kind of a thing of the past. I love the feel of older Vegas diners. Sadly they are all starting to disappear. There is something nostalgic about eating from a diner that opened in the 60's or 70's at 2am on a Thursday night.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Note to self, it&#39;s really crabby when you slice your finger with a claw.

Rr0wsvyOD0axGi7Hj82-fQ.text: Absolutely disgusted by my dinner experience. My husband's green beans had a piece of metal from a dishwashing scrub. My green beans look old and hard. My T-bone steak tasted like if someone sprayed some type of cleaning spray. I can still taste it in my mouth. Wasn't offered a replacement but was taken off the receipt. My server was very rude. Didn't seem sincere and assumed I was lying. This is usually our go to place for dinner but after tonight's experience I'm appalled.

BDE6UkHfqPyPkgCKDKx2sg.text: When in Vegas, one craves prime rib. So we ended up here.   We were super excited when we arrived, mainly because we walked 15 minutes and were hungry as hell. The service was nice enough at first. Their free bread and cornbread was also great.   For $13.99, you can't beat what you get. You get at least 12+ ounces of prime rib and their mashed potatoes with gravy was also great. Hooooowever. The flavor does tend to get old after a while and it just becomes hard to finish. We also felt a little neglected after a while but our server still did a decent job. I would give this place a try again. It's not like I hated it. Lol. I just wish it were a little better.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oqOlvgbjukgxrEDX2xtq6g.text: Pretty good diner food at very reasonable prices. Marilyn's is located inside the Tuscany Casino, just a few blocks from the strip. Even though they were busy, we had good service as well and didn't wait too long for our food. My omelette was decent size and tasted great. Everyone else enjoyed their food as well. I wouldn't hesitate to come here again for off-strip prices for good food.

OGJvSvn7QR-2m7Il0NThoA.text: Rarely do I go anywhere near The Strip, but a friend was singing here tonight, so I visited Marilyn's Cafe for an informal meal. Marilyn's is like a real diner with many booths and tables of course. The menu reflects many diner choices. My choice was a Chef's Salad, definitely worth the $8.99 price tag, loaded with ham, turkey, cheese and cherry tomatoes. No cucumbers.  I left happy but my concern was there was no bread offered or worse yet..no mints at the register when I paid my bill.

STPiGqryrrfmNHkBgqTo8A.text: This is THE go-to spot for the cheapest steak and eggs in Vegas, no doubt about it!!  I had been introduced to this cafe by a few colleagues of mine who were looking to grab some post-club food. We came here dressed in club attire and we were certainly not the only ones to do so. Yes, you'll have the old folks stare at you but this is definitely where you'll want to end up for your drunchies.   There's a special from 12-5 am where steak and eggs are only $5.99!!!   Is the quality amazing? No lol. But it's $5.99!! You can't beat that!  The steak and eggs comes with eggs cooked to your preference, hash browns, and side of buttered toast.   Guests staying at the Tuscany Suites hotel can also use their BOGO Free coupon for their house wine or beer.   Overall, totally some bang for your buck.  (32/100 - 2018)

D4EGYzbtKVxqiNmR8vajFw.text: I had steak, eggs, hash browns and was able to sub out the toast for one delicious pancake.  The steak was cooked blackened and was perfectly cooked to my liking.  Paired with the Lea & Perrins steak sauce, I had a lovely breakfast.  The hash browns were crisped and well seasoned.  I'm not a fan of their coffee but still consumed 3 cups. .  I'm happy with my visit and would come again.

MU2zi6Fue4vuk4bWIS-kBg.text: Came here roughly a week ago to try out the steak and eggs special only to miss it by a half hour.   Tip: Arrive 15 minutes before 11:00 AM so you can get seated and order their steak and eggs special.  Anyways, as for overall experience it was great. I came with a larger group of 9 people so we expected a long wait but only waited maybe about 10 - 15 minutes before getting seated. No time was wasted and our orders came out relatively quick. It took about 35 - 40 minutes between getting seated til our orders arrived mostly because this place was packed. After finally digging it, I can totally see why. The food definitely is reminiscent of an old school diner, quality frugal eats.   I, myself, ordered the country fried steak and eggs. First time trying a country fried steak so this was a new experience but impressions were good. The steak was crispy like fried chicken with a mellow steak flavor when you bite in. Not too oily but it was also masked with their house gravy so difficult to tell. The gravy did help to cut the fattiness of the fried oil. Eggs were okay, not overly cooked nor undercooked. Would have hoped it to be a little less cooked. Seemed it was waiting to be served for a while as it was a bit drier.   All things considered though, the food was good and definitely met my expectations. Almost all their dishes could feed two people. For the price, the food satisfied my needs but if I were to nitpick the food could have been brought out when it was hot. Fried foods aren't as great once they cool down in my opinion. Additionally, their hash browns were not thoroughly cooked. It was watery and made the toast a little soggy.   All in all, Marilyn's is a solid choice for breakfast. The quality of the food is average and service was above average. The price and quantity makes the meal a solid four stars though.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TZCHRtcy5LVgxy2NFXZwiw.text: Such a good find. Authentic diner food with really great service and even better prices.  I had the French toast, hash browns, bacon and sausage. The hash browns were seasoned really well. It was all so tasty. My wife had the country fried steak and it had awesome flavor in the steak and in the gravy. Over easy eggs would cooked exactly as they should be.   Great breakfast is at Marilyn's.

xoVLyGUe2UyFTJ6Wkb2HnA.text: Great band for your buck.. Prepare to walk away feeling 7 months pregnant.

PaD6a6s9CRLDn2XJ-Kc_-A.text: Marilyn's Cafe is just a overall great cafe to dine! Great service,delicious taste,very clean and the casino itself has the best comp system in the city of Las Vegas! Thumbs up to that! Monopoly Millionaire after dining and a trip home feeling great! Good times I tell ya....

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash and hot wings
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat Lovers omelet,hash browns and toast! We got our grub on....

F_4dc9JEpMD1ih7zYnUOdQ.text: 18 years and I only just found them! OMG the prices! The quality of the food! And the excellent side dishes to choose from including steamed white rice (very important), freshly sauteed spinach, freshly made garlic green beans and crispy skin-on fries! I had to have the liver and onions $8.99 delicious! The prime rib is $13.29 and beautiful!   I can't wait to go back.

lt46xvlx5_5rYEKiMdR4Qg.text: We found this place when we were looking for cheap eats off the strip in Vegas. Their menu is huge so there's something for everyone. The meals are also quite large as well so if you're on a budget and you're looking for a filling meal, come to Marilyn's.  It's tucked away in the Tuscan Hotel and Casino. My boyfriend changed his mind several times before deciding on a meal and the server didn't seem to mind. I ordered a fried chicken meal which was huge. I could barely finish it. His friend ordered a steak meal with shrimp and I think my boyfriend ordered the same.  They have a super cheap pancake deal that is under three dollars. They also have daily specials. It's definitely a better choice than some expensive buffet on the strip.

0x6JMvDypzvqbEfjKTm5Yw.text: We enjoyed breakfast here two days during our stay. The gluten free multigrain banana pancakes are definitely our favorite. Our server both days was Alfredo. He delivered EXCELLENT service and was very friendly, professional and thorough. Next time we visit I hope we are fortunate enough to have him as our server  again. Excellent service makes the food taste better!

fb0AIKf32oToI9r20tSY2w.text: Usually come here for the steak and egg special past midnight. Usually, they are consistent with their steak and eggs and come out with a nice medium-rare. The steak and eggs come with steak, hash browns, two eggs, and four pieces of toast + jam. It's $5.99 for the special, and I don't think its on the menu.   Service is a bit slow depending on if its busy or not, but they keep the drinks refilled.

mNxSOC9Brl9K29qUIcjizQ.text: Ordered the T-Bone and eggs. Steak was medium rare and it was delicious. Sunny side eggs hash browns and toast. Dipped the toast on the runny egg yolk. Everything was great. I don't remember the name of the lady working my table but she was excellent.

vNTIfrEZ1yAOnwJNZzciKw.text: Staying at the rrsort and had breakfast here for three mornings.. First morning, service two thumbs down. Hostess and server didn't want to be there and let you know. Second morning, hostess A. didn't like that we wanted a booth. Dropped the menus without a word at the half booth she sat us at. I guess she felt the tiny table was good enough. Our server was better than yesterday's.  Third day hostess was fine and Victor was an awesome server. We let him know it, too. Food is good and reasonably priced.  It's a crap shoot for service.

D5DBVbFPdZXywVS-O1FA6Q.text: Had lunch and breakfast here.  Decent standard fare cafe.  Nice service.  Each time we came to dine, we had to wait for them to get the table set up.  We had a large group, so I guess that's standard.    I enjoyed my pancakes.

ASs59tQsveZtFdqYmxALmQ.text: I always hit up this cafe after a late night in Vegas! A short Uber ride off the strip located in the Tuscany hotels. My friends come here for the steak and eggs. Solid dish. Can't go wrong with this dish. I tried the chicken sandwich with fries this trip around and I loved it.  Would recommend this if you aren't feeling steak and eggs.   Pros:  -great service  -reasonably priced  -steak and eggs -short trip from Vegas   Cons: -just off the strip but not that much of an Uber drive

7eUaC_QP9sKm-7wHRBQZgg.text: Came to eat here repeatedly during our stay! The food is affordable for Vegas and very tasty. The breakfast was good value, a lot of food and very tasty for the price. We had a dinner there-I wasn't too impressed with the cheese sticks but the lasagna was amazing and my partner loved his wings. The service was hit or miss, some were rude, others pleasant. I liked the atmosphere.

lCb-Ts_R9I7jGjpSBsX81g.text: Place was pretty dope...breakfast was affordable and definitely will not leave hungry. Service was good and food was awesome. Definitely recommend to anybody looking for some good food at reasonable prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Winners Breakfast
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QNUE9TIsDA7OiEypHiqaYg.text: Juicy steak, perfectly cooked every time I come! Crispy hash browns, delicious wheat toast with my favorite strawberry jelly, and scrambled eggs which they serve you a generous portion of. This place is my absolute favorite Steak and Eggs place around town!   It's almost embarrassing that the waiters that work here remember my order. I guess I just come here too much? Who can say no to the midnight special!   Sevens are very attentive. They refill our drinks as soon as it hits empty and checks up on us every so often.

GqNabK_a_cJxad-S2VcCYw.text: Listen well: I come here with this expectation that any regular, run of the mill breakfast place--no matter where you go--..."breakfast food is always horrible when it's not gourmet". Some of you should write that down ;P   But, not everyone can just sit down and afford $20 breakfasts at the top notch places. Some of us just want steak and eggs and don't want to spend a ton of money (me)! And some of us are drunk and hungry and need a 24/7 breakfast place (sometimes me)!!!  That being said, Marilyn's Cafe is not that bad. It's on par with IHOP and Blueberry Hill in terms of food. And let's face it--every cheap breakfast place you've stopped at is probably horrifyingly average.  AMBIANCE: 3 - The Cafe, or at least the inside seemed out of place. The Tuscany looks like a classy casino, until you step into the cafe, where it seems a bit worn down and old. However, it was very spacious inside and they try to sit everyone at booths since not a ton of people come visit them!   SERVICE: 4 - Our waiter was really friendly and fast at servicing us. Our food came out quick--I know, how can it not?! It's steak and eggs!--and they left us alone for the most part except to refill drinks.   FOOD: 3 - Word to the wise: Alert! Alert! BYOW. Bring Your Own Water. The water I had was nasty. I would strongly suggest some bottled water, or maybe you could get a soda! My steak and hash browns  were okay, as long as I had it with steak sauce! Don't get me wrong, the steak was big and juicy, there was just something off with the taste.  The eggs were good! I usually order either scrambled or over easy with cheese.   Fun Facts: Their jelly that goes with their Toast is Heinz jelly instead of Smuckers! It's way, way better.   Times were fun, MC. It's a win when you're on a budget! If I go again, I might just taste their pancakes because it's so cheap!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. steak and eggs = yum!

JZm_coEbwMt1f7gpv3QGaA.text: This place is awesome. Food is incredible and the waitress Riza is absolutely the BEST!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch at Marilyn&#39;s in Tuscany Casino with our waitress Riza!!

q2na-aBv7KK2sSXcmROWYw.text: I want to give a shout out to all the wait staff at this restaurant!  If you are contemplating getting into the restaurant business come see and experience 1st rate staff at this restaurant.  Everyone helps each other here.  Even though they were not waiting on us it was nothing to see fellow staff help each other out with tables they are not working.  The price you ask!  Is very reasonable, i felt guilty paying so less for some excellent food.  No I was not drunk when i ate here.  Well, maybe a few times.  We ate breakfast, lunch and dinner here throughout our week stay in Vegas.  We were not disappointed during any of our meals.  I would highly suggest 2 things.  Stay here and eat here.  You will have a great time and meals.  Oh yeah, WEDNESDAY specials Steak and LOBSTER!!!!!!

v3nYZwDpW-lZjK392IpuBQ.text: We were at the Lounge in the other building attached to the casino and we wanted food.  The Tuscany Garden was closed so this was the only place to get food.  I went over and ordered food to go to take to the lounge.  We ordered a Waldorf Salad, some potato skins, mini burgers and a corned beef sandwich.  Everything that came which was cooked in oil tasted LOUSY.  It tasted like the oil was rancid and had not been changed in a while.  The salad had what they call chicken which was not real chicken, it was processed and tasted nasty.  Needless to say, $38 down the drain because other then the mini burgers and the corned beef sandwich, everything else got thrown in the trash.  The sides with the sandwiches, the potato skins, the salad....Maybe the Steak and Eggs people talk about after midnight might be ok unless you are too drunk to notice any better, otherwise this is a place I would NOT recommend.  The food at least last night was horrible and really deserves a 1 star but the service was good and staff was friendly even though the food was EXTREMELY disappointing.  CHANGE YOUR OIL....

Mr57j9gdNMf8QXwweyCh5g.text: When I went, I caught them at a pretty bad time. The host said that they're kitchen staff was running unusually slow, so many others and I had to wait inordinately long. When we finally got sat down, the waiter was very nice and easy going! He helped us get the best deals for what we wanted. Unfortunately, when I got my $6 steak and eggs, it was totally under seasoned. Luckily, there was table salt and pepper, so I was able to get it to taste right.

u08ZVDS1mEekSnl8vY-Ixw.text: Huge portions!! Opens 24/7!  It was getting late, we were tired, hungry, and just wanted something to eat. Thank goodness for the night life in Vegas where restaurants closes late or doesn't close at all. I know many reviewers stated they enjoyed their cheap steak and eggs, but we were neither late enough or early enough for that. So this review is for regular dining.  There is a special every day listed on their board in the front and their website. It was Wednesday, so their special was 4oz of lobster tail with 6 oz of steak and two side items.   Chicken Parmesan $10.49- My younger cousins both loved it. They each had their own order. No side items but had two slices of garlic bread. They were full from the pasta that the bread was not consumed.  All included two side items. 10oz Prime Rib $13.49-Not bad! I got a coleslaw and hash brown. It came with dipping sauce. Not a bad price at all! Turkey dinner $8.99- It didn't look appealing to me when I read the description and it wasn't good. The turkey slices were tough. 12oz steak-Dad chose medium rare, didn't try it, but he said it was good.  TIP: Open a membership card to receive their discount booklet. Since 4 of us were able to open a card, we took advantage and did just that. It had a 10% discount of an entree at this cafe (not including specials). No limit per a table.  Good service and food. 18% gratuity was included for our party of 6.  Will be back! I want to try their inexpensive steak and eggs!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. prime rib
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. turkey dinner
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. steak and shrimp

K2XSvk5vtcGUAC6rYLluVg.text: Yummy brunch location with very decent prices. We just got the basic breakfast with coffee and French toast with cornbeef hash and an egg.   The service was fast and food was tasty, I love brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basic breakfast $5.99
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast with lots of random sides

vze6seONn-T3m2VUEItMYQ.text: Not a gourmet dining experience, but the service is great, and the food is delicious!  I had their fruit pancakes, and they are soooo good.  I'm a healthy eater, so I didn't use the butter or syrup I was given.  They were perfect as they were, with tons of fruit baked into them.  I've also come here and gotten dinner, as well.  Yummy veggie burger!  I'll definitely be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes, with blueberries, bananas, and strawberries!  (Otherwise called the &#34;red, white, and blue&#34;.)  Yum!

-lJh-61p27yfXRaauo3ePQ.text: I have to say this place is a quiet low key place. The food was good. I was on a girls trip with my friends. But I have seen many people out of control in public and this one takes the cake. We were seated and the food was out at timely manner. We were seated next to some people who were over the top ridiculous. They were so extra as soon as soon they ordered. They were outright unfair and mistreated the staff. I have to say this staff at Marilyn's Cafe were one of the most patient people I have ever come across. They took all their abuse and ignorance. The reason I give this place 5 stars is because even though those guests were straight up rude. Not once did they loose their cool. They kept offering to fix anything but this case was one of compensation in monetary form. Thank you staff at Marilyn's Cafe and I apologize on behalf of those immature "adults."

YdY-rUAchbYJm4eTjIxBCQ.text: #150  I was in Lost Wages, err Las Vegas for 2016 CES and staying next door at the Fortune Hotel. FYI, don't stay there (I will detail that experience later).  I went to Marilyn's for breakfast the first day of CES, Wednesday, 6 January. I tried the chicken fried steak and eggs with real shredded hash browns and my friend got the pork chop and eggs. We shared and the hostess had recommended the latter as one of her favourites. Good choice! The chicken fried steak was lightly breaded and the chicken so tender; the pork chops were so tender you could cut them with a stick pen. I thought the coffee was excellent but my friend thought it was average. Jose and Miriam took care of us this meal (one of 4 trips in 4 days). Excellent service with excellent food!  Next trips, my friend and I got the Steak and eggs which are $5.99 after midnight and $8.99 between 0600 and 1100. Great steak! Emilia and German took care of us and again, excellent service.  These meals also come with hash browns AND your choice of toast and jams.  Because of this restaurant, next trip we will be staying at the Tuscany which houses this restaurant.  Good food, good price, good portion, good location, good service. Now, that is my 5 stars; get yours soon!

LylActoJrYs3ybd-epCL9w.text: The food quality isn't the greatest but considering the price, it's worth a try. I highly recommend the steak meals as they're not only delicious but also reasonably priced.  Although the cafe is located within a casino, there are kid friendly options so bring the family.   The servers seemed a bit gloomy but service was averagely paced despite the early crowd.  The plates are large so that's a plus.  The country fried steak was salty but the eggs were alright.  Toast was just toast and it came with the generic jam.  The pancakes were tasty and my sister enjoyed it.  The greatest disappointment came with the french toast.  They were soggy and bland; it resembled wet bread and nothing more.   On the positive side, the servers were always ready for refills and attentive with the bottomless coffee.  The food is cheaper than most places and although the food isn't outstanding, it's filling and tasty if you pick the right choices.  The steak was cooked correctly to order, perfectly medium rare.  Each dish came with many options so it's easy to share.    Wouldn't stop by for another time of day besides breakfast but it was memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YFdR-w5Z9785X2kx-K6U9w.text: I want to start off by saying, I did a lot of research for the most inexpensive and quality crab legs in Vegas! I'm very impressed with  this restaurant! They serve crab legs on Friday nights until 10pm for 23.99. AND GUESS WHAT, It's all you can eat WARM CRAB LEGSSS!!! Let's be honest what more can you ask for, right? They also give you two sides. I ordered sweet potatoes fries and green beans. Trust me when I say, this place is the bomb!

fUJyLDzRVoejVRTPUYaJvg.text: Came here during bsides/defcon week, so this place was definitely more packed than usual. However, a restaurant this size should always be prepared regardless of crowd size, and waiting 40+ minutes after ordering for our food is not acceptable.  For a casino, food wasn't terribly expensive, but it wasn't anything great either. The prime rib melt was eh, nothing extraordinary but still okay. Tequitos and fried zucchini were a little disappointing,  but their burrito special seemed filling. If the service was better, I'd probably bump my review up 1 to 1.5 stars..

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qpnxEso-Rnq9tRDxdBouHQ.text: Is it really a Vegas trip done right without that $5.99 steak and eggs? I'm gonna say no. I've been to this place a handful of times and I'm always coming back.  DISCLAIMER: I've only eaten Tuscany's intoxicated, so my words may not be the sober truth. :)  Steak is juicy and a good portion. It's not your fancy steakhouse steak but it'll do at 3 a.m. when you're starving. Eggs are always cooked as asked (I mean, you can't really mess up eggs), and hash browns are cooked to a perfect crisp. I actually split a plate with my friend this past weekend and it was a great size for the both of us.  Servers are usually great and nice to everyone, which I think would be hard to do when you're serving dozens of drunk 20 somethings. Major props to them, lol.

NcJhjGLjHJApcNJYvKtzOw.text: Awesome.....awesome......awesome!! Excellent service! The menu prices were great too. You get a lot of food for what you pay for. Skip the pricey restaurants on the Strip and check this place out. Casual setting, but great food and service.

0XuAWN9DJI8-4m2oDHwS4Q.text: A lot of food for the money. Big, loud, no atmosphere. Food was good. The cocktail did however not contain cream of coconut as advertised

n8J_YqS8CwB9qUdXtM0f4g.text: Service was fantastic. Our waitress Miriam was amazing, attentive, prompt and alert. The food was so damn delicious and so cheap. Like 3 blocks away from the strip behind the Linq.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All of our plates were sooo good!!!! NY steak and eggs and BBQ chicken.
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half a BBQ chicken with choice of 2 sides 8.99 and steak and eggs with toast and hashbrowns 12.99.

lIYvnz5RYcxAgHuzKkugoA.text: Had them for 4 straight days last week and loved every meal.  Good selection and reasonable prices.  The 8 oz Angus burger blew my mind!  Room service was always on time and served till 10pm.  Thats a big plus for fat guys like me...  Food arrived still warm.  Was very impressed with the staff.   Recommend to all...

2His6xf_LuGba3HyV3ca0Q.text: Amazing food, and great prices. New favorite restaurant in town. I will definitely go back!! The specials are my favorite & the ribs omg yes!!

bxLpetBSzcrEsbJk2TG1Ig.text: I wanted to order a make your own omelette breakfast. Agnes suggested I order the Supreme and substitute items that I wanted. It worked out better and was cheaper. It was delicious and way too filling. My wife ordered banana and yogurt with some french toast and that was also delicious. With a shot of Bailey's and a beer ,for breakfast , the bill was only about $30. I would suggest this place to anyone. Great food, great service, very reasonable prices.

6b4SCGylTp2wkAYTbvg3EA.text: My friends and I absolutely loved this place. It's not too far from the strip and prices are incredibly affordable! Staff is friendly, upbeat and our server was incredibly nice and attentive.  There's a wide variety of options for food and the portions are pretty decent. Everything was delicious. I would highly recommend this place to anybody looking for a cheaper meal in Vegas!

N0wa3ASJnCJqUxQPnLfEbQ.text: Really good food, and for the price you are paying, its a great deal! They give you a lot of portion of food for an affordable price. Its busy on weekends specially friday. Servers and busers are usually friendly and nice.

mV9JPof_TfQNDa-tGff9dA.text: Definitely a fan.  The food was above average for an excellent price.  I was confused on where it was, but it is in the casino/resort.  Go to the back......... park..... enter and eat.

JVO5OoKvy9GoeUKqt3bhEA.text: Definately does not dissapoint. Its very affordable and not far from the strip. I came here for breakfast and ordered a Breakfast Burrito and my BF ordered a Regular breakfast. Staff was very friendly and everything was great. My hashbrowns were a little cold but they took care of it and were really nice about it. The food was really tasty. Great experience!

kR0GO_Zs1BfrsUR4JSAgNw.text: 3 steak and eggs and a fruit cup for $15? YES PLEASE. Late night cheap eats for after-clubbing food orgasms. Eggs (scrambled) were a bit tasteless and overcooked to me, and the steak could have been rarer/less dry, but hey...decent portion for a great price. Nothing more to say! Oh and plenty of sauces/dressings to douse the dryness out of the steak if need be!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs...amazing for the price!

7UKhSUMVPqukWpXLNi0a6Q.text: I used to come here more often years ago when they had a promotion where you would get $10 off on any bill of $20 or over.Almost everybody that I recommended this place to or dined with liked it.My friend Arthur is visiting Las Vegas and he is staying at the Tuscany so I suggested that we have lunch here.We both had prime rib and we both enjoyed it immensely. The price is very reasonable and the quality of the food is quite good.You're not getting overcharged like you would be in a lot of the tourist traps in the Strip,where you're paying for a brand name.Our food server Wendy was an absolute sweetheart.She was very warm,friendly,personable and efficient.They have a large selection of side dishes,too,of which you get your choice of two included with any entree.I cannot recommend this place enough.You will get very good value for your dollar and the quality of your food should be to your liking,IMHO.

ZzNQVo1jvrlT0tdqiz2cJg.text: You go here for one reason and one reason only.  $3.99 Steak & Eggs after midnight. They don't advertise it, you just gotta hear about it. It's like a secret club @ the Tuscany that all the Asians hit up after a night of hardcore partying. & boy, does it hit the spot. $3.99, what a freakin' steal! No wonder the asians flock here.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. delicious!

a3hEkUhZMpvHLExE2CpPQg.text: We come here every year after the EDC - usually around 5:00 or 6:00am. The food is always great and the service even better.

cYbqfs4Efn1e2WCD5QizpQ.text: this place is really stupid. first of all the servers are rude and obviously hate their job???? idk but they have horrible attitudes. second they can't split checks at all? I work at a restaurant it is extremely easy to split a check or at least put a certain amount on different cards. the sever just did his side work the whole time which was rude and when we needed something he wasn't around we had to go up to him. so we had to use an ATM and get charged an extra 2.50 and then we get charged 18% gratuity like for what??? the service here was disgusting and it was annoying. they need to get their shit together and I work at a restaurant so I do know how it goes and I think it was horrible it was a disgrace they need a new system and new staff because it was not good at all. I don't want to come back for those reasons

xzjR0OgpKUV6TBtvHhx_5g.text: Eh, second time here and service is terrible but cheap food. I ordered the turkey pot pie & it tasted like something was moldy inside. I returned it and ate only a side of hash browns. Only reason I give it three stars is because my boyfriends food was good but over all the place is mediocre at best.

Vm0yOSPzvTWjqEUWQiV_Fw.text: This was our spot when we stayed at the Tuscany during our multiple Vegas trips. Open all the time and the $4.99 steak and eggs was a steal! Who could say no? It is especially enticing after a night on the strip and rounds of booze ;) So yeah, it might not be top quality steak or anything but drunchies claims otherwise!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti =]
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qnweQkZUhZsLFx03WrM-VA.text: Fast service, tasty & plentiful breakfast at a great price. I mentioned that to the manager who indicated he hadn't raised prices in a decade!

Ud9CLNcU-Kjf8lfDMNqEQQ.text: First meal I ate in Las Vegas. Porkchops and eggs.  Very good. Clean place, friendly service.  What you would expect from Las Vegas.

tvA7yZzvF77cWSb-oH-E3A.text: I went for their Steak & Eggs late night special for $4.99. Specials run from midnight 12am to 5am. Heard about from Yelp when having hunger pangs late at night during a Las Vegas vacation.  The special come with a strip steak (cooked medium, my preference), two eggs to your liking (mine is sunny side up), hash browns shredded-style, and toasts. Sure hits the spot and satisfies!

Xg9ibb16VbVkHyqq_pGwUA.text: I was at the Tuscany for a week long convention and this was my main staple of the trip.  The menu is extensive and everything looked great.  I had the Marilyn's omelet a few times, the breakfast croissant a few times, potato skins, mozzarella sticks, club sandwich and a few other items that I can't remember.  Everything was really good...every time!  The service was great.  The waiters, the bus boys and the cashiers were always very very friendly.  I really like this cafe and when I come back again next year I will eating here for the majority of my stay.  Did I mention that the prices are very reasonable as well?

6zP5BZfHZ33d8vlF2x1W4w.text: A little better than you would expect for the cost. Breakfast 24/7. Think GOOD greasy spoon!!!

4TyAtt9K0jJnW24JHtCUxw.text: T bone steak is fantastic with a good price. BBQ ribs and chicken are awesome. Great place to dine. Good customer service. Very friendly and accommodating.
