g3KhS7JM8VefemX2QDtJOw.text: This place was great for being open at 1 o'clock in the morning and for the value of the food. We had the eggs and steak and hashbrowns for five dollars which is a fantastic deal. We did have a trouble ordering a beer for some reason it confused the staff. We waited quite a while for the food but we had no complaints given it was so late and we were so hungry. The value and the atmosphere were good. One thing I would not recommend if you are sensitive to smoke - there was a lot of cigarette smokers inside the casino.   Food quality was really only 3.5 stars.

S4TSWbGzoYrQvJxXIX5q-g.text: WHAT?? $4 steak and eggs you say?? Yeees, I heard you right!  The steak and eggs were SOOOOOO good after a night at the club! Definitely worth the $4! They give you a strip of steak, 2 eggs, hashbrowns, and a lot of toast but be careful eating those as you will get full before you eat the rest of the plate! I asked for my steak medium and they did the cooking right! The bbq sauce on the table is so good with it! My eggs sunnyside up and again they did that right. Can't really go wrong with eggs though. The hashbrowns were so good with the crunch on the top. Throw some ketchup and tabasco on those babies and they're perfect!  We also got the gravy fries. Those were amazing as well. We didn't finish them though because we were all full from our steak and eggs.  This will definitely be my early morning spot when I come back to Vegas. I love that they're open 24 hrs.   Taxis don't frequent this hotel since it's not on the strip. My friends and I didn't really know what to do to get back to our hotel. Luckily a few minutes after we went outside a taxi came to drop some people off so we took that back to our hotel. I'm pretty sure you can go inside to ask the concierge if they could call a taxi for you though!

l8B4QJWY9KBEyqI3oNSGQQ.text: Amazing Breakfast, eggs were perfectly cooked, hash browns were delicious, and the French toast was amazing, crispy on the outside and soft in the inside. Yummy!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. July 2014 Special French Toast, with 2 eggs and 2 sausage and 2 bacon strips $5.99!!! Yummy
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Basic Breakfast - 2 eggs, hashbrowns and toast $5.99

Pf4aMgpglBh2tWF_yUBdjQ.text: Went here recently after some bowling. Wasn't expecting much but i was wrong. I order the steak and eggs, I ordered the steak well done, eggs scrambled and it came with toast and hash browns. The steak was a little small but I guess that's what you get for the price. The steak was good all on it's own didn't even need steak sauce, the eggs and hash brown was also great because I noticed they didn't overdo the salt.  I am definitely coming back here again!

q3s14BNcLmWpgaCgfFLGFA.text: You can't beat $5 steak and eggs!  I came here with my dad and bf after a night out.  It was open at 3 AM (no surprise) and not very crowded at all.  We asked for the $5 steak and egg special.  It took about 15 minutes before we got our meal, and the steak was cooked just right and came with 2 eggs, hash browns, and toast.  Everything was delicious and nothing was left behind on the plate.  Best $5 I've ever spent!  The service was pretty good, and the restaurant definitely had a cafe atmosphere to it.  Even though it's a little out of the way from the Strip, I would definitely come here again!

wqcxReVg2vZP87EvoyUvWA.text: Took about twenty minutes for a server to notice us and take our drink orders then it took another hour for our food to come out. I got the big winner. My scrambled eggs were orange. Talk about strange. My boyfriend thought it was Mac n cheese. The bacon was burnt and the sausage links were overcooked as well.. The pancakes and hash-browns were decent. I probably won't come back here for breakfast. My boyfriend got steak medium rare and it was cooked perfectly. Service sucks so bad and the food was decent.

l2gtozrotNPU5sfHN1Wwlw.text: This place is by far one of my favorite places for daily late night happy hour specials on their food. They have a deal for endless pancakes for about $3 , a monster cheeseburger with fries for about $5 and my one and only regular order that I always get is the steak and eggs special for around $5. Other casinos that offer special cheap deals like this that I tried I was very disappointed overall with quality of the food and service and atmosphere but here at Marilyn's cafe you get great food made the way you ordered correctly. Very friendly and attentive servers and clean atmosphere.

G57bmJYEXE0_0ATobzxttg.text: I'm from the south. The country fried steak was on point! The grits were watery, but good. Eggs, phenomenal! Service, spot on. Hashbrowns, tasty. Coffee was mediocre but drinkable. It's more pricy than its listed, more like $$ but no big deal. Decor is relaxing and comfortable.

KNys7z8n3fA1TI7AyMnfYQ.text: Great prices. They have 4$ all you can eat pancake. About 13$ for a big good breakfest. Free wifi

vAYtvio6n5Z-NPkIqHw_kg.text: This place is an awesome breakfast spot. Mostly because the prices are unbeatable anywhere else near the strip and the quality of food is pretty good. Great low key spot to go to for a hearty breakfast after a night of partying or a great spot for medium size groups. family friendly environment.  All you can eat pancakes for like $4, perfect right? There's not much trills as far as decor or atmosphere. It is what it is. A good food spot for somebody that's hungry. Note: I only went here for breakfast so can't speak on lunch or dinner.

KWvvrzbSlzkIf68k0YVpNw.text: Shortly after midnight the German, Starsky and myself checked out the cafe. This was my first visit. The other two had been here previously. The menu is huge! Burgers, Apps, pizzas, and other stuff but the key here is breakfast. I want my breakfast after playing some pokers for a few hours.   We started off with some sweet potato waffle fries. Pretty good. Crispy and plentiful for the 3 of us. But what we came for was what we all ordered. Steak and Eggs for $3.99. Boom! Awesome deal. 2 eggs anyways you want, a petite strip steak that was tender. Not a hockey puck like Bill's Gamblin Hall's Victorian Room's steak and eggs for a $1 more. Oh yeah, it also comes with toast, which I got sourdough, and hash browns. Excellent deal and it hit the spot.   The German and Starsky got dessert. Looked yummy. Starsky got a huge sundae and the German got some chocolate molten cake. Service started off a little slow but once they took our drink orders everything went well. When we got the bill the total was $26! Easy game. I'll be back here real soon.

Hsvl4gZD9R9lcjRjDKGONw.text: The food was good, but I was super impressed with the staff.  Very friendly and dedicated despite a busy breakfast rush.

Q847VDLVsfug2PALQR_fYQ.text: Great place to have all your meals, they open 24/7, serve breakfast all day. cool AC

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t finish all these

iclLty3NNH6CTNMp5UFZHw.text: Ate here several times while staying at the Tuscany.  It's inside the casino.  Great specials every day and great inexpensive breakfasts.  Was able to fill up and get out quickly.  Highly recommended for standard diner fare.

7sHwkVg67oMpSije7c-Y-A.text: Food was really good.  It's just simple cooking with a low price tag.  Service was average. Serving size is average to large, neither one of us were able to finish our meals

Q72bnbeGSqCLfJNNoqj6Tw.text: I would rate this place at 3.5 stars based on my two visits recently. The first time I visited it was about 23:00. I ordered french toast with bacon. The french toast was fine, but the bacon was limp and disgusting. The bacon, also, had a bunch of black specks on it, which I'm assuming is residue from the flat top. Needless to say, I didn't eat the bacon. Totally disgusting. The second time I came by it was about 20:00. I decided to order a club sandwich, despite the earlier issues with their bacon. This time, however, the bacon was fine. I made sure to look at it before eating. It was crisp and without any sign of foreign particulates. The sandwich was damn tasty, and it was a good deal like all their food. So, would I come back? Probably. Marilyn's is one of those old-school Vegas places that still has great prices and pretty solid food, which is becoming a rarity in Vegas these days. Coming here was actually cheaper than eating at the strip's White Castle.

0i6QPdyJWa0K7Hcj42C_ow.text: Easy Mac from Kraft...the kind in a pack with the powder. Seriously, that is what they gave me for my macaroni side. Someone tell me WHY this place has more than 1 star. YUCK!

BWpYyKyfMiHCJ0B6h2pjmw.text: Great food and very fast!  Service was great and prices are very fair!  They are open 24 hours.  Jesus was our server and he was very prompt and had great recommendations, too.  They have Alaskan Amber on draft, too!!

Gjx-FHeY0HXxYSN8YmyskA.text: The fried chicken is to die for.  Four pieces with the greatest, crispiest skin in the world.  I'm thinking buttermilk dipped.   I thought the Rio Buffet had the best fried chicken, but Marilyn's may be the best.    Menu is huge, like Cheese Cake Factory.  So many options, there is something for everyone.  French fries are fabulous.  Mac n cheese side is super good.  Mashed potatoes are awesome.  I try something new every time I go.  It's inexpensive and you can use your points from the casino if you want.    If your looking for a champagne brunch and buffet, hit the Bacchanal Buffet Casesars, as Marilyn's isn't it and it's not supposed to be.    24 hours inside Tuscany Casino on Flamingo, east of Las VEgas Blvd.   ***Park in the back of casino if you want direct access to the restaurant.

Rs5WZStSL7EH0dQXgkzvlQ.text: The steak and lobster deal on Wednesdays is such a good deal! Don't expect Wolfgang Puck quality, but with two sides and a bread basket, this is one heck of a deal!

7ouEPRAcosJFdpzJJT35UA.text: Great Food and Service!! The menu is extensive and has something for everyone. The steak and eggs was amazing. We will be back for sure!!

Bbz-KNl75Rg5EgZkaxBMlQ.text: Decent.   Diner style restaurant but classier. Open late for your drunk munchies after you go h.a.m. in the club. Came here with some friends and opted for the breakfast choices. I mean the food doesn't look pretty, but its edible. The bread isn't entirely fresh in terms of home made. I am pretty sure they order like Wonder Bread and give us those slices.  I don't even remember how much everything costed..... Probably pricy because it's vegas?   Whatevs.

wHiYIBbIWTx36jPaY5pDPg.text: Service was excellent! Price is very affordable! I ordered the fetuccini Alfredo, and I gotta say, it's one of the tastiest I've tried! I would've gave this place 5 stars if the steaks my friends ordered wasn't so over cooked and dry. So I suggest if you want your steak medium-well, just get medium. If you want it medium, then get medium-rare, and so on..

LxP81dEgjOxnbJNxW_EBcQ.text: All you can eat snow crab legs for $20 on friday night from 4-10.  Awesome!  Service was fast, snow crab was hot and delicious, plates were refilled promptly.  One of the best meals i've had in Vegas for sure!  Don't get the mac and cheese as a side, though.  It was nasty.  Cauliflower was delicious.

--vLrLNEiREKwU4FE6eBfA.text: Awesome! Servers were friendly and helpful. Great size portions, my 3 sons didn't leave hungry. Great price near the strip. Food has good flavor, I thought the 3.99 all you could eat pancakes were a pleasant surprise.

SrKh2QUca47mMkgyC8jwSQ.text: I was very impressed with this cafe. I expected food portions to be a small since it is Vegas. That is the opposite. The value here is great and the food quality is even better! I will no doubt be back again on my next visit.

XvgszIQdYEzt6IkhGX3BuQ.text: Good off of the strip breakfast eatery. Good portions and size for basic breakfast. The service is decent but hey, it's inside the Tuscany. I can't expect big time stuff from this 24hour cafe. I ordered the French toast with eggs, hash browns and cheesy grits for all under $11. You can't really mess up basic breakfast so if a place does, then it really must not be good. French toast portion was 3 huge Texas toasts and they were fluffy, comes with the standard powders sugar and butter. My eggs were scrambled well and my hash browns had decent seasoning and golden brown. The grits were cooked well and had good texture to it. They put grated cheese on top just the way I like it. It could've used more salt, but hey that's preference. Good cheap breakfast right off the strip close to flamingo and koval.

AMXc-FhWbkEvy1FO00xdvA.text: First time here, nice quaint casino... I ordered the breakfast croissant and it came with hasbrowns.  It was tasty and plentiful.  The decaf coffee was really good and the waitress was very accommodating.  I like it here.  I enjoyed the gambling too.

OJg5gx2LrLtnRJxx3QH0cA.text: steak & eggs!  steak and eggs for $3.99? i'm a fan. i think the deal is only valid between 2:00-5:00 am. definitely great after you've have a couple of drinks at a club dancing the night away. it does get crowded especially around 2:00 am. the deal is not on the menu, so you won't need it. just tell them how you want your steak and eggs and what kind of toast you would like. it also comes with hash browns! try the zucchini with ranch as an appetizer. it's worth it. will definitely come back again (it's a tradition)! check out the picture i posted.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. steak &amp; eggs!

AG7koNMgh5FcxIm-AqXFAg.text: I walked over here from The Westin because of the delicious photos I saw of the waffle sweet potato fries and the great prices. It also looked like the environment was a lot better than Ellis Island.  Once I arrive I have to wait 5+ minutes to be sat because the host is off somewhere else. Then I'm sat and NO ONE comes to greet me, ask if I want something to drink or anything for 10 minutes! Finally a server on his way to drop off a guest check at the last remaining occupied table in my section stops and asks if I have been helped. I told him no and he takes my order and brings me back a water using lots of 'here you are beautiful'. He was the only saving grace of my visit but that was short lived because I overheard him telling his last table that his shift was over.   I order the four piece fried chicken and it is brought out in about 12 minutes by a lady. No one comes back to check on me the entire time I'm eating. When I'm done I ask the food runner who I can get my check from and he says he'll let my server know. I find that interesting because 'I' don't even know who my server is. The lady who dropped off my food but never introduced herself or spoke to me drops off the check and asks if I want a box. I say yes. It then takes a little bit to get the box. As I get up to leave to go to the cashier she then yells out "Thank you so much, have a nice day!" as if she just remembered she wants a tip for her non-service.  So then I get to the cashier and it's a whole new barrel of monkeys. I hand the cashier my debit card and she says she needs my id for credit cards. I tell her I didn't bring it in my little wristlet because I didn't want to gamble and just came over for lunch. I say it's debit and I'll put in my pin. She says they don't have the machine and that I would need my ID.  I only left $8.79 in my wristlet and my check is $9.74 and I tell her again I didn't bring my license cause I walked and wasn't planning on gambling and just brought my debit card. I ask for a manager. She goes away, comes back and says the manager is busy but that it's their policy to need ID even for a debit card cause they are going to run it as credit and that I can go use the casino ATM. I tell her there is no way I'm taking out cash at a casino ATM and that there should have been a notice prior to a guest sitting down and eating in the restaurant that I would need id to use my debit card as that is not common practice to need one at restaurants. The large sign by the cash register only says you need id and room key if you are going to make a room charge. Seeing as how I'm at Tuscany eating and staying at The Westin that didn't apply to me. She then walks over to a small notice in small writing on the other side of the other register that says for credit cards you need id. Again I tell her that I brought by DEBIT card, and that little sign won't be seen by anyone, AND it would be seen after the fact. After someone has already eaten. I told her I'm trying to pay but I'm not using using their ATM and I only have $8.74 in cash on me and if the manager is too busy to come speak with a guest (I even showed her the copy of my work id that I have a pic of on my iphone that shows I'm airline crew which has helped many times at hotel front desks when I've locked my room key in my room and I need them to reissue me another one) then thatbis not my problem. Finally, she goes back to wherever she went before, comes back and takes the cash I do have and says next time bring ID, and I tell her there won't be a next time.  Between the horrible service, then the cashier incident, I would not go back to that place. The food was fine, but nothing special. Not to mention the pieces of chicken were 25-50% smaller than any normal sized chicken pieces you would get at KFC or the grocery store.

-BsgW6LD9MYPSwks043uRg.text: THE GOOD: They serve alcohol, they're open 24/7 and have all your diner needs. The prices are an ode to old school Vegas back when awesome food specials would draw you into random hotels. Perfect for after the club "sober me up" delectables.  THE BAD: The wait!!!  Oh my goodness!  You'd better have plenty of time to spare cause you'll have 3 major waits to deal with. First off its not on the strip, Second you'll wait a while to be seated and finally you'll wait a longer while to actually get your food.  I believe the long waits puts an unnecessary additional amount of pressure on the taste of the food.  We wanted Steak and Eggs and Yelped this place specifically for that reason.  Sadly the steak was REALLY tough and the hash browns were bland and uneventful.   ALL IN ALL: Gets the job done but not at all memorable! Again it was probably the long wait that hurt the taste so I gave this place an additional star. With all that said I'd definitely go back at some random hour with less expectations.

GLfPK8sV6hWa4ycSz4_eOw.text: We had some phenomenal service on a busy Saturday morning!  Nedra, our waitress, was awesome.  (pretty, too!) She was attentive, always nearby and had some great suggestions.  She actually seemed to be happy to do her job, not like some of the soulless eyes that stare back at you in Vegas.    Jeff got the eggs benedict.  He had ordered them the day before and decided to do them again.  They looked great and the eggs were perfectly cooked.  He got some orange juice.  It was ok, but it had a flavor that we couldn't quite place.  I think there may have been something else in the juice mix, maybe tangerine.    I got the chili omelet with grits.  The grits were delicious, not too dry and not undercooked.  They added a dollop of butter, which is the way that everyone should eat grits.  (Now, if they had some cheese, I might have added a little of that, too.  I guess I could have asked, but a chili omelet is already enough gut-busting damage as it is.)  The chili was kinda funky and didn't have much flavor.  The omelet was well done, however.  It wasn't too dry nor too runny.  I wasn't going to order toast, but then I changed my mind.  Nedra had toast out to me in less than a minute and it was hot and buttered.  Damn, that is good service.  Jeff got excited and accidentally knocked over his juice, all over the toast.  Within 3 milliseconds, there was a waiter/busboy with a stack of napkins to wipe up the spill.  He was gone and back in a flash with more napkins.  Nedra came over, tsk'd us, offered more juice and brought out more toast.  So impressive. Most places would just ignore you.   The style of the restaurant reminded me of broken-down Santa Fe style, though I'm sure they were trying to imitate some rustic Italian villa.  (It doesn't work.)  Normally, I would give this place a 3 star, but Nedra made it 4.

OHUnBMmEQX8Dri13KOI4Fw.text: 4.99 for steak & eggs at 3am. Oh yes. 3.90 for a glass of o.j.  Oh no. Stick to water guys and let your drunk body soak up all the meaty greasy goodness

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good food but stick to water. Paid $4 for my oj. The food was 3.99

fzvuRBbt5ieOq2nXW0dUYw.text: Marilyns' cooks everything well like most Vegas coffee shops...Ate there three times last week.  My colleague claims and I quote "The best dry rye toast ever"....not sure where he regularly eats toast  Hoever, I ate a couple of omelettes and both excelled as did the hash browns and the toast.  They have great specials like all you can eat pancakes, steak and eggs for 4 bucks as well as dailys like chicken pot pie  Marilyns is a great find...open 24 hours

KafNdWUHKJ1OEV6_jYlOew.text: Steak & Eggs. Best thing to get after midnight and it's only $5.00! Steak was juicy, hash browns were good, toast was how it should be, and eggs were cooked exactly how I asked them to be. Service was alright and food took a while to get.

JnVTZ-jztZ9Xn3oGmhfyeg.text: $4 steak and eggs..  Oh whaaaat?!  Yawp.  This spot has cheap ass steak and eggs for pennies on what you would probably spend in Vegas.  It's inside Tuscany Casino which isn't such a great spot but it's well worth the trek for after club/drinking grub.    Now onto the flavor of the meal.  It is $4 steak and eggs.  It's not some prime cut ish you would find in a bitchin steak house.  But for the price you pay, you definitely get something well worth it.  Now, I will say that my opinion on the flavor may be a little biased and skewed cuz of the drunked taste buds that think almost everything tastes good.  But whenever I go to Vegas, this is a spot we end up going to at least once during the trip.

2XuBe_E7vN9OCjImunQ11Q.text: Steak&eggs = yum Steak&eggs + rice&soy sauce = BOMB

aG-kDcnsok3PFz3NlHiNjg.text: Our service was generally good. Despite the ravings here, I would say it's just OK. The food was adequate but certainly not "made with love" as my partner put it who came for their steak and eggs. The plates are huge which was literally awkward when they put one slice of French toast on it next to your eggs. We asked for no toast but it still was on the plate but once removed the spinach omelette look sad & small. The prices were inexpensive for Vegas but it's an example of getting what you paid for.

Ah8OhBV7VpqWjpDukJ4fnQ.text: Good food and i love how the portions weren't disgustingly huge. It was just right for one person and some extra.

aAP6hOR30LzpHn0UqTX6hw.text: Went to Marilyn's Cafe on Friday for their all you can eat crab legs. Have been there before, and the food was good, but the servers were so busy they couldn't spend much time. Sort of threw food at you. This time though, John, our server, was outstanding. He was right there when we sat down, asked for our drink order and didn't wait for the busser to bring them. Asked if we were still having crab legs, as we go there EVERY FRIDAY for them. We said yes, and he brought the bucket, my extra lemon and extra napkins before we even ordered it. Dinner was served promptly and he kept the crab legs coming, even asking if I wanted more just before I was finished with first order so second order would be there right as I was done. (So we wouldn't have to wait, since they were so busy). John is one of the best servers in the bunch. We have been there numerous times at different days and times since we are locals, and John ALWAYS knows what we are drinking and usually has some idea of what we are going to want to eat. He makes sure our drinks are always full, and if the bussers are busy he even clears the table so we don't have a bunch of plates piling up. If you want excellent food and extraordinary and attentive service, GO TO MARILYN'S CAFE AND ASK FOR JOHN.(he only works nights)

ab_p385x9XlkDma0m_MLMQ.text: $4 steak and eggs. Need I say more?  Actually, yes I should!  Marilyn's also offers a $5 burger (with french fries) that is pretty decent and in my opinion, actually better tasting than the aforementioned meal.

PiW2xrxYcmtRGKVLpYxEKA.text: so this place has a special from 12 AM to 6AM they have have a $5.00 steak and egg , with toast! Amazing deal right ?! yes & no. The service here is terrible, slow, and unfriendly.  I literally had to flag down a waiter, then he gave me the wait finger,  finally took my order and didn't even put it in ,  he was straight up just rude. I know it's 1 AM but if it's part of your specialty have some integrity and don't make the place miserable

CIdAQ2u4uGTZ0s22nDIQtg.text: Good food, the pancakes were to die for. Service was outstanding our waiter Jesse was on point!!!!  Eggs were just right...

r9zxxJHjb49dYtWF5DaM5w.text: I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 because our waitress was nice, but the management was horrible.   I went for the all-you-can-eat crab on Friday with my coworkers and I'd have to say DON'T EVER GO WITH A GROUP FOR ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT CRABS. They don't split checks. There were 10 of us and the bill came to about $300. Once we went to the counter to pay, there was a sign that said they don't split checks. This sign was so hard to see considering how packed it was and people were almost always standing in front of it.   We asked for the manager since we all had debit/credit cards to pay with. The manager first said that "the system" won't let them split checks on Fridays but any other day it will. We explained to him that were unable to pay unless it was separate. He, then, said he could split the check in two for us and told us to use the atm. This still was not going to work as none of us with credit cards were going to get a cash advance for this. He sighed and mumbled something under his breath with attitude and said he'll split the check in three for us. Since we still couldn't do this the waitress stepped in and said she would void the check and then separate it. The manager told her that the voided check would still come out of her taxes and she said it was ok. So this manager said fine and stormed off.   We were there for about an hour just to pay for our check. I can't believe this place is getting business with such horrible management but I know I'm not going back again.

NZfcYEM5j0PVjQlOLacwoQ.text: In the category of casino coffee shops, I think Marilyn's is one of the better ones in town. Lots of decent-to-great menu options, friendly service, open 24 hours, and some excellent specials.  Being inside the Tuscany is a plus too, as it is close to my home, they give me free slot pay $$$, the casino atmosphere is nice, they have a good selection of slots and table games, and parking is convenient and usually plentiful.  On this particular night, I selected their Ground Steak with Mushroom Gravy, and it was very good. Beef tasted fresh and the gravy was bursting with umami.  I choose their famed "Loaded Hashbrowns" as one of my sides, and they lived up to my expectations. Could have made a meal out of those alone!  My other side item was their warm cinnamon apples, which were fine, but did not look or taste like they were made in-house.  Looking forward to trying their pizza, which was recently added to the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ground Steak with Mushroom Gravy, Loaded Hashbrowns and Cinnamon Apples ... Comfort food-appalooza!

r-zOReWQ80pZ_bZYKNsWNA.text: This place is chill. Their steak, eggs, hash brown, and toast break combo is $5.99. Pretty cheap and good. It's located in the Tuscany casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak, eggs, hash browns, and sourdough toast..

QtMDLpqgWpTKaUe-x5c61A.text: This was my second time here and I was so disappointed. It literally took about 30 minute to take our drink order, another 20 minutes to receive it, another 20 minutes to take our orders (btw 8.99 steak & eggs is from 6a to 11a only!). They didn't even bring everything we ordered out until we pretty much had to beg for it.  Overall it was the worst service I have ever experienced in Vegas and the servers had no remorse but then again why should they. 2 stars because their food is good, I'll give you that but at what cost, you know?

j1uJ44K362Bck7Fl388iiA.text: Really great prices and good food. Prime rib is decent but the steak and eggs is the real deal. Pizzas pretty good too

7NaPz8zjBOHsHccmPHv8Qw.text: How do you beat $4.99 steak and eggs?    Went here after having $5.99 steak and eggs from Ellis Island Cafe the previous night.  Marilyn's Cafe is definitely brighter and nicer in ambiance.  However, the potatoes from Ellis was better; and the beer at Ellis was cheaper too!  Our server was friendly and food came out quickly.  Check out both places and decide for yourself.

GsMxYJJQxIPi8tOmJFfFGw.text: Great food! Great service! Great prices! What more can you ask for!!  Sonia helped us out and she was awesome!!!

2MLo73HP5W2pjFSyhfn6aw.text: Cafe with inexpensive specials. Had the steak and lobster, lobster wasn't bad at all for 4oz and the steak had some gristle to it but was edible. Service was lacking and my beer was just brought in the bottle to drink out of, should have been offered a glass before bringing it out and just setting it on the table. Green beans were so crunchy and inedible that when I told the waitress I was surprised she didn't offer to bring me something else since I didn't eat them; she just said "I'll let the kitchen know so they can cook them longer".  doesn't do me any good

nZYCbLAfDLWqGcAqVv8Exw.text: My friends and I stopped by for our last meal before driving home. The restaurant is located within the Tuscany Casino, a short drive off the strip. We were seated immediately which was nice considering we were hoping to beat some of the traffic.   It didn't matter though, because our service was terrible. Our waitress, Patty, was the worst server any of us had ever had. She didn't introduce herself for over 20 minutes and failed to provide any reason for being so inattentive. Our food came out another 30 minutes later and was all cold besides the country fried steak. Although cold, the food was pretty tasty.   Having already watched our neighboring table wait another 30 minutes for their check, we decided to skip the suspense and approach the hostess to pay. We would loved to have express our frustration to Patty herself, but she was too busy using her phone to check on us. Luckily we made sure her manager knew of our discontent.

zRow14v8P82KNmFAXXO29Q.text: This is our go to spot every time we hit up vegas. Its located in Tuscany Suites.. The hotel itself is on the older side and not the greatest filtration system when it comes to the cigarette smoke, but the restaurant itself doesn't carry the smell. The food is great and decently priced. Service is good, the prices have gone up over the years but understandable. Good place to go when you are looking for a quick bite. The prime rib is good (best medium) if they have it available for purchase.

iuaQsGsbi0L98npWqp9DVQ.text: This review is about the AYCE Crab Dinner  Mediocre corn. Mediocre rice. Mediocre crab.  What happened? I use to love the AYCE crab dinner here because the crab was so warm and juicy. This time the crab was just room temperature and the sides were just blah.The only thing that improved was that they now put their butter on burners, so it never solidifies. The thing I hate the most was that they raised the Crab Dinner price to $15.99 (drink not included)!! That's 3 bucks more than when I use to come here not too long ago. That's a big difference. For just a few bucks more than that I can go to a seafood buffet with unlimited drinks. I don't think I'll be coming here again for the ayce crab dinner. It's no longer a great value.

7UDj1NkliL4GcU8nwcErog.text: Marilyn's Cafe is located inside of the Tuscany Suites and Casino.  Just off the casino floor, it's a fairly open restaurant and is very convenient for those who happen to be inside Tuscany.  We came here for a cheap dinner before heading out to the strip.  I had the spaghetti with meatballs for a reasonable $7.  It's cheap and affordable and the portions are average sized, but reasonable.  My friends enjoyed their dishes as well and we all finished our meals and ended up with empty plates.  The service was pretty slow, and even slower when you realized that the cafe was not quite filled up at all.  However, we couldn't deny the deal we were getting.    Pro Tip: Apparently there's a deal for $3 steak and eggs early in the morning (3 am to 7 am).

98UTdL6lMupReT5iHSTKkA.text: Our first time here. Never even heard of this Casino or the Hotel. Came here based in 4-star rating with over 300 reviews.   We had to walk through the casino to find the restaurant. I was extremely impressed with the fact that there was hardly any trace of smoking in the air. Friendly staff, GREAT and freshly prepared food, and reasonably priced! Our waitress even offered us coffee to go workout even being asked.  We'll come back to this place, for sure!

D1UGedKQPmmb0ZSf4nFVEw.text: Bottom line: eat here if you can, but it's really not worth the crazy wait in line if you can't get in easily.  On all my trips to SF, we always try to stop by Marilyn's.  We always see the stupid crazy line out the door, and decide we'll try next time.  This time, we actually saw a few people in line, and quickly took advantage of the situation.  SURPRISE!  There's ANOTHER LINE inside!  OK, so it only took about 20 minutes once we got inside, and we ordered a variety of breakfast foods to sample.  We go the french toast and an omelet and the side fixings that go along with those dishes.    It was good.  Would I eat here again?  Yes, if I don't have to wait more than 30 minutes to get to my food.    I will suggest Sear's Fine Foods in Union Square as an alternative.  I think their breakfast food is comparable - and there's typically no wait.  I know Marilyn's puts fancier ingredients in their food and such - but with the foods we ordered, it only mattered that it was well prepared.

BJPrt-A92pdzgLR2ZSAwQw.text: This is a late review, but this was a memorable spot from my weekend in Vegas some months ago.  They have this late night special where they have steak, hashbrowns, eggs, and toast for $5!  The girls and I did this two nights in a row, and if the weekend was longer we probably would have been back again.  I have never had any of the other food, but I've heard that it's also decent.    Next time you're leaving a club/party with drunchies (drunk munchies), come here for an affordable and filling meal.

ANkJGbtFqkrWRrA_2BoaeQ.text: Breakfast all day... check vegas... check... good food... ok service check smokie smokes everywhere... gross.  Of course I got the eggs benedict ...... its a craving i'm special. My friend got pancakes and they were good. :D Nothing too extravagant but again its veygas so they had alchhol to serve me. nom nom nom  3.6 stars.

b3kwdmA-0QRAfHeKnQ4RnQ.text: Ate here for breakfast, it's a few blocks from the hotel I'm staying at. The place wasn't packed at all, then  again we did come at 7am. I believe it's open 24 hours tho. The service was good and the food wasn't spectacular, but it was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy.

KPdld0Axw0zguYj40IG7OQ.text: If you look past the messy tables that were left behind by big parties, this place is a gem! The plates are a generous size. You also pay a lot less when compared to a regular diner. My boyfriend and I eat out A LOT. Yet, we only tackled half of our entrees.  This cafe is open 24 hours, which is extremely convenient. The servers are attentive and have such a welcoming personality.   Keep in mind that checks cannot be split after 10 PM.

t1cRMmp0kos487moBxrdoQ.text: My boyfriend and I dined here twice during our visit to Las Vegas, once for dinner and once for breakfast. When we dined for dinner we both chose pizza and I got a personal sized veggie pizza. The size was perfect and the pizza was very good. Our server even made us some drinks to take with us which we both really appreciated. The second time we came for breakfast and that was good as well. I got chocolate chip pancakes, and they were delicious but rich. Overall the menu had a great variety and prices were reasonable. Dine here, and you'll be sure to find something for everyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Personal sized veggie pizza.

xKH3qAis2WxMGzmpCCavrQ.text: I guess they have time limits on everything and they expect you to eat within two minutes to get the dinner special.  Was excited but now I'm not, I guess I'll take my money elsewhere and leave this awesome review on yelp

4MeQ-EfuDbhB5wkILV83pA.text: It seems a hidden place in Las Vegas. I wish more people would know about this place. We always came here for Steak. I love T-bone here, but New York steak is amazing too.  Price: Denny's  Quality: Outback Steakhouse  Nice service  What else could you ask for!!?!!

GAc1Gov08yyi9CotGcjcyA.text: Our server Miriam is awesome and attentive.. Very affordable. Look into their specials.. It's all god for the price $..

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Daily specials 4-10pm

qeCP8SfL6zIlfGkq--ZiVg.text: This is a definite go to place for a great plate of steak & eggs.  Roll in anytime from midnight until 5am to get the steak and eggs special for ONLY $5.99! My ears couldn't believe it either when I heard the price.  For $5.99, you get a decent sized steak, 4-5 slices of toast, hashed Browns, and eggs. The servers are very nice and service was wonderful!   This place has my stamp of approval!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium cooked steak, scrambled eggs, wheat toast, and hashbrowns

Xv_hyHxRROxgpzAyrnmMSA.text: Hash browns were not crispy.  Asked for it but they must've not heard me.  They were pretty soggy  NY steak is better at market at cafe. Pancakes were pretty good  Inside casino but not smokey except for your short walk to get there.

3C4_JxZLSsuF8UZsgY55dQ.text: The advertisement i seen will I was driving caught my attention "All you can  eat crab legs",.  I thought this was a buffet but no you sit down and they serve you the crab legs and refills.  They also have other food to order as well.  The crab legs that I kept getting seemed to be the claws. (why me when I seen others getting the legs) The claws were so hard to open I even spilled over the tealight trying to fight with the claw.   I asked the waitress can she give me more legs because it is difficult for me to open these hard claws.  The waitress was gone for a while and servicing others because it was quit busy in there due to the all you can eat crab legs.  When she would return she was always nice to me but she said, one thing and that this is all they have.  I was so disappointed due to I seen alot of folks with the legs.  So i order some prime rib taquitos.  (not good to me)    There was this one lady who seemed as if she was a "busboy"  always coming around asking can she get you anything and she is so happy to serve and help you. She did that a few times.  I thought How cool was she. I should have asked her to get me the legs.  I DON'T EAT CLAWS. LOL

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 sides included

BlxZnKJP879Vs531MSmzYA.text: Best damn breakfast we had in Vegas.  Take my advice and STAY AWAY from the buffets at the casino and head to this place, may be off the strip but there is a bus that will get you here!  Service was pretty good, the manager seemed to walking the busy restaurant assuring satisfaction and refilling coffee.  Nice little casino from what we saw as well.  I enjoy going to the non chain restaurants and after a very disappointing breakfast at our own hotel on the strip, this place was great!  This was my first time in Vegas but I will head back to Marilyn's the next time we are in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CmUylaIsUAkHjCeRQuC9jA.text: $6 for steak and eggs, hashbrowns and English muffin!? Yes please. This is a great deal from 12am-5a, after the club! They had signs up that they would not split checks. I assume due to the deal. It was decent for what it is. I would recommend getting the steak rare. I usually eat my steaks medium rare, but you know with these random cafes. Also if you like your hashbrowns crispy, get well done and they cook it on both sides. Yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Vy9KBTICXiGuKJw1NQfVPw.text: $5.99 steak and eggs from 1am to 5am, though it doesn't seem to be advertised anywhere. We came as a party of five at around 1am and were seated immediately. Service was attentive. They were always checking up on us and refilling our waters.  Steak and eggs are cooked to your liking. You also get a choice of toast, as well as hash browns. Extremely filling! Fantastic portions for the price! I would actually recommend sharing if you aren't famished.  This place may be a bit hard to locate. It is in the 1pm direction of the casino. Definitely worth hitting up when you're in town! Also, no split checks allowed so have cash or venmo ready if you're coming in a big group!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $5.99 steak &amp; eggs

v4WcuvgGjNef5yJm1za2Kw.text: Worse customer service ever. I get that they're busy, but for a waiter to cater another table every 5 minutes and our table every 20 mins is just complete bs. It had to tale someone to complain to get attention.   We ended up super upset after being so patient with the service. Manager helped us a good 20mins later after we asked to speak to him. He gave us 25% off and went about his day. I work in the industry too, but there was no sympathy with the manager. We were there for 2 hrs, just waiting for some service. Which, btw, we ordered the all you can eat crab. Within the 2hrs, we barely got much to order. Crabs were small, but not bad. You literally would have to order 3-4 plates to get full. So, imagine being there for the length of time we were there and had no service just waiting.

AlcrPiJzVxU8vlmB9dYkqg.text: STEAK & EGGS SPECIAL!!  **2016 Yelp 100 LV Challenge #4**  I purely come here for the Steak & Eggs, but time to time we get some biscuits & gravy as well. The place is very old cafe restaraunt style w/ all the condiments layer out on the tables. Every time we have been here.... the service has been pretty damn GOOD. Those who haven't gotten good service based on other reviews.... I don't really see it... or maybe we ALWAYS get lucky w/ an awesome server. On occasion our steaks don't come out the way we want it... but whatever... you get what you pay for.   They have Steak & Egg special everyday after 12am   STEAK & EGG SPECIAL $5.99 - for that price I think you get a pretty damn good meal... eggs however you like them.... a big slap of hash browns...  2 pieces of buttered toast, & what I believe may be around a 5oz. Steak that isn't too bad as long as it's not overcooked!   I would come back all day any day I feel like have a cheap decent meal.... & honestly... wouldn't really care if I got bad service... you are getting McDonald's price for quality food! =]

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; egg special 5.99

npR74V-UkkCXfUwqULwR9w.text: I had Sunday t-bone special with add-on salad.  This was best meal for the week I spent in Vegas.  Steak was tender juicy and seasoned well.  The string beans were best ever in butter and garlic and yeast rolls were baked in house.  Winner winner tbone dinner!

ZmeQRvPz7FR-na5DnUqpqw.text: Really good food that's affordable & just a couple minutes away from the strip. We took the 202 bus there with no problems. The French toast is good , but I did not like the orange juice or the syrup that was served. It tasted old and the syrup was bland. Other than that , we enjoyed our food.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast $8.29

AGU--RxQvX89bI6o37yklQ.text: We're from Hawaii but we come to Vegas once every year and every year we always eat at Marilyn's Cafe, at least one meal out of the trips sometimes twice if I can get everyone else to join me! The service is great, the food is great, and the pricing is amazing for a generous order of food!

73zrZuJCo2UrRQxA54tAEQ.text: Another one of Vegas' hidden gems. This one is off the Strip inside the Tuscany Suites and Casino on East Flamingo Rd. It's just located around the corner from Ellis Island Hotel & Casino, another gem of a place for good and bargain eats. Marilyn's Cafe is open for 24 hours and they have a daily special from 4PM - 10PM ranging in price from $7.99 to $18.99. Check out their menu here: tuscanylv.com/d/tuscany/... However...there's another special menu from midnight to 5AM. Yes, the special and staple that's ubiquitous of Vegas - The Steak & Eggs. How much? $4.99 That's more than a bargain; that's a Willie Mays steal of 2nd base without a throw from the Catcher kind of steal. You get an 8 oz. of juicy, delicious steak and eggs cooked to order. These steaks ain't the cheap kind they serve in Reno for the same price. It's a good-sized piece of steak that's tender, meaty and flavorful. Don't expect a cheap steak for a cheap price, but it was pretty decent quality for the right price. They also have an All-You-Can-Eat pancake for $3.99 for their midnight special. I'd have to say that's a lot of carbs for me, but it's there should you get the munchies. And I have to add that service was impeccable. I forgot our server's name, but he was a nice gentleman that was well seasoned. By that I mean experience and class. Servers from other fine-dining establishments could learn a thing or two from him. He made us feel at home, comfortable and relaxed. So the next time your in Vegas and hungry and starvin' like a broke-ass college student, don't run to the border or any closest fast food joint on every corner. Get some quality instead and your stomach and wallet will thank me for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8oz NY Steak with Eggs and a side of Grits
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16oz T-Bone Steak with Eggs and a side of Grits

EBrSalawuOOP2BS0KFbvoA.text: Best cafe breakfast meal that I have had in Vegas to date. My breakfast croissant with a side of grits was delicious! I'll probably go back today. I've eaten here before but it's been a long time. We ended up here by default because Ellis Island had a 45 minute wait & we weren't up for it so I remembered this place & decided to come here. The waitress was sweet, however, the wait for the food was quite bit longer than we expected. When the food finally arrived, I literally shouted "Hallelujah "!! The waitress just cracked up laughing! Lol!! Anyways, this is a great spot for breakfast. You likely won't be disappointed.

F71HK277dU8WChbqabajdg.text: Service was mediocre. We ordered food and it took quite a long time for us to get our food. We saw  good reviews and pictures so that's why we tried but the food was horrid. Ordered a t bone and eggs, steak was ordered medium and we got medium well almost well done. Also ordered a Marilyn's supreme omelet and I got cut up frozen and cooked sausage links in it and the hash browns you can tell our straight from the freezer, all mushy and soggy. Don't be fooled by good looking photos.

pCQSWhv8UByTiYpdUSCVhA.text: I found this place from yelp. Not knowing what was around the area and staying at a hotel on the strip. I paid over $9 for an ice tea and croissant. So I decided to find something more reasonable. I walked to the restaurant in the morning and was really pleased with the staff. Very friendly attentive. The food was very good. I had the country fried steak and eggs one day and eggs Benedict the other. I highly recommend going. It is very reasonably priced and you get a full breakfast.

pezzGvFY43pjpnr0iIdPSg.text: Fantastic food and fantastic service.  Check out the menu for those seniors over 50! Great value.

RLx7YK3VNK7DRNv2nBoBDg.text: I've always enjoyed coming here a lot, Marilyns is usually a solid place to get cheap, standards at good prices, close to the strip and with easy parking. Today's visit, my first since Jan 2019 was slightly disappointing though.  The first time I visited since the refurb in 2018 nothing else had changed but today wasn't so good.   Despite a few staff standing around it took a couple of minutes to be greeted/seated today which was an unexpected bad start, service is usually great here. This continued throughout waiting to order although when the waitress came she was friendly.  The menu has also changed with a couple of items sadly missing, such as the country fried steak as an entree, although in fairness they were happy to prepare this.   The food was good as always with generous portions.   In summary, it was still okay but noticeably not as good as usual - I really hope this was an off day and not a sign of further negative changes to come.   Dropped a star for service and one for the menu changes - I know the menu is still long - but this is one of the things I loved about this place. We still love you Marilyn's but please do better!

qryVCKplOt3cmGnDRbiTzw.text: I wanted some steak and eggs so I ended up here. Very friendly staff and attentive. The food was hot and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Eggs

Xd44TTpaowYKi0u3lLc-FA.text: The food is average. About as good as Denny's. Then again, I was probably expecting too much due to the reviews. Service was slow and the order was mistaken. Meh is all I can say about this place.

It0w6pGHGTfTR7dim8tDLw.text: Been here several times in the last few years I've been coming to Vegas. Of all the infamous steak and eggs places in Vegas I've gone to, this place is pretty good!  Located in the Tuscany, just behind the strip, it was easily accessible and convenient for our group. Our group came here at about 3 am on Friday night after clubbing over at EBC. We were hella tired but wanted to make sure that we get our steak and eggs fix in. As usual, everyone ordered the steak and eggs special for $5.99. $5.99?!? That's right!! **Only available from 12 AM - 6 AM**  The steak and eggs special comes with a 6 oz. steak, eggs, hash browns, and toast. All that for $5.99! That's pretty great if you ask me. and when you're tired and hungry at 3 am, it totally hits the spot. You can't find stuff like this anywhere outside of Vegas. I got my steak medium rare with my eggs sunny side up. The steak was good, it was juicy and nicely seasoned. and the portions were nice as well! I just wish they had A1 sauce.  The service we received was nice considering we were a group that came in separately and they were willing to seat us together. However, this time around, it took a while for our food to come out. I've come here at busy hours before and it wasn't that slow, but this time it felt like it took quite a while.   I enjoy the steak and eggs here and am glad to have found such hidden gems here in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Mp5_z6RyaxFDmRorJHS1eQ.text: Came for New York Steak and eggs $10.99. Great prices for Vegas. Steak was juicy and tender. Recommend for a good breakfast at reasonable prices

jsuyMEAXZ5sCSQtgVxIH7Q.text: This place is a gem a little off strip. It's nothing fancy or "Vegas" other than the fact it's located in an off strip casino/hotel. This place does basic breakfast well and fast and at good prices.  My group and I walked here twice to eat breakfast during our visit. I got eggs bacon toast and hashbrowns the first time, and a sourdough burger the second.  Both were tasty.

mwMVHugiKg_E-ZI0Zul3bQ.text: I stayed at Tuscany for a weekend and ate here a few times over the course of the weekend. The food is excellent. My omelette was one of the best I've had in a long time. The only reason why I didn't give five stars is due to the service taking a long time on two out of three times I ate here.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Kn9huYoN4-CbIjveB9N4ig.text: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: The food is still of very high quality at a fair price ... but I sense some management cost-saving moves that require a one-star ding.  Now at 10pm, they hand out a VERY abbreviated graveyard menu. Instead of the full dinner menu I used to see all night long, that being a huge drawing point. The only True meal-deal on that menu is the $6 steggs. The rest of the menu looked more like a graveyard menu one would see at a typical 24/7 VP bar ... and for about the same price. Also I believe I noticed their very-popular dinner side, mac&cheese, has been dropped. I also overheard someone complaining that Friday night business has dropped off, since management changed the AYCE Crab Legs deal ... to a NOT AYCE Crab Legs deal.   Service was slower as well. I arrived just before 10pm on a weeknight and while I stood waiting to be greeted and seated, I watched no less than eight employees scampering about behind the two registers trying to pull-off a shift change. Eight people, two registers, really? I've seen shift-change here before and it was pretty seamless, never looking like this. My guess, new employees to replace veterans who moved to greener pastures after feeling the effects of these kinds of cost-saving moves.   From my arrival ... to seating ... to ordering ... to my salad arriving ... I'd say at least 35 minutes. Way too long for a casino diner. Especially one that was once voted "Best of Las Vegas." And the restaurant was only half-full. I've seen it full-to-capacity many times and with service running at least twice as quick. I noticed a lot of hustling on the floor during my meal, but it looked sort of disorganized. I heard a manager discreetly chide a veteran waiter for the entire floor running behind. I read the frustration in the waiter's face as "don't blame me for this mess." I had to specifically ask for more lemons, more napkins and my serving of bread. My waiter was trying to be attentive, but I think he was just spread too thin.   To be fair, I noticed the venue received a slight face-lift, with lighter colors of ivory paint & wallpaper that open up the space and make it more attractive & upscale.  And, again, the quality of the food was on-point, and the portions remained untarnished.   CONCLUSION: Proceed with caution.

mg8MjJxbGOKIl6AvPL2Ocg.text: Solid choice for a place open 24/7! It has an old school diner vibe with no frills in terms of decoration. They have an extensive menu for all of your needs, we opted for breakfast. I stuck with the Basic Breakfast and added turkey sausage on the side. My eggs were cooked as I asked and the sourdough bread was perfectly buttered! Service was great, but their coffee needs some improvement.

NvjoOGW90mr-RpaebI8osg.text: It was very busy when we were there but the wait was only a few minutes & our service was good. My husband got biscuits & gravy with a side of bacon & I went with the fitness scramble that had egg whites, green peppers, spinach, tomatoes & feta. His was really good. No complaints. Mine was horrible. The peppers were over cooked & the eggs stuck together in clumps. It basically tasted as bad as it looked in the picture. Thank goodness breakfast was crazy cheap...less than $20 for 2.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits &amp; gravy
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fitness scramble. Terrible!!!
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side bacon

uiFaK42iMdk2VGGRnoZzHw.text: I came here off a late flight. I'm no stranger to bang for your buck solid late night deals or gambler specials. Since I hardly had any lunch today and no dinner until midnight I needed some major sustenance!   I'm staying here at Tuscany Suites and I knew from staying here before that they have a graveyard special. Midnight (when the ghouls come out) until 5 am (when the vamps open their coffins to go to sleep), they have a bodacious steak and eggs special for $5.99. 6 oz. steak and 2 eggs your way with buttered toast and a good landing strip of hash browns.   Melfer took good care of me with water refills and bringing my food. I was expecting it to take a long time like previous reviews mentioned but I got mine in about 20-25 mintues. I ordered 2 of the specials. Yes, two! Hungry as F! It was either order 2 of the steak and egg specials or keel over from starvation!   Well, I took both plates down. Toast and all! Crush, hammer, destroy! I'm staying here for a few days so I might partake in more of their wares. The portions are good and fair for the price. Price as stated gets better from 12am-5am.   Good place to grease up after a night of partying! Give 'er a shot, you won't just visit once...

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very minor damage
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After. Yes took down a pair of specials!
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Before

iyXQ0WRWb-lbt_i90YeM7w.text: This is a must every time we come to Vegas.  The food is always good and the price is right.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.  This trip we only had time to go once but the breakfast was amazing.  Ask to sit in Alfredo section he will take care of you.

Wc-pCbU4W6FjSTOJJrvRHw.text: My boyfriend and I came here for breakfast last weekend before returning to San Diego.  All I can say was that it was alright, but I don't think I'd be returning.  I believe we arrived right before it got really busy.  Even though it looked busy inside the restaurant, there were still seats, so we got seated right away.  The service was actually pretty slow.  Our server took a while to actually greet us and ask us if we wanted anything to drink.  We both got Vegetarian Omelette's and two coffees (I don't eat meat and he didn't feel like eating any meat that morning).  The food took an awfully long time to come out.  The good thing is that the server communicated with us and told us that the food will be coming out soon and that it was crazy at the kitchen.  I appreciated this because we didn't even ask her where our food was, she approached us.  The omelette was pretty bland.  There wasn't much flavor and I don't think they added many if any seasoning.  It came with a side of hash browns and toast, which were both pretty okay.  The food wasn't that memorable.  The positives I can say about this place is the affordability.  A majority of the menu's prices are good deals considering how large to plates are.  However, the slow service and quality of the food overpowers the positive aspects of this restaurants review in my opinion.  If your looking for a breakfast spot on the more affordable side, I do recommend this place.  However, if you're looking for faster service and better quality food, I recommend you look somewhere else.

2Oe7Xhsqvt3_BJQAq39MmQ.text: My first time coming here didnt go so well, we had a rude waiter that didn't even bother bringing refills when asked let alone check on the table.  I was willing to give this place another try and was quite glad that I did, all my following visits went without a hitch. The service and food were worlds beyond my initial visit.  The 5.99 steak and eggs is my go to meal, always try to rush in after my graveyard shift to make it there before the deal is done for the day. I like to order it medium rare and my eggs over easy. They're constantly cooked to perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NqJfIo9Vd6j8nwtQUOugzw.text: This place has went way down hill , service is slow and even server says food takes 45 mins to come out !!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Under cooked hash browns !!
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is what passes as an omelette here !!

behk-jPFslDhjPPbwdsQAw.text: We really enjoyed the dinner here. Very reasonable prices, large portions. The cornbread was amazing. Did not have to wait for a table during dinner rush on a weekday. Ordered some grilled cheese to take back to the room. That was pretty awesome too with the house made chips w/ ranch. Girlfriend had the bbq ribs/chicken platter, pretty delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan Pasta  BBQ chicken and ribs

4dhz1-mSfAWSORr48XjJRg.text: Excellent customer service with a smile . Food was hot and good . I would've liked another minute on my waffle but that is just personal preference  . Coffee cup stayed full . I would definitely recommend this cafe to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles. Cornmeal breaded chicken strips well flavored and juicy .
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes.
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs   bacon , sausage grits...good home southern cookin.

hRSrY2_KkfpDqpYEei0Vkw.text: What better way to start any potential special day than with a breakfast special.  Marilyn's Cafe serves their very own 5.99 Steak & Eggs specials between 11pm to 5am.  A special taste that will remind you of a high quality home cooked meal, even while being on the road. While the low price of 5.99 will give you a taste of the old Vegas style values.  Additionally, Marilyn's Cafe also has nightly dinner specials. Meals varying from Roast Turkey to Fettuccini Alfredo Chicken, depending on which day of the week. My personal favorite is Steak and Lobster Tail Wednesday. Each meal meal costing less than 12.99. A great value for any night. A home cooked meal every night of week. Now that what makes these meals truly special.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r7ov8q0mBwdo4Dl8uvivhg.text: One of the best "unexpected gem" secrets that I found out about by a Las Vegas native. I would always come to Marilyn's Cafe after clubs in the AMs for their Steak n Eggs which is like $5.99 I believe?? This cafe is located in Tuscany Hotel which is kinda far from most clubs but worth the uber/lyft over.   I believe their Steak n Eggs special is usually in the middle of the night which is the perfect drunchies. You can order the steaks however you want (rare, medium rare, medium well, etc.), you can also order the eggs however style you want (poached, scrambled, sunny side up, etc.), and you can order whatever your 2 pieces of bread you want too (wheat or white). It also comes with a big piece of hash brown. DEFINITELY WORTH THE COST.   Service was pretty quick but the food sadly does take a long time to come out. Sometimes when it's busy, the wait for the food can feel like forever. However, once the food is out, the happiness begins because the food is bomb. I think it's one of the perfect ways to end a night. The steak is definitely worth more than the price you pay. The bread is probably my favorite part because they put butter over it and it tastes so good and toasted.  Definitely a must go to place for people should go to when they're in Vegas!! It's definitely exceeded my expectations and I can't wait to be back here

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Steak &amp; Eggs

d9_B4oMDZCHw5GavrQ_FSA.text: Don't kid yourself here... This place is the late night king When you want a steak.  Close proximity From all of the major clubs And always open.  This place has brought me Back from the dead numerous Times in my career.  The servers are great, But we are here for the steak And eggs with two toast.  No A-1 sauce but  Lea & Perrings does the job. Get the fried mushrooms!  Best in the city For steggs that is priced just right. Medium rare though...

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. steak and eggs with wheat toast

8sW267EaeaiPrAk1Ksx2kg.text: Awesome awesome awesome!  My whole family is a huge fan of the midnight special.  Steak and eggs, $4.99, and the quality can't be beat!  We stop in every time we come to Vegas.  My kid is a night owl and even if we are dragging on our first night in Vegas, she'll ask us to stay up and go.  And we wind up happy about it every time!  On our last trip, two years ago, the steak was good.  Now it's a dollar more for the special, and the steak is great!  And the rest.  This restaurant can actually deliver an egg over easy.  It's perfect every time.  The toast, buttery and filling.  Hash browns, nice and tasty, well cooked and not overdone.  You need to know what's on at what time when you come in.  The $4.99 special is midnight to 5 AM, but a regular breakfast special for $7.99 is available mornings.  Or fill up on pancakes for...memory is a bit dim but I think it's $3.99 around the clock.  Be sure to tip your waiter on something like what the actual price would be.  Service is good and regular, ours always keep our drinks filled.  Hit the casino for laughs with the Judge Judy slots behind the cafe, or just hit the video poker up the aisle.

hf_zj3QdYJ04xv62_A4swA.text: Came on Friday for the AYCE crab legs for $20. There will be a wait, but it is definitely worth it. I came with a group of 10 and we have never received this type of service on top of that we were STARVING. Only reason I gave this place 4 stars is because they told us we had a 30 minute wait but it ended up being 1 hour... They will drown you with crabs!! They bring plates of crabs out before you are even finished with your plate! They were delicious   definitely come here if you love crab legs!!

7N6iOj3DOdqFEBrSGvoQGg.text: Came back here this pass weekend and they were $3.99.   I think because it was holiday weekend they up their price. But my steak and eggs were definitely on point! We went to the Victorian Room at Bills I think it was, right across from Ceasars and it made me regret not coming here instead.  So if you want some yummy decent Steak and Eggs for the price. Definitely come here!  Also don't complain about the steak, it's $3.99 people so don't expect a steak from Donavon's. Lower your standards.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Eggs
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ujS9AfFerB4tCKGe0r9Hbw.text: Most of the food and prices are pretty good, with a couple of exceptions. They usually don't include some of their specials on the menu and you have to ask.

Y5vm9AtPZ6jBT65lgwMdCA.text: I'm biased. The only thing I order here is $4.99 steak and eggs.   I can't get over that for $5 I can get a legit meal of steak, eggs, hashbrowns, and toast. (Medium steak with over medium eggs.. yee) . It's perfect after clubbing food. It's also great that its 24 hours. Also, the service there was pretty good. It was 2 am and the guy working was still peppy. Props to you man!

1Kd25tyhc7RAPFuPuA-y6w.text: Stopped by for a late dinner before retiring to our room next door. Was really amazed by the portion sizes and cost. Was a good price with plenty of food. We ate and had left offers to bring home.  The service was really nice and quick.  Definitely coming back before we head home.

nMkiYobC4QFwl90pF-elOA.text: WHOA. Steak and eggs. So cheap. It's ONLY whopping $5.99!!! Great drunchies for sure!! The best part, I didn't go when i was drunk. But it was that goodddd for the price! Check it out :)

l7rmEcTYkMG6E_RZ8WWSVA.text: Good quality breakfast, cheap prices, and very attentive service. Yelp saved the day again.  Surprisingly, the cafe wasn't crowded for a Saturday morning.

mpP3ZMPTbAqSxPS3v3ve5g.text: This place serves a variety of really good food for a quiet 24-hour restaurant off the strip. My boyfriend and I came at 2AM because we were craving food. Their appetizer menu and side items made it really easy for those of us who want to just munch on something instead of having a whole meal. The to-go section was a very short wait and the waiters were really polite and helpful.  We ordered gravy fries which tastes better than it sounds. They gave us way more than what $3 worth of fries should be worth and successfully sent my boyfriend into the food coma he wanted.  If you're staying in the Tuscany, this place is worth trying if you come back after a long night and need some quick easy food in the proximity of your hotel room.

yQNf4IrCTorQtIRMjjaC2g.text: Not bad but not great. Hostess was not friendly and the buffalo chicken was cold and not much spice to it.

kEccA28tWZgAwuBbVXK2CQ.text: Service is great as well as the food.  A great local spot.  Daily specials and breakfast specials are competitive with everyone else.

Uuj0tv3IbuBZscLq__PJAg.text: Went here for a well priced steak and it delivered. I got the prime rib and it was cooked to perfection. The server was very nice and the prices were good. The atmosphere is a typical cafe, nothing fancy. If you get a players card you can get a 10% off coupon. The only reason I didn't give more stars was the sides weren't great. The green beans were over cooked to my liking and the baked potato could have been cooked longer. But the meat was good and that was most important to me.

apCMrigWa9XxGTcT3FVNpw.text: Good food for a casino breakfast. Good service and fairly cheap. Easy seating quick service, in and out

7R43d3g2LYn3s9hrQh3fGg.text: Decent food and big portions. Slow but friendly service. Have to walk through the smoky casino to get to the cafe. They have a service charge of 18% if you have 6 or more people (which I think is ridiculous!).

LMTYoMYNrkUC4SJxV6lJnA.text: Horrible!! Run! The manager is (I'm sorry to say) a fucking idiot! When I complained about my food he said to our waiter "please take the coffee off their bill please" ha what a joke! Never again! Yuck! Everything is frozen and microwaved!!!

gX0BHHTooul0zCax45ByJg.text: I've eaten here more than I'd like. It was really good 7 - 10 years ago. It's gone downhill sice then. Even when the cook of the evening is bad, I could mozzarella sticks and fries. Not now. Even they're horrible. So is the service. Too bad. Probably hit by recession, like so many.

d8p3v7dOS6FGS3w5RfizxQ.text: I would give this place no stars if able. But I have to give it one star. The service was slow. They would NOT split our checks and there were only 7 of us. It caused lot's of confusion at the check out register.  Our server was Saida. She was working her butt off for all of her tables.  At the register the manager on duty Dana was rude, unwilling to accommodate our party. It was very busy and it took 45 minutes to get our food. Which was not good at all. It was crap all around. My son ordered a vanilla milkshake that was 2 scoops of ice cream and milk not blended.  We called it a vanilla milk float. I will never eat at this cafe again and The Tuscany Suites & Casino will never get a dime of ours again.

73qm68Xv_Ey4JsRrirMm8Q.text: Pretty good and super cheap! I had a breakfast that consisted of eggs bacon sausage pancakes toast ham and it only cost $9. They have steak n eggs for $5 as a special. Off the strip with easy parking.

R5Hj5ONHFMI7K0siv_0V9g.text: MMMM...that $5 steak. What a deal! We left EDC early for this deal, totally worth it! You have to ask for their steak special though since it isn't listed on their menu. I ordered medium rare steak and over easy eggs which comes with hash browns and toasts. YUUM!! So cheap and you get what you pay for!  This place makes me happy because come on! nowadays, food is just overpriced and finding places that offer deals like this just makes me happy. The food is good and fulfilling; they give you more than what you pay for. Not to mention, the service is awesome too! KUDOS to the lady that served us that night! She was so nice! She made sure that we got what we ordered, went back a few times to check up on us and asked if we needed anything else. AWESOME deal and AMAZING staff? This place deserves 5 stars! Way to go, Marilyn's Cafe!! (:

scO0Xl3pSYBdIJ1XbQ-dVQ.text: first our food was 45 minutes late, the server saida was great. They told us we could split our checks for a party of 7. We got up to the front counter in front of all of the other people, was told by a manager that they were not going to split our checks and embarrassed us. We had to come up with cash money, our server did not get ila tip, and they told us they were going to write her up. I have gone to this place multiple times and it was wonderful, but this was hands down the worst experience ever!. We actually went and talked to management ).   the manager on duty,  Her name was Dana.... She should be fired.

ABlitrBvVmm3zpz2or8NyA.text: I'm giving 4 stars because I've yet to try anything on the menu but the all you can eat crab legs on Friday evenings but if I were to rate that I'd give it a 5. This is the best place I've found in Vegas so far to have all you can eat crab that's not the buffet!

pdaCOd0PBdQRuA69tBxT8g.text: All you can eat crab legs on Fridays for around $20 makes Marilyn's an unbeatable option.  The crab legs were cooked well, there was plenty of butter, and the waiter was prompt with our reorders.  Unbeatable deal!

E_KAxzS-j9P8baSzdsXttA.text: We had breakfast. Sausage Omelet and pancakes.  Most of it was left on the plate after we ate.  All the ingredients of the omelette was cooked separately then folded in the cooked egg, held together by the cheese. The sausage was almost beef jerky like, if I had cooked it in the microwave then cut it to put in the omelette I might achieve the same result.    Breakfast was just horrible. McDonald's is a better choice

KRutUdN6pN77LlOECWWAlA.text: Keeping a quiet night here in Vegas so I decided to order room service for a quick dinner. Pleasantly surprised, Grilled Pork Chops ($10.99) - both 8 oz chops are well cooked and well seasoned. All entrees are served with two side items of your choice. I ordered steamed broccoli and apple sauce along with a side garden salad ($2.99) and a last minute impulse order of cornbread ($2.69) - which is hot, buttery, and sweet served with whipped salty butter.  Ps. All of their portions are huuuuuge.  If you are looking to grab a quick filling bite with immediate service, Marilyn's Cafe gets a thumb up in my book.   * Room service hours run from 6am-10pm * $10 minimum service fee * 18% gratuity

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0jkSZFMb1xH48PbYflmmdw.text: We came here because we didn't want to wait very long for breakfast at some of the other options in the area.   Long story short, it took them 45 minutes to get our drinks from the bar, and then more than an hour to get us our food. Which wasn't anything special. It's all your standard American breakfast fare, done without much variation.   We didn't wait long to be seated, but it took forever to get serviced and our food. Ultimately, I won't be coming back.

QxfPa-eeC_9smw8d330DRA.text: Ask for James! For sure he works Friday and Saturday late nights. He makes four AM seems like any time of the day and has GREAT local suggestions!  $5.99 for Steak & Eggs (Wheat bread, medium rare steak, over medium eggs for me please!) A perfect place to venture out to after the club at 4AM to help ease the hangover you may have the next day. My favorite part are the crispy hash browns that come with your meal!   Only one time has our service not been great & it was probably because James was not our waiter. A friend was baffled because he had some blue pieces of fat and let the waitress know. She kind of apologized, but also didn't care. "It's just the blue stamp they put on meat sometimes" & he asked, "Shouldn't they cut it off though?" & she kind of just blew him off. We get it, it's late and tips aren't great on cheap meals.  They do not do split checks between the hours of 4PM & 5AM! So bring cash or bring a friend that has a high credit card balance and Venmo.

lzUXlr1VgJ9V21_jzDgOXQ.text: Ordered room service from Marilyn's while staying at the Tuscany. The service was very quick (was well within the estimated 30 minutes quoted), and the pizza was tasty. I order the personal BBQ chicken pizza. The crust was crispy and the sauce was very generous. Also, the delivery guy was kind enough to point out that the tip was already included when I went to tip him. He could have easily taken the extra cash. The honesty was very refreshing to see. Room service prices were extremely reasonable.

tMpr-52c61REgpKP8pib3w.text: Seriously go somewhere else. The service sucks incredibly bad. For one we waited forever at the hostess stand without even a greeting or asking how many are in our party & telling us the wait time like most places do. Instead many employees went to the stand and ignored us and others waiting. Like we weren't even there.  Then after finally seated,  I kid you not... 20 minuttes of awkwardly sitting there before a server came and got our drink order. Prob took another 10 min to get drinks to us. The Orange juice was nasty & server forgot my water I asked for. Tried drinking the OJ anyway but really it wasn't good so I asked for the water again. Water... even worse! But that might be a Vegas tap water issue...  Tasted like dirty water. Anyway, We had already read the menu so ordered when we put our drink order in. The food was decent but not amazing or anything.  Resturant was cute and reasonably priced. Those are the only good things I noticed about this place and I try to be a very positive yelper. They were busy-ish but still had many open tables so I don't know what the deal was here...

oplH1ontVCCNs_N_urdqpg.text: The service bad... and they take lot time for make the food... thats suck!! 45min??? I never come back

qeDBdOOz_dzdC_t7rfttUg.text: I'm a regular here & I always anticipate consistent results with my same order.  I usually get the $5.99 after midnight steak & eggs special.  The medium rare steak I get is very consistent.  I did get side of green beans one time & that quickly became my favorite side order.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vnWRo1X2NLe2L07OeErTaQ.text: Delicious food, great value and great service. They have gluten free pancakes in all kinds of flavors. Great diner specials each night and the steak and lobster was so good! Portions are huge!

ILKv3SxK3cKEHb0TuGf2ZA.text: $6 for two eggs any style, hash brown, 2 slices of toast, and steak prepared any way you like it? I'm in! This place is the place to go when you're in Vegas. I definitely recommend this place after a night of clubbing or drinking because this place is open 24/7 and it's super cheap!   This restaurant has great service and is customer friendly! The restaurant is located in the Tuscany hotel and casino a little off the strip but I highly recommend it for those who like to eat late!
