photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak (medium) and over easy eggs with wheat toast and hash brown all for $6

UduQfI9rlS6vyVXv5-vsMw.text: Went here to try their all you can eat crab legs. I had  read there is always a line so we went early. They start serving at 4pm. We were there at 5 and there was no wait. The service was amazing. I never had to wait for a refill. The amount of crab legs that they serve was a full plate. It was delicious, I had 3 plates full! If you love crab legs like I do, I would highly reccommend this place. We will definately be back nect time we're in town.

XJm0-S5ioB8JiuRYv48hFA.text: Hidden inside the casino area of The Tuscany Suites & Casino, this place is a gem that's close enough to walk from the strip but just far enough that the prices aren't jacked up for tourists.   What we got: - Pot roast with mac and cheese, mash potatoes and house salad with Caesar dressing $12. This was excellent. I loved the pot roast and was surprised at how soft/moist the meat was. The mash potato got raving reviews from my boyfriend and I was impressed with how tasting it was. The mac and cheese was a bit watery, not the best but not bad either.  - Coffee (unlimited) $2.39 I had 5 cups of this stuff and it was GREAT! I had several servers come by during to top me off with more fresh coffee before I was even done. The awesome staff even gave me a to-go cup!   - Tilapia with mac and cheese and broccoli $10  The fish tasted fresh and the side of broccoli was MASSIVE.  - Coke with Grenadine (unlimited) $2.39 Too sweet for me but the boyfriend loved it :)  Service - Was a bit bumpy at first because they seemed to be short staffed. There was a wait to get our orders taken and a wait to get our orders but after that the service picked up and staff was very attentive. A man who seemed like the manager was going around to each booth making sure we were all enjoying ourselves and then he followed up with me to ask if i wanted more coffee LOL, at this point I felt like an addict so I had to politely decline. Then I saw him giving out hugs to some elderly customers and thought that was really amazing customer service.  Totally worth it and I would gladly come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A lot more coffee lol
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot roast
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side salad

u3JwEY48p4SjvGh6Dsitqg.text: I reall enjoy this place kinda old school clean the food is great and is a break from the hustle and bustle off the strip I make it a point to stop by each year when I come to Vegas and the food is awesome with large portions I can't think of anything bad to say about this place .Anyway see you next year

Bw3YPXemro6klvAv8mxJmg.text: YES. Probably my go to now post clubbing.  Came in on Saturday night after an extremely long day of drowning myself in alcohol and got me a good ol' steak & two eggs.   Lots of food for such low prices - comes with a piece of steak (I wish I knew how many ounces), hash browns, 2 eggs, and bread. Ordered my steak medium rare with eggs over easy. Steak was cooked perfectly and my egg yolks were still nice and runny. Everything was seasoned perfectly.   Got the bill and what? Only 5.99 for that much food?! Both tummy AND wallet left extremely happy. :)

WsZOQEi2ngehXOTHOif5MA.text: Wanted to make it out here for steak and eggs (supposedly $6) between 12am and 5am. The club gods were not kind to us, so at 3am we went back to the hotel instead of having food.  Steak and eggs were still on our minds the next day, so we came out here before heading back home. It's $13 during normal hours, but you get 8 oz of steak, 2 eggs, 2 pieces of toast (we opted for English muffin) and hashbrowns.  Service was quite slow due to large parties, even though the restaurant was not full. The food was really good - not sure if that's due to my hangover state or the actual food. The steak was cooked nicely, although a bit more on the rare side of my medium rare than usual. It could've used more spices. But then, I'm not judging it like a steakhouse, considering for my one steak at CUT in LA I could've gotten 10 of these.  Tip: ask for the butter on the side. There was so much butter on all the toast/english muffin/etc that one of my friends thought she got a grilled cheese instead of toast before biting into it...  Overall, good cheap-ish option. Would have totally given this a 5 star if I had the $6 steak and eggs. Ah well, there's always next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs for breakfast

BLeR-vNUpgGiW49WJZs2cA.text: Marilyn's Cafe is located inside the Tuscany Suites Hotel.  It is their go-to restaurant for the hotel.  Basic food and should be easy to get in and out.  It was not.  The service was sub-par.  The wait staff seemed overworked and overloaded by the large groups we had.  The management knew there was a huge event in the hotel but didn't seem to book more staff to cover the overload.    The staff were nice but just couldn't keep up. Plus, the management decided mid-stream that he would not allow split checks.  So, when we had had a split check one day, the next we couldn't.    The food was basic diner food.  Nothing special.  But then, you don't need fancy for every meal in Vegas.  If the service had been better, we would have eaten there more.  After one particularly tedious two hour breakfast, we were over it and ate elsewhere for the rest of our stay.

_AWkE5AvQxKJoGx4VUcC9Q.text: Crab legs were on everyone's minds tonight. We only had snacks on the way to Las Vegas today so we were ready to eat.   At 9:45pm, the line took 5 minutes and they still seemed busy. John, our first server, was close to ending his shift and rushed us through the ordering process. When we got our food it was barely warm and drinks had to be requested twice. We were not impressed. I didn't know what to say to the family as I remember the cafe as being quite good for the price. We ordered a second round of crab plates when John disappeared without a word. No waiter, no crab, no drink refills.   I was about to approach the manager. And another waiter saw my distress. James saved the day. He has a smile, customer skills, and took responsibility for making the rest of our dining an event and fun. He was there with drinks, hot sides of potato chips, and steaming hot tasty plates of crab. Thanks Marilyn's Cafe. We had a great time. John almost lost the place a few customers. But thanks to James and Sonia for making it pleasant.   On Fridays, arrive early (at 4pm) or late (just before 10pm ). The staff said the wait can be up to 2 hours otherwise. Ask for James and tip him well, hard worker.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs, loaded potato and homemade chips

D-x861ZSBDX5sipP0r0Avw.text: == Review is just for the Steak & Eggs ==  Everytime i hit up sin city I have to have Steak & Eggs. Love Love Love em!!! By far of all the spots I've tried close to the strip, Marilyn's Cafe is by far the best (aside from Mr. Lucky's 24-7) in terms of cost & quality. It's nothing super duper special but a great place to get your fix.   Very friendly servers. Service is pretty on spot here except one time they were super super slow and the restaurant was 3/4 empty. By not means is this an upscale, fancy cafe. There is no modern decor nor an ambiance. Just a simple, old-school cafe & serves yummy bfast. There are various tables & booth seatings.  :: FOOD ::  STEAK & EGGS BFAST SPEICAL    (5/5)  - Price of $8.99 (6AM -11AM Daily)  - 6oz tender NY Strip  - 2 eggs any style  - Hasbrowns, Toast or 2 Pancakes  OJ    (2.5/5)  - not fresh squeezed, taste wise mehhhh.... wouldn't order again.  COFFEE   (3/5)  - very light roasted taste, sorta does the work just to get the morning going

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 9/7/14: $8 Steak n Over Easy Eggs

e7NlcYWoLARw62VzAevPGg.text: Once you lose/drop $11,840 at the casinos/clubs/pool parties and you are flat-broke...and hungry...trek over to this nondescript hotel/casino off the Vegas Blvd.  You can use your last $7.00 in the world to buy chicken n waffles and a coffee.  I witnessed 27 Filipino people eating and working in this old-school Vegas diner.  ...so where the F is the white rice on the menu?!

Vjo6oyC_9TiRHQprjercqQ.text: Hey guys we decided to check out Marilyn's Cafe after a night of margaritas. We were looking for mimosas and a decent breakfast.. This place certainly delivered!  Ambiance: Basic decor, the lighting is somewhat offputting and it felt a bit empty inside. It felt like we heard echoing but definitely clean.  Service: Wonderful service. We got seated right away. Everyone was well dressed. Our busser served us ice cold waters straight from lake minatonka and classic mimosas. Our server Noe was exceptional! Very professional and his timing was perfect. He even checked on us for additional napkins... it's those little things that set apart the service ya know? ;)  Food: Wolf got the chicken and waffles. It was served with syrup, a dollop of butter, and a side of ranch. The Belgian waffle was really good. My wolf really loves his syrup! You can even upgrade to the real deal pure maple for a charge. You can also add fruit and whipped cream. The chicken was surprisingly moist, it looked like it would be dry but it wasn't! Theres a burst of buttermilk flavor from the corn flake coating.  Kitty got the basic breakfast, eggs over medium cooked well. It came with choice of hash or grits and the hash was satisfying. She added a half order of biscuits and gravy,, that was probably the only disappointing feature if the breakfast. Rather bland and it came out room temp. Biscuits were only okay.  Will HOWL&MEOW  return? Most definitely!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Central Dining Area.
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; waffles, side of hash.
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa. #hairofthehound

B9PqGSTbBdkvLsx821t0DA.text: What a surprise!  The daily special was steak and lobster. The service was quick and friendly. We are staying at the hotel so the restaurant is very handy.   The quality of the food is good for the price. Everything was cooked to order and extremely tasty. Again, my wife and I we pleasantly surprised. We will be eating here several times during our 4 day stay in Las Vegas.

xzsJ0rzw6rfzGxZVNwi_vw.text: Before we left Vegas we decided to eat here for brunch. The parking was packed but more open spaces were found on the side of the hotel.    As expected, Sunday morning brunch was crowded but we were seated, ordered our food and ate; all within 20 minutes. It was surprisingly better than I had expected. The dining area though busy, seemed clean and the bathroom decent.    A "hidden fishing hole" as far as brunch is concerned. Consider coming here for some good eats!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ggNh0TstP-6s-ndkM5KCbQ.text: 5.99 steak and eggs ends at 5am. Come early enough to make sure you get your order in before 5.   Came here and sat waiting for 15 minutes for someone to take our orders. There were about 10 cleaning staff mopping and 3 servers with 2 host/hostess at the front. Didn't get orders in until after 5, but we had to wait for over 15 min and had to plead our case to get the special order. Long story short, we got the special, but only after speaking with the waitress and the manager. 3 bucks doesn't matter, but what matters is don't blame the customer for waiting patiently and then telling them sorry you didn't make it in time. It's about the principle, about customer service, and valuing your consumer- we enjoy coming here for the experience with friends, for the special, and for convenience. Overall we appreciate the ability that the manager remedied the situation and make what seemed an impossible time and  'computer' problem into a possible "we'll make it happen" positive experience!  Food was great- no complaints there! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In reality 3 servers 10 cleaning staff that morning.Must&#39;ve had the floor mopped 7 times while sitting at the table waiting for a server.
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs! 5.99 still

Dr0NRnvaQxKlgLFC8ICjPA.text: If you're looking for affordable food, close to the Vegas strip, with excellent service come to Marilyn's Cafe! I was pleasantly surprised with my experience here! I am staying at a hotel on the strip, but I wanted to find somewhere more affordable to have breakfast. We decided to walk from our hotel, it took us about 20 minutes but it was all worth it.  Right when we were seated we were asked what we wanted to drink, and then our waitress stopped by to take our order immediately after. Our waitress was very friendly and checked on us multiple times. She made sure our drinks were never empty, and that we were satisfied.  The food here is delicious, and the servings are a decent size. I will definitely be back here to have breakfast again, (or even lunch or dinner) before I end my vacation, this place is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marilyn&#39;s starter. So good!

uemUIRgUvFkKt9i6V9f_kQ.text: Marilyn's was the best part of staying at the lovely Tuscany suites!  Tucked into the back of the casino, at different times we went it was either quiet or very, very packed. But every time the service was quick and very friendly.  They have food for all budgets and the menu is overwhelmingly cheap, and the service was just as good when we went in for a beer and sharing chilli cheese fries as it was when we went in for a full dinner. Our food always came quickly and we never had to wait long to order or get our bill   My favourite was having the New York strip steak (very reasonably priced) with a choice of sides. Would happily return next time we're in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12oz NY Strip Steak

D4BVff7SQpo7epEkaddzPA.text: You know what? - I don't even care that this is in a crappy hotel casino 5 blocks off the strip.   Marilyn's Cafe is a super legit, super friendly, super fast, reasonably priced breakfast joint. The menu is huge - plenty of options for even the pickiest of eaters. The food came out fast, hot and delicious. There is plenty of seating, so no wait here.   Now is the ambiance that of a high end Vegas, boutique breakfast location? - no. Not even close. But, I'd come back and recommend if you need a good meal, you stop in as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior

-SfJiaC0eBhu7XilSZQwig.text: If there were such a thing as a low budget restaurant, Marilyn's Cafe would be it. The food was decent, but you could tell it was prepared  with low quality ingredients. We ended up there because we were pressed for time and it was convenient.  I ordered the French toast with scrambled  eggs, sausage and bacon. I didn't  care for the  sausage patties at all, but everything else was ok. The French toast wasn't made with Texas toast so the bread was thin. Maple syrup is usually pretty thick, but this syrup wasn't... it was as if it was watered down or something. The OJ was darker than usual too. It obviously came from concentrate, but it was as if they neglected to mix it with water before bringing it to the table. We went it back and opted for water instead.  On top of that the service wasn't done with smile. Our waitress was a middle aged, Asian women. I don't recall her name, but she was pleasantly plump and wore a constant scowl. She wasn't exactly a ray of sunshine. She did come back to the to check on us, but that's the only good thing I have to say about her service. A regular patron came in and sat adjacent to our table while we ate. Our waitress perked up and greeted them with the most enthusiastic smile. Her entire demeanor and body language changed. It was weird...  The place was clean though and the prices were reasonable. I wouldn't visit again, but wouldn't discourage anyone from giving it a shot.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OJ - It&#39;s  hard to see in the  picture,  but it was very dark. Definitely a genetic brand.
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast breakfast

yQjq5u1udY_BHfDSkr-vFQ.text: Such a hidden gem! Won't break the bank either. This was our second year in a row going on our last day in Vegas and the food is so good. Everything was cooked to perfection. Agnes was our server for the second year in a row and she is the best! Thank you for the best service Agnes! We'll continue to come every time we are in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Steak &amp; Eggs Sweet Potato Waffle Fries

BaPPxjmmNz76n01UL7Y3iA.text: Meh. The usual blandness you expect from a hotel cafe. Waited a long time for both food and drink, and all of my food came out cold

S5fMXcKFVl00iYTd79E6ZQ.text: Nothing fancy here - just good food and great personal service at a head shaking inexpensive price.  No stress here as it's a complete pleasant experience that's relatively quiet; you can actually hold a conversation without a megaphone.  This was a wonderful find for me

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A little healthy fitness breakfast with a touch of an indulgence

3xkYnA7zS5tahVmLeyGmVg.text: Marilyn's Cafe nestled inside The Tuscany Suites & Casino Off East Flamingo Rd. Serves up Home style cooking at its best away from home. We had family stay at the Tuscany the week of August 11. Our 80 yr young aunt enjoyed dining there. We had breakfast, lunch and Dinner.  It's definitely a busy restaurant but the hostess and wait staff really cater to your every need. Take it from me, I'm a very picky eater. I was drinking coffee for the 1st time. What an experience for us all...Lol  Very comfortable and inviting place to either start the day or unwind from the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas day life.   We had a smorgasbord over the week, steak & Eggs $10.99, Marilyn's Starter Breakfast $8.49, Eggs Benedict $8.99, French Toast $9.49. Lunch: chicken Salad, Grilled or Crispy &9.99, Marilyn's Chili $6.99, Patty Melt $8.99, New York Steak Sandwich $10.99 They also have daily specials. It's family friendly and not cost breaking on the pocketbook. Thankfully we had the same magnificent waitress all week..Rizza. If one of us was missing from the group, Rizza noticed. When we placed to go orders, she always made it at the end of the meal so it was at its hottest. Rizza made our family vacation memorable. Certainly an asset. So if you're near Tuscany Suites & Casino stop by Marilyn's Cafe for an Away from home cooked meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plain Waffle
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Multi Grain Pancakes, Crispy Bacon, Scramble Eggs
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build Your Own Omelette, Grits, Rye Toast

-lOJ_gUg-UOPwpWhCnvEPw.text: I was hungry for steak and eggs. Did a search and this was close by. I seen the person who brought me my drinks more then the waiter. Ordered the steak rare it was medium. Eggs slightly over cooked. Won't return.

V8eKL4WBZjPAgZSjRDM2NQ.text: Steak eggs pancakes Lasagna  Grits, cheese and eggs with wheat toast All served at the same table at 3PM on a Thursday afternoon.  Sal our waiter has been with Tuscany 12 - 14 years from our math and he says "you never complain". I say "you always get it right". And a good time was had by all.   Hubby had lasagna and enjoyed it immensely. Finchum had the additional surprise "pancakes for me". Of course we didn't release the table for too long. We made up for it in a great tip. Sal graciously posed for pictures and gave us extra attention. I believe he has a photographic memory.  24/7/365 any meal you want cooked to order with a better than decent cost to portion ratio. A Las Vegas slightly off the "Strip" secret

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sal is surely the best wait staffer at the cafe! And cute too
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Always enjoys his customers
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. St T - Bone &amp; Eggs long time Cafe stalker

6nGygzWgPxx1CFw-POlPJQ.text: We had server Alfredo twice now. Excellent.   Usually good food but other than veggie burger, fruit plate, or spaghetti... not much for vegetarians unless you eat eggs.  Good service with the exception of a rather imperious tall woman whose  approach is cold,  as she smiles tersely through tensed jaw muscles,  'Wound you like anything to drink?'   It's the desert, so we say yes, through withered and parched lips.   She then smiles,  after confirming our need.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good luck trying to get 500 points in a day.
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FmKh0V3xe2Hp6tlYOxNFuQ.text: This is our absolute favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. They are located conveniently off strip in Tuscany Suites so parking is never an issue. Open 24/7  and the food is hot, fresh, served fast and tastes great  The staff here are friendly and know when to refill your drinks. The third shift manager is amazing and runs a great place. The food selection is wide yet not too much we have never had a bad experience here.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken sandwich and fries and a personal pizza

1hCQuYI8qfrqsvAEjiDSpQ.text: Solid breakfast! We had just arrived at the Tuscany from a very long red eye flight and needed to wait until 0900 for our room to be ready. Coincidentally, we were also starving. So, this was it!   Now for full disclosure, I'm not the type of guy to go out of my way to eat at an average casino cafe, but I just might for this one.   Fast service, decent pricing, and really good grub! The only glitch, the gravy for the biscuits and gravy was extremely "peppery." Now clearly all cooks have an off day now and again, so I'll take this with a grain of salt, er, pepper! However, you'd think a little taste testing would occur now and again.   In any case, we liked it, and I think you will too.   Cheers!

EpCLtGtEB20FsqbHVGP5Bg.text: Here I was introduced to an outstanding Meat Loaf entree like one's mother used to bake in the home kitchen, with creamy Mashed Potatoes and beautiful, snow white Steamed Cauliflower.  This was preceded by a quite ample side salad and complimentary Italian Bread and butter, along with excellent homemade Corn Bread.  My fellow dining companions partook of Grilled Fish with Loaded Hash Browns, and Grilled Chicken Breast with a Baked Potato.  All portions were large, and all pronounced very tasty.  Best of all, Marilyn's is open 24 hours, and provides great value for the money charged.  It is a fine coffee shop serving exemplary comfort food.

tmzj1RNIGzvEtRI7MFw_Kg.text: Came here twice during my stay at the Tuscany Suites Hotel. Decently priced, got what you need. I enjoyed it, especially after a night of drinking or the breakfast afterwards...  Not the most amazing menu selection but it does the job. Would I come again? Yes. Was the quality amazing? It was alright.  Sometimes you just got to get some food in your belly after a long day out in Vegas and on a budget.

-mJOyutfSPUvTiraV6Uk4A.text: All you can eat crab!  It was good and plentiful. I was shocked at how good it was. Hot butter and plenty of lemon. Great service. I couldn't have eaten more. They are very generous with the crab. Some places give you a plate and forget you. Not here. Yes it's loud but that's a small price to pay!

DMHXXl_Dwlt30P5PR7zhPQ.text: Best 24 hour cafe in Vegas and best kept secret!!!   It's inside good ol Tuscany! They don't even advertise it, but they have Steak, Eggs, and Hashbrowns for $3.99.  You definitely cannot beat that anywhere on the Vegas strip, that's for sure.  If you are a hotel guest, they even give you coupons and you can get 2 for 1 pizzas at Marilyn's...overall this cafe is the bomb-bizzle.    Customer service is wonderful also.  The staff is always super friendly and attentive.  Yeah for Marilyn's!!

d2bNPhqs5tsqhrSzc8aJuw.text: This place is just okay on the border of average and below that. My husband got baby back ribs. The flavor was good but it was severely over cooked . The texture was just horrible. I got the southern  fried chicken and again it was super dry and overcooked .Plus the service was super slow. All I can say is that you should really learn your meat temperatures. Good luck

dfGdWkXTzG9QvwzrhDQa0g.text: Omg! So glad I found this place on yelp!! Delicious!!! Visited for breakfast on Sunday November 9, 2014. Best scrambled eggs with cheese!! Perfectly cooked, nice and moist. Pancakes were perfect, hash browns and sausage perfectly cooked! Server was a sweetheart too. Entire bill came out to 12 bucks!! Cheap and good!! Highly recommend!!! I'll be back!!

Q2gbzh7VHpRyHE9WEBUTcg.text: My husband and I ate here over the weekend and had the prime rib dinner and it was delicious.  The food came very quickly and the service was very good.  I ordered a side salad expecting it to be tiny and it was actually large enough for both of us to share .  If you are looking for a good meal at a great price check out Marilyn's Cafe.

lYk_xmPc68yL3s_rW4annw.text: Came here for the steak and eggs like everyone else. I was kind of disappointed. From the pictures that I had seen of the meal, it looked WAY better in pictures than in real life. The steak was really fatty and not very tasty, but hey it's a damn cheap meal and I'm fine with that after being out all night.

1LTMTy2pVB_9NbNDBgjc3w.text: We were a group of 12 and sat us right away ... Awesome service , great food ..great prices...deff would come back ...

JY1dbAD6nQMCspfd2YrKYQ.text: Ok I don't want to get into too much detail, but look up the symptoms for Salmonella poisoning, both my friend and I had all of the symptoms within 36 hours of eating chicken at this place.  More egregious, was the service.  First, we decided to try to expand out lunch options.  There was a $10 off coupon in the local paper and the place is located near UNLV where we both work.  When we got there and were seated, we were optimistic when we saw the variety of options on the menu, we were confident that we had found a new lunch spot.  Sooooo at 12:05 we still hadn't receive my chicken Caesar wrap with sweet potatoes waffle fries or my friend's grilled chicken salad.  Nor had we seen the waitress or bus boy to refresh our drinks, that was until they walked into the room from some obscure place together after a half hour. . .We flagged them both down asked for drink refills twice and to please check on our meals as we were on our lunch hour.  Out came my meal with waffle fries that were not even warm to the touch. I sent them back and ate half of my wrap.  It had kind of an odd taste but I attribute it to strong feta cheese.  My friend asked for no dressing with her salad but asked for vinegar . . . The waitress brought her a bottle with about a quarter inch of brown liquid in it and said this is vinegar.  It wasn't.  It was soy sauce, so that went back. . .  We asked to talk to the manager; we had to ask four people to speak to the manager until he finally begrudgingly came over.  He began with "You are already unhappy so there is nothing I can say to make it better"  That is it. . .He would not even take care of the worse meal I have ever eaten in my life. . .which lead to 3 days of major illness.  STAY AWAY.

U_V366dqyY6IW5LGUmZWNA.text: What's more better after the club than sleep or drink more (for you alchys, jk) ? EAT! haha! after the night of burning calories from dancing it got me hungry and my friends & I all decided to hit up Tuscany for steak & eggs!! WOW $4.99 for steak, eggs, hash browns, and toast that is such a great deal! It took awhile for the food to come out but oh well it was worth the wait! I was a bit bummed that my steak was more on the almost well done side than medium-well. All our steaks were not all correctly cooked to what we wanted but hey it was only $4.99 and it's late so maybe the cooks were tired too lol Definitely a spot to hit up for some late night grubbin!

RWettalEsXOdrpvXvbx57w.text: Price was great for all-you can eat pancakes - honestly though, I couldn't even finish the first plate - they are huge.  I got a side of corned beef hash too and it was A-OK by me (as was the coffee).  I ordered my pancakes as the 'red, white and blue' style - which means strawberries, bananas, and blueberries.. the bizarre thing (which I did not like) was that they actually mixed all the fruit into the batter - so I got pancakes full of mushy cooked fruit.  I guess it was ok, but not my favorite and not what I expected - I thought the fruit would be on top of regular pancakes.  Oh well.  Service was nice and quick.  I definitely don't mind stopping in here for food whenever I am staying at Tuscany and need to get a quick bite.

FjFOxFj0vaK9pey5nIlGFg.text: I stay a the Tuscany Suites every year for a convention.  Their Marilyn's Cafe is the best "in casino" cafe I've ever eaten at.  They have a wide variety of food and I really enjoy their chicken pot pie and 24/7 breakfast.  There's been occasion where the service can be a little slow, but for the most part it's average for Vegas. Don't go expecting a culinary experience, but good basic food that is not Over-The-Top Vegas food.

hTMl_IasIaHi96o61Qc-0Q.text: WHY 5 STARS FOR A CRUMMY DINER AT A SOMEWHAT CRUMMY HOTEL?  SERVICE IS AWESOME AND THEIR $3.99 STEAK AND EGGS IS AMAZINGGGGGGGGGGGGGG!!!!!  I have always come to this place almost everytime I go to Vegas. They're steak and eggs deal starts at 12am and goes until I believe 6am. Here's a secret, get your hashbrowns loaded, it's a dollar extra but soooo worth it! They top your hashbrowns with gravy and cheese and onions or something like that...I can never remember since I'm always a little...who are we kidding, I'm DRUNK when I come here! They've got powerade, for those who party too hard at the clubs...lol. But seriously this place is wellll worth the taxi ride!! :) Sucks cause I always forget to take a picture of my steak and eggs, since...you know...I probably can't even remember my name when I come here.

-Jf9gbLzNtzcX1oRzBIlCA.text: We tried this restaurant on our last morning in Vegas for breakfast because it had such great reviews! We were NOT disappointed. The service was great, the staff, especially our waiter Oscar, was very courteous and attentive, the food was delicious and the portions were huge! All for a very low price! I wish we were here another night so we could try the infamous $5 steak and eggs. Definitely worth it! Oh, and the coffee was exceptional, coming I'm a coffee snob who thinks Starbucks is overrated!

fMjfly3g70uN1HOgQw0rSQ.text: The food is actually really good, but they hardly ever get the order right when it's to go. On my most recent trip I ordered a hamburger no cheese. I know for a fact she understood this because she repeated it to me " hamburger, so you don't  want the cheese?".  I got a patty melt with lots of cheese, now i'm not lactose intolerant or allergic to cheese so i'll live, i'll be a big girl and eat it, but then I notice it's on the only bread that I know of that I do NOT like at all, Freakin Rye! but hey i'm already at home and maybe somehow someway they've taken all the ingredients I don't like on a burger and made this the best taste treat ever. Did it work you ask, did they accomplish the impossible?....... Do you see 5 stars?! Honestly if I was reviewing this meal alone i'd be giving it 1 star, I had to throw the burger away, but wait there's more I also ordered  a fried chicken salad ( to eat later) and I received no chicken on my salad, when she took it back to fix it she came back with grilled chicken. Oh I know it's healthier, but this is what I cook at home all the time I don't go out to eat what I make, and yes I let it go, I took it which was a good thing because as you previously read my burger sucked. I went out to eat and ended up with exactly what I already had at home. I do put up with it because the food is really good and the portions always leave you with left overs.

bBcJnOUt4ctTszclCbH-Xw.text: I love coming here for the five dollar steak and eggs. And the attached casino is pretty awesome as well. Great servers, a good selection of food at a reasonable price is never a bad combination. Everytime im in vegas i always make sure to drop by here.

HN-d54mqY-Ph2vHJStzKtA.text: Have been there twice now on their All You Can Eat Crab night. The food, the service, the atmosphere (buffet) are all superb! The Manager, Aldo Mencatto, and his staff are fun, courteous, helpful, and attentive. The food is fantastic. And the price - well, you can't go wrong. Definitely a place I look forward to visiting again.

0mn0S2kVthNuSE5Eljtrfw.text: Amazing steak and eggs!  My BF actually liked the steak better than what he had at Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill.  And for about half the price of what you'd pay at most of the other more well known casinos.  Service is friendly and super fast.  Great diner food...they also have comfort food (pasta, pizza, etc) and everything else looked really good too.

SKpTs-b_ymseJUiuA0eEEw.text: $5 steak and eggs starting at midnight!  we got into vegas a little after 10pm and before we went too far along into the night of drinks, gambling, and more drinks, we wanted to grab some food. there weren't too many places that were nearby and open late serving decent food, but going to Marilyn's at the Tuscany was a unanimous choice given their steak and eggs special that we ordered right as we got in (which as luck would have it, was right at midnight).  ice tea, medium-well steak, and eggs over-medium, and sourdough toast for $5 and i'm a happy man, ready to burn the midnight oil on our first evening in Sin City.  the service was quick, which i'd imagine is either because a february Vegas trip isn't as crazy and packed as one in the summer, and/or the fact we got there right at 12. the other times when i've decided to stop at Marilyn's at the Tuscany for steak and eggs have been when it was closer to 3am, after a long night out cruising the strip or checking out one of the clubs and the waits (for our parties of 10+) have always been closer to an hour.  satisfying meal for the price. plus you can hit the $5 blackjack tables at the casino when you're done.  -civilities.

G4q3UkMUyA_ccgTMfHmrmQ.text: Anyone below who knocks this place...well I cannot not think of any other plausible reason other than they are just not smart and are expecting the moon and stars from a 24-hr cafe at an off the strip casino/hotel.  The place is clean, well lit, and decor was satisfactory. The service was just right. Only coming back when plates were clearly done or to refill beverages which clearly needed to be filled; and they were friendly about it.  The food was pretty darn good. The $3.95 all day all you can eat pancakes are beyond adequate for that price. The steak and eggs special, while not on the level to make Gordon Ramsay not scream, were very good for the price and you got to pancakes as a side. The steak was a bit thin and had some more fat on it thenI would have liked, but nothing to cry about. The eggs weren't perfect, but having been to Vegas 8 times in 6 years and having 40+ breakfasts, I am yet to find good eggs. So I was not unhappy. I didn't get sick and they looked/tasted like eggs. Little ketchup and Tabassco did wonders (as they usually do).  My group also, took part in the all-you-can eat crab legs on Friday night for $16.95. We took down 100+ legs. None of us were sick or even felt uncomfortable...just full. Again, not the best I have ever had, but really, quality shell fish in Vegas is hard to come-by (I live in CT, good seafood is a staple in my neck of the woods, so I am spoiled...very few places in Vegas come even close to what I experience on the norm).  I will agree with one Yelper down below...BRING YOUR OWN WATER. The water was a bit funky. It may be the local filtration process, I do not know. But after a 'long night in Vegas', water the next morning is clutch. Not from here though.  I would give this 4.5 stars if possible. But I went with 4, because of the Water thing, and the steaks were a 'tad underwhelming' (that may be too harsh, but it is the best I can think of). Definitely check this place out if you are on or near Flamingo at or East of the Strip.

qMnppoxfYXhnV0X1sJeUVw.text: Decent Steak and Eggs. Great Atmosphere.  Would definitely eat again!  Thanks for the good time!

12gzxdg8msNnDBS6osKytQ.text: I say this every time I'm in vegas.. "I come to Vegas mainly for the $5 steak and eggs." This is the place to be. Granted, I haven't tried enough steak n egg places to know this is the best, but this is my go-to spot on most of my drunken nights. They have the $5 deal from 10pm-5am I think, usually seating is always available too! Service is fast and friendly. If you come here and don't get the steak and eggs, you should just stop coming to vegas. I always get the medium rare steaks with over-easy eggs, and sometimes one plate isn't even enough... #drool lol  The few times I've driven here, parking has always been available, but if you come here in a Taxi, getting one to go back to your hotel is harder. Just go to the front desk and have the worker call you a taxi, cause they rarely wait at Tuscany lol   Enjoy!

9i_RGYrG9oT3aV5uPAtY7Q.text: Best place to eat at a decent price while in Las Vegas. Food and service was great. Went back many times and each time the service and food were exceptional!!!!

wQ2xClYU_R9Z69tQt3_qfw.text: I love that it's 24 hours, I come here every time that I'm in Vegas and staying at the Tuscany it's so convenient, the only thing I would say is to speed up the take out orders I waited for like 40mins at 1:30am for my food but other than that it was worth the wait. Oh yeah and there is plenty of food options and the price is amazing with good quality food.

3lOc9uxxNq-YSAeeLbIUqA.text: 4 stars for the menu variety, food quality and value 2 stars for the service Don't eat here unless you have lots of time to kill Server just disappeared on us....like 20 minutes Other than that, she was nice, just ghostly Once she came back, I had my credit card in hand, and have it to her.....she came back with the bill?  C'mon....I've got things to do!

t0BMid9FOpZc1YsZg-WnlQ.text: $5 Steak and eggs?! I'm in! This little gem is located in the read of the Tuscany Suites Hotel & Casino. There is free parking in the front lot as well. At midnight, this cafe has a special for $5: New York Steak, two eggs, 4 pieces of toast, and hash browns. If I lived in Vegas, I would definitely be coming back here more often because it's a quality meal for cheap!

vX62n3yfKnzizi1_T5IQOA.text: Been eating here for years but hadn't stopped by since 2011. Had the prom rib at 9:30 pm and yuk. Tastes microwaved as did the potato.  What happens to this place. Provably should have stuck to my old fav, the steak.

k3TLdzuobMo8vO7yFBql8Q.text: 8:20am on a Tuesday. Two greeters can't figure out where to seat a party of 4. While they have 50+ menu it wasn't offered. Long wait for table service, but good when it showed up. Square coffee cups; strange. Pricing is very reasonable.

bkdQ_3YSgNtPbwOG5x4A0g.text: The food is great , ordered the chicken fried stake , I cleaned my plate ! it takes some time but it's worth it and the desert was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marilyn&#39;s Cafe

XhItPH2oNf5cODuDPH13zg.text: This was my last meal before leaving the great city of Las Vegas. Some of the people in our group swore by it and I am so glad they made the recommendation. Like some of the other reviews, my only issue was the speed of service. But our waitress Patty was super cool and came back to check in on us pretty often.  Would love to experience this place after a long night out on the Strip, maybe next trip...

JGxjSLabXKw7sd2dScITiA.text: We were staying at the Tuscany (got there in the afternoon) and had to eat somewhere before seeing a show that night. Big menu so you should find something you like. The food is just OK but decent value for Vegas. Not worth a special trip but if you're nearby you could do worse.

QiZItWAmkiAAW1Hcl1VTTg.text: Good food. Good value. Good service. Enough said :) The only downfall is that it's not close to home...

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread basket
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. T-bone steak

LY8mc8nDzOG96STmR7i91Q.text: 5.99 steak &eggs with a beer? COUNT ME IN!   everytime i'm in vegas this is a must go to place! not only for one day but for every day that i'm in vegas &i do just that! the wait can vary depending on what time of the day you go but i come here around 11 am &the wait is about 10 min. ive only tried their steak &eggs but boy are they yummy! &did i mention the portion of the steak is huge &delicious?!?! the meal comes with steak, eggs, hash brown &bread and also your choice of beer all for only 5.99! can't beat that price anywhere &the service is also amazing as well we never had to ask for anything because our waitress always checked up on us &was very attentive! another added bonus is their hours! their open 24 hours a day so after the club this would be a perfect place to go too when you get hungry!

2yZBmKLfWmP_7IywY1vYLw.text: I AM IN LOVE!!!!  this is the place to eat! they have STEAK, 2 EGGS, TOAST, AND HASH BROWN FOR ONLY $4.99 are you kidding me??? not only was the price so cheap but the steak was soo juicy and tender. i am drooling as i type. the $4.99 special is only from midnight thru 5 am but we like to come here after our night outs! the regular price is $12.99 for this meal but we actually went back the morning after and ordered the same plate again... it was that good! i would recommend this place to EVERYONE! i wish this place was around my area! the lines are never too long and all the servers here are spectacular !!!

SooViCW8EmEmdQ7AfiYoig.text: 3.99 steak and egg only for midnight to 5am! We walked in  this place in the afternoon. Regular price everything and tastes so so.  You can find better food with lower price in a lot other restaurants in Vegas such as Ellis island!  And service in this place is terrible no energy at all! 2 stars for the bread and butter.....

VUkY2Cguo40ZNp7fGLIr7A.text: Yuck! The other reviewers were drunk when they wrote their reviews! I ordered the meat loaf with loaded hash browns and mac 'n cheese. Everything tasted mediocre at best and super processed. It all tasted like it had been heated in a bag. The meat loaf had no texture - it was shaped mush. The hash browns had zero crisp - mush. I haven't left that much food on my plate in a long time.

wIeH1vR8RDkoa9gjZWdKmA.text: Love this place! Marilyns cafe has a little bit of everything on the menu. I myself prefer going Friday evenings for all you can eat crab legs for 16.95. Service is always fast and friendly. Aldo the assistant manager is such a sweet heart. He always makes sure that everyone is taken care of and is happy with the service and quality of food.  I recommend this cafe

CG3sAIlRSf35GbtPCEYYUg.text: I can't say enough good things about this place... I absolutely love it here.   I have been eating here since 2008, I probably go, on average, once a month. I don't live close, so I usually make a special trip. The staff has always been amazing and for a casino cafe, the atmosphere isn't obnoxious.  The food is kinda homey and the portions are more than adequate, especially for the reasonable prices. I love the Turkey dinner, it's like Thanksgiving anytime!  If you haven't been, I totally recommend giving it a try!

jOgj6A5qIqadzvCQTHXsiQ.text: $3.99 steak and eggs after midnight! that's pretty much all you need to know about this place. It comes with hash browns, and toast. The quality of the steak is so-so. I went here twice the last time I went to Vegas. The first night I ordered my steak "medium-well" and it was too red and bloody. The second night I ordered it "well-done" and it was still red. It wasn't that big of a deal for me because I'd still eat it but it might irk some people. The hash browns were also a bit undercooked. I only eat the toast top of the hash browns.  But again, for $3.99, you get what you paid for.  Service is great though. They were friendly and peppy for midnight =) That's why I give them 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $3.99 steak and eggs

jWVhv86FfNEvYK_IR3oIvA.text: I suggest ordering pizza - the handmade pizza's here are to die for!  The turkey ruben was a 4 star sandwich and I also tasted the patty melt which was pretty darn good also.  The servers are a bit slow, and the smoke from the casino is a bit bothersome but overall... good food great prices.

IgDVB-uIKEk2WgXJvRsCSQ.text: We had 2 breakfasts here during our stay at the hotel.  Very good both times.  I especially enjoyed the eggs benedict with perfectly cooked hash browns.  Thumbs up for the hollandaise sauce they serve.. good prices too.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict - really good!

j27ggiMV04n_IdMfl-laeQ.text: We tried this place because there was a coupon in the Entertainment Book. Since we like the mexican restaurant inside the Tuscany, we figured it was worth trying.  We had two sandwiches- we split it (our MO). It was very good, surprisingly, for a casino cafe. It's about $10 per person, without the Entertainment coupon. We've been here a couple times. The service is very good. The atmosphere is nice, and this restaurant is spacious inside. There are tables and chairs as well as booth seating available.   It's truly "hit or miss" at these casino cafes. This is probably one of those little known/forgotten casinos and two of the restaurants here are really good.

xM6N9GzQUbIvgJl2L6BkxA.text: Had a late night meal after the Jennifer Lopez concert. Our server James was the BEST! He was very professional, very personable & very attentive. The portions are HUGE & the prices are more than resonable. The restaurants at the Tuscany Garden Hotel and Suites does not believe in small portions. The food was very good. Thank you James for making us feel at home. I highly recommend Marilyns Cafe to everyone.

IWI4TEmG-pjUU_w4LR-cGQ.text: Nice clean restaurant just a few blocks off the strip.  Great breakfast at a very reasonable price

qjney1iO428jJ6WZ8NZdzg.text: Okay, this is definitely a hard place to avoid. I went back after 2 weeks since the 'no service' experience and sad face review. This time I made sure to request to be seated in my top choices of servers' area (I know them by name since I go there a lot). What I conclude is that  one time was a fluke but if it was my first experience I would've never gone back.  Anyway, all is good after I make the precaution of where to sit.   Food: as great as usual so here's a general list of things that I have ordered before.  Coffee: The most important thing during breakfast - awesome. I'm not sure where they get the beans but IMO, it's better than Einstein's Bagels selection and it's better then Egg Works. Not that the other 2 is bad, I just like this coffee more.  Steak and Egg breakfast special: One of the best choice you can ask for if you are a steak fan. Every time I have ordered it it's made to perfection of the medium rare. The steak is lightly seasons so some people may want to add more. I've never been a fan of hash brown but this place makes it good. You get a choice of pancakes or toast.  Marilyn Starter: No way a person can get it wrong. Generic breakfast of eggs, sausage, bacon and pancakes. Ordered it a few times but only once that they over did the salt.  Grits - just right consistency. Great with butter and adding a bit of salt.   Country Fried Steak: First time having CFS. Steak was moist and the batter was good. Would recommend.  Quiche: I had one with ham, pepper and onions and it came with a fruit cup. Probably the only thing I have ever gotten that I didn't really like. I was not a fan of the crust.  Sweet Potato Waffle Fries: A-mazing! Partial bias because by default I love anything with sweet potato. Still awesome to try.  Biscuits and gravy: Was a bit cold when I got the plate. Gravy is not bad but I think it would be better if it had some bits of sausages in there or just something else to add on the mushy texture.  Country Sausage Lovers Bowl: Aside from food coma in the middle of eating i. it's really good. Heaviest meal I've ever gotten from here. For $9 it fed me for 2 meals.   Grilled Chicken & Eggs: Usually a gamble when it comes to chicken but the chef had chicken breast moist and tender and lightly seasoned.  Overall: Just give this place a try, you can't go wrong.

ahb0agO2HlJoAwo0vQE5MA.text: Great place!  I found this gem on my Las Vegas trip.  I needed a place that gave me a specific Vegan diet and that is exactly what I received!  The staff was so friendly and the conservation was something I will surely cherish.  Thank you so much for running to the store for me and thank you for the free coffee!     There was one con...no beans...but it was made up for!!!

SBcDqPfg5Jqcw1_hSkcw-Q.text: Ok food. Breakfast is ok. Very slow Service.... Nice place if you don't want to leave the hotel or casino.

NdzvJmmgfUt36M6jT86IkQ.text: Not much on ambiance but the food is spectacular. It's the classic old Vegas specials but they are so good here.large, tasty portions and great service. Ya a winner.

1XFDSKPBRKTSt_fsEsmFIQ.text: Steak and eggs is a staple of drunk or "been drinking a bit so now I'm really hungry" food in Las Vegas.   While there are a few choices in Vegas I always choose Marilyn's Cafe at the Tuscany because its 1. close by to the strip 2. its not crowded, no wait in line 3. it taste OK.  Your steak and eggs is $4.99 from something like 11pm - 5am, consist of a 6ish oz steak, two eggs, hash browns, and toast. Pretty basic, but a core essential in waking up without a hangover.   I've had the other food before on their extensive menu and it gets a pass.  If you do come here for steak and eggs they no longer allow bill splitting during steak and eggs time so bring CASH.

3Gy7H5aXJoo1oeShM0RhyA.text: Little restaurant inside the Tuscany Casino. This was a mixed bag. 5 of us ate there twice:  Good: + Price + Selection + Some of the dishes were good: roast beef (pot roast)  + relatively quiet location + time - Their hours seem to be round the clock   Bad:  - Most of the dishes were just so-so. My chicken cordon bleu was extremely disappointing and not any better than a frozen microwave chicken cordon bleu  - Plating or presentation was poor - just slap it on the plate.

NKdFnkhbyRa6JPPISV-4Ag.text: Food is delicious , ended up going back the next day for breakfast. The staff is awesome and very kind. Would definitely recommend it .

FphSHYocsuUpddysSOnk4Q.text: Fairly good pancakes, especially for all you can eat at $3.99. The French toast was also good as well as the eggs, hash browns, and toast. It's nothing to write home about. Our waitress was really nice and attentive. She even had a great personality and was funny. She made it a better experience than it would have been otherwise (+1 star). The music and sound of the nearby casino is the major downfall. It's in the "Tuscany" and they have pop music on. If that odd mix of genre isn't enough, there is a slot machine that plays western ompa polka music about every 30 seconds and it's louder than the pop music. Overall it's a good cheap breakfast.

7sI0Cvw_kgzzFP2kYvemzQ.text: I went on Friday & had the all you can eat crab legs & they were amazing. Speedy  & excellent customer service.

SEOq-Q9nTPCUOAQe4xVfvA.text: Best breakfast in Vegas!! I love breakfast and there are a million places to eat in Vegas so I looked on yelp for the best breakfast near the strip and this is what I found! It's inside the Tuscany Suites and Casino, straight back from the entrance of the casino. It's a 24 hour cafe that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. I would compare this to a mom and pop version of Denny's, with better prices.   I got the "Big Winner" which comes with 2 eggs, bacon, sausage, ham, toast, hash browns AND pancakes..... for $8.99!!!! And this isn't even a special! They have cheaper prices if you come during certain times on weekdays. And the taste was GREAT. We really liked our server John. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and made our experience even better.  Basically..... I can't wait to come back to Vegas to have breakfast at Marilyn's!

V4qrrbHyme_nPo-V_t5KhQ.text: All those cheap specials that are being advertised on yelp are only at late night or early morning, which caused some disappointment for me as I convinced all my friends we'd have a cheap meal.  I ordered a skillet plate since the special was unavailable and it was packed with goodness. The wait for the food; however, was a little unbearable. We had about 6 people, but we waited around a half hour for our food. They might make you wait so the food can taste better.   I wouldn't mind coming here again, but I might only come when I find out when that damned steak and eggs special is available.

OtYBxEEZDRsHnTdqcPRqTg.text: Great little GEM off the strip. We stayed at the Tuscsny and decided to try this place out. Glad we did. Very nicely decorated with a Tuscany Italian theme, fantastic service and the food was excellent. I ordered the chicken cordon blu, which you don't see offered in many restaurants. The entree was prepared perfectly and the sides, brown rice and whole kernel corn came out hot and were delicious. Highly recommended.

osWTgwrcl4hqtPMoz1zrVQ.text: $5 steak and eggs!!  Definitely a must after clubbing! My friends and I ALWAYS come here after a long night at the club because it's such a great deal for a good amount of food!   The steak sometimes isn't how you order it but the hashbrowns and eggs always hit the spot! it also comes with toast. for $5 you can't go wrong! it's never really that crowded that late at night but it does kind of suck trying to find a taxi after you eat.   I've actually been here not at 2am and the food is pretty good! definitely worth trying if you don't mind going a couple blocks off the strip.   Note: the $5 steak and eggs deal is only available late at night.

OcWE35MHdHGnhnoXvOFhng.text: The chicken Caesar wrap is great. The prices are pretty fair. The service was good. The prime rib sandwich was good. The salad was a good price and the good side. It's nice it's right to the casino. This is my second time here and I'm sure I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of seating okay decor.

PWBPx0szjmSq0MaEuyMCyw.text: Marilyn's cafe offers a small diner feel but in the big city. Pancakes are excellent. 8.99 for pancakes , bacon and eggs. Love this place. Easy to get to from the strip. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegas special.

uXRUW4-mPXFFh34BfNSBMw.text: Came in for AYCE CRABLEGS only to find out they ran out of crab legs. I just don't know anyone could offer AYCE and run out of your deal?   I think it's extremely inconvenient for any customer to wait in line for about 30 minutes only to find out that they stopped serving what you came in for.   Although the manager did apologize for the inconvenience it was a let down. Still a great place to go well worth it.

hJI2yjc4aGdQdVKw50OUtg.text: Best place for steak and eggs after a night of drinking!   $4.95 for steak and eggs and $3.99 for AYCE pancakes, making it a great night owl place after hitting up the clubs or a night of drinking.   The steak and eggs entree also comes with a side of toast and some hashbrowns.   I've been here numerous times and I've always experienced good service even in the twilight hours of the night.   They also have milkshakes which I recommend, both the chocolate and strawberry are delish!

WWri-6FsnbiZv-KzItkZCw.text: Service was stupid. Watched a take out carton get dropped off and sit at the counter for 10 minutes until someone finally gave it to me. Nothing like cold food. No apology. Terrible service.

Jv4WL9X6PuSO77aaUpZvsQ.text: Decided to eat here before heading back to Long Beach based on the 4 star review on Yelp.   I honestly can not figure out how this got an overall rating of 4 stars. My wife ordered a T-Bone breakfast and I ordered a New York Strip breakfast.   We both ordered the steaks medium-well but my wife's steak came out rare and my was overcooked and tough as leather.   The eggs, hash browns, and toast were average noting spectacular on par with a Denny's or Norms.   The service was ok, it took awhile for us to receive our check.   I really hate that my first review was a negative one, but I really don't want anyone to see the 4 star rating and think it's a great place because unfortunately it is just below average.

luaiycWU6OKS09NcHCHxzQ.text: Thank you  for the exceptional service from our waiter  Arnold. This was the best service my boyfriend  and I  had all weekend.  The prices were very reasonable and the food was fantastic.  I will definitely be coming back to Marilyn s  the next time I'm in Vegas! :)

5I20IxS9jkbaQkZqBiPsNA.text: My husband and I always stay at the Tuscany.  Suites are very nice and most importantly Marilyns Cafe is delicious!  Great service amazing food all in one!

k8o6NXKHUv-GYdRtt5eRFQ.text: I love this place, I always come for the healthy section in the menu and the food is always good and consistent, thank you, and have a nice day.

vpmpM-8mXinkZ0nptUF2Eg.text: We recently stayed at the Tuscany and this restaurant was inside the casino attached to the hotel, and  this place was recommended to us by a friend.  The fact they have breakfast 24 hrs/day earns them 3 stars right off the bat.  The fact that the breakfast was tasty and excellent gives them another star.  I tried their sausage Benedict with grits, it came with a biscuit and gravy and some hash browns.  Firstly, very large portion, you can't leave hungry.  I wasn't too big on the grits but the rest was so tasty I wish I had room for more.  And the coffee?  Well this is the USA....so it was excellent.  Rich, strong and tasty, what a treat from the Canadian brown water we are subjected to.  Maybe this is why I travel the US so frequently, I love the quality of food.  And the prices...unbelievable.  Starting at $3.99 for endless pancakes.  My meal with coffee came to $10.00.  Other bonuses...free wi-fi, nearby casino, nearby patio = heaven!  Will come back for sure!

omNukDqOuFfd9u6vd9aIsw.text: Stopped by there for breakfast.  Basic breakfast food nothing special.  The service was pretty good.    This would be a 3 star review because it was just good nothing really special at all.... the typical casino cafe.  The reason for a one star bump is because it was somewhat cheaper than other places for breakfast.  So - decent breakfast very reasonably priced with good service.

EiKrJCd3YWZmpySvliIPbw.text: Ate here everyday on our trip to Las Vegas. 5 days and I couldn't get enough! The prices are reasonable and food portions are big. Would recommend to anyone.

7NEZv_RbNioLvvoSdvLwIw.text: Convenient if you stay at the Tuscany Hotel, otherwise, you can find so much better. We had dinner there, then breakfast. Dinner : we ordered pizzas, and i'm pretty sure mine was bought at Walmart and defrosted. Breakfast : not very good, and I suspect it made me sick.

E8fPa5lFRePVsNf9UR9aFw.text: Best prices and the quality is wondedul!  All the workers are so kind as well :) everything on the menu is phenomenal!!!!!!

7k_LWNrM7zZL20JXcxmyZA.text: Honestly this place is my new favorite place to eat! They have so many GREAT deals going on at all times of the day! One awesome specials is the $5.49 1/2 lb. Monster Burger served WITH fries. This offer is 24/7!!! The only catch is you have to fine in to get the deals (a small price to pay if you ask me). The quality of the burger was really good. The price does not mean lower quality. We spoke to the manager before we left, despite how busy he clearly was he stopped to have a full conversation with us. He was incredibly kind and professional. At the start of our visit we had to wait a 5-10 minutes before we were seated, but we were constantly acknowledged. They were very apologetic about the wait and it made the wait totally worth it. I am so pleased with out overall experience in the cafe.

y6HU4IT7CBRckSaiQEo6ew.text: They have a pancake special all-you-can-eat for just 3,99$ that is very good and the staff is very friendly!

JlL2DtglXQAR2Bd2-whyJQ.text: It's a very basic 24/7 restaurant. Not worthy of 4 stars. Nothing spectacular about it and just decent grub when you need it. Not worth the trip unless you are staying here.

urUOVOeyhAyAyhmWH4vbwA.text: I'm here.. After a night of partying ... How many times have I been to this cafe ? I lost count! Seriously ! Amazing wait staff and food is to the point!   If its an early morning: get the Steak and eggs! Never fails!  If its dinner time: I like the half BBQ chicken and ribs; get the green beans ! Has bacon in it! Didn't think they would add that flavor element did you!?      So if you are on the strip. Want some affordable food and great service!? Marilyn's Cafe it is!

WCtQ--tXbwSYbPqkhBWZAQ.text: Two breakfast specials: All You Can Eat Pancakes for $3.99, or for $8.99, a 6 oz. NY Strip with 2 eggs, hash browns, pancakes or toast. I didn't think I had time today for the steak, so I opted for the pancakes. They were ready in short order and refills consisted of 2 additional pancakes at a time. The service was prompt and attentive. I think the music playing in the morning was post-disco, or the ratings would have been better; 5 stars instead of just 4 stars!

Q2Gb-5UriUxXTT4_jFpgWA.text: We were addicted! A big group of us were in town a few weeks ago and stumbled upon Marilyn's Cafe, while searching for a yummy breakfast off the strip.  We had breakfast here 3 of the 4 mornings we were in town!    Great prices, yummy food and awesome service (I wish I could remember our servers name from our final breakfast there bc she was the best)!    Their chicken fried steak is amazingly good (it was my first time ever trying it and I was hooked after trying a bite my first morning).    Great place and will definitely be visited time and time again when we're back in town!

cAgakRMHc1rAzMKvmrRejA.text: never dissapointing at alll absolutely the best staff also/.....

qplD1xzlwwDd2-OUtS6r2g.text: $3.99 steak and eggs?! I am one happy and lucky girl.   This place is awesome. You cannot beat $3.99 steak and eggs with crispy hash brown and toast. After partying hard, this is the spot to go when you don't want to break the bank even more. The cafe was not crowded at 2 in the morning on Friday and we were seated immediately.  My steak was cooked the way I wanted, the sunny side up eggs were great, my hash brown was crispy and on top of that, got a nice hearty toasted wheat bread. Service was a little slow but I don't mind it just one bit. This meal would leave you full and very satisfied.

1648t_Y5jjgeUJqymZZUkg.text: Horrid service!! Food was decent. The waitress was quadruple sat and forgot an order. Sigh.

O6V_5hpeMHUzLkbcTVztKQ.text: This place is a god-send after a long night on the town, because when the clock strikes 12am it's time for $3.99 Steak and Eggs!!!!!!!    Seriously what can sound better than that? And if your thinking they'll skimp at that price, oh no my friends your dead wrong. Your getting a good sized slab (4oz?) with two eggs served your way, a heaping helping of hashbrowns, and the glorious buttered toast. ( Eat it with jam or use it to sop up the yolk) It's all the  right components to soak up all the booze in your system.    This place was so awesome I came here both nights I was in town. I hear the wait for your food to come here is pretty ridiculous, but both times I was so far gone I couldn't tell. LMAO

pkxbcp1lhsUQ83FmxLQLyA.text: great customer service.   i had the pancakes and bacon breakfast.  Everything was good.

YnerWQZPfd8Sl6vZ4A_jHA.text: A great place to go eat slightly off the strip on flamingo Road & their open 24hrs aday

3hMWn7cOAPwqm6kul3cHlA.text: CRABALICIOOOOOOOOOOUS! That's what you come in here for. I came  here on the AYCE snow crab deal for $19.99. I've had my crab cravings in the past, and I'd call around the buffets in vegas (Bacchanal, wicked spoon) to ask if they specifically serve snow crabs. Why pay $40-$50 when all i want to do is get my mulah's deal worth on some crab action.  4pm-10p.m. only on Fridays. I came here around 5:00p.m., thinking that there'd be a line, but no, it was a shoe-in. Service was quick, waters were constantly filled, and the crabbies were loaded on my plate. You get two sides included (which isn't AYCE). I highly recommend the SWEET POTATO WAFFLE FRIES. Probably the best I've ever had in my LYFE, SON!   The french fries, mashed potatoes were average, and the fresh chips were really good. I just ate off of other people's plates, hence I got to try my medley of sides.   I was stuffed by the end of the night. They also had some cookies that they sell Subway style by the cashier. I like my oatmeal cookies so it was yummy for my dessert.   I'll definitely be back to fill my snow crab cravings!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab attack!!!!
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE snow crabs wooooo !!!!!! $19.99 baby!!!!!!! Comes with two sides of choice.

U7g24_GwCQ1CRFrujSvCVw.text: I've only been here between the hours of 1-4am, but you can't really beat $5.99 steak and eggs after a long night of drinking and dancing at the club.   The plate comes with a good-portioned steak, hash browns, 2 eggs (any way you like), 2 whole slices of toast (white, wheat, sourdough). I usually order it, medium rare, over-easy or sunny side up eggs with sourdough bread.   TIPS: Dip the toast in the runny egg yolk for that next level deliciousness.   You get what you pay for, but this hits the spot every time, I've always left feeling satisfied. Plus, I've never had to wait, so definitely my #1 recommendation for late night bites at a very affordable price.

L5ANq7d0oETmpvXgywR3BA.text: We went to celebrate birthdays. My husband and Dad love crab legs and Friday night is all you can eat. The server was great and we all loved our food. Everyone ordered the crab. The sides were really good and a nice surprise. The green beans were excellent! I love that they serve the butter with warmers, very nice touch!

Yl7kw7yJnjBbVcVqlz512g.text: Located in the Tuscany hotel. 12.99 steak and eggs with hash brown or grits and toast. It was all bland but good thing for pepper and ketchup. Did not like the fact that they put butter on all the toasts but the jam spread made up for it. Overall steak and eggs in Vegas is always inexpensive, love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fhbSjAgfnfe-S-WfC4FX8w.text: We have eaten two meals there one dinner and one breakfast and both of them exceeded our expectations and price and quality of meal also the waitress and the workers cleaning the tables were all very active, very busy and very friendly. I even met a family friend that had been moved off island (Hawaii) some 13 years ago working here. So far, this is one of the best breakfast places I have eaten at over here

KRrmjHxhB-ZEW5kU0Zyz5A.text: Had the $5.99 Steak and Eggs, was good, better than over at Ellis Island and amazingly cheaper... the cafe itself needs a renovation.  Was there at 4:10am on Saturday, was pretty empty.  I'll definitely return.  UPDATE... went back a few days later, and the steak I got on my first visit, bore no resemblance to the steak I got on my last visit.  And the service was non-existent after I ordered.  So I dunno, you can't beat the price but I'd lower my expectations.  If I could give it 2 1/2 STARS, rather than 3 which I did, I would.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Eggs, $5.99, between midnight and 5a

d0tCBqMq4h7S0tG6boWnfQ.text: My first breakfast spot on vacation and the food was good with a large menu. Plenty of options at an affordable price. Within walking distance from the high roller Ferris wheel and flamingo hotel (~15 mins). On the plus, I was able to build up an even bigger appetite walking over. Service was also quick and efficient. Seated and eating within 10 mins.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ek8YkErgKIBlF5SkIEPQEA.text: Doesn't matter if you make the best food in the world, because if the service is lousy the restaurant is lousy. I chose to come here on my birthday yesterday I have all the restaurants and hotels in the world at Tuscany Suites. I'm sorry I ever came-due to the unprofessional inattentive servers,  I got no service no one took my order after 15 minutes, and I had to attend a show which was a total farce. (Because the performers at the rat pack is back we're different than the ones that I thought I was getting you could sing on key.)  I asked what do you do for birthdays and they said oh we do nothing. Marilyn's doesn't have one dessert listed on their menu and I asked pacifically bring me something cake or something with a candle they couldn't even do that! Finally, after having the most un-festive birthday I ever paid for in history, I went back to Marilyn's  at one of the morning and the manager on duty found a massive dessert platter and put a candle on it and she sang happy birthday to me.  Why the hell couldnt they have done that when they were supposed to?  Why was I told they don't do anything for birthdays, no cake,  no ice cream etc?

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It took 3 attempts to get this dinner of meatloaf.  I asked for the manager to guarantee someone would take my order
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food was good once I got it but the customer service and attention by the waiters was terrible. The worst I have seen to date

DtAyaD9ug5k-YM1UjFo83Q.text: Found this little gem on Yelp while looking for a breakfast spot.  My first surprise was the coffee.  It was not burnt, it did not taste old or bitter.  It was fresh and good tasting.  The menu prices are not bad at all!  The amount of food for the price you pay is great! Been here for 4 days and this is my second morning in a row coming here!  I totally recommend this place.  There is a slight wait to get your food once you have ordered but other than that, it's a great place! Enjoy!

dfFo9ooQ32YwRgA1GkfL9w.text: Attracted because of the low price and high rating. The food was cheap, quality of food was great, and I enjoyed the staff. Definitely recommend for a cheap but good breakfast place.

uWk2a_aSpyapUV-ttpwzKg.text: My group of friends and I always come here after a night of clubbing in Vegas at like 4am.  We got seated quickly and the place isn't crowded at this time.  It's cheap, tasty, and filling. It's roughly $6 for eggs, steak, hash browns, and toast.  I think they only offer this price during a limited time of the day. So, be sure to check on that.   Service is friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My usual:  Wheat toast, scrambled eggs, medium rare steak, and hash browns.

bR2wDNK4Kr_qV9PTV2dSfg.text: All the cool people know where to get good $5 steak & eggs... And that's at Marilyn's Cafe in the Tuscany hotel and casino off the strip!  A perfect place to grab some food after partying all night at the nightclub.  Hardly any wait to get seated.  Service is quick and friendly.  Good for big groups.  They open late night.  $5 steak and eggs and it comes with hash browns and toast. Good deal!   ***FYI you cannot get the $5 deal if you order the meal for take-out!!! Or else you pay regular price   ***And another tip: It's difficult to get a taxi to pick you up at Tuscany, so I suggest using Uber or Lyft!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; eggs scrambled
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; eggs over easy

aUiPMVe8em9CVqeHoZiGHg.text: Perfect for what we needed! Came for high school swim finals. The meet ran late and we needed a lot of solid good food at a low price. The school only gives the students a $15 allowance for each student. PERFECT! There's only a few items that are over! Large portions, hearty food and tasty. Plates came out full! Broccoli was abundant and well cooked but not seasoned. We had 14 people and they got us right in on a Saturday night at 9pm. This is going on the school list of great places to go in Vegas!

ZgLhuC5Gntvm1ERQTQLXKA.text: Went to dinner at Marilyn's Cafe in Tuscany Hotel, and had the worst dining experience.  Ordered Roast Beef Medium Rare, and my friend ordered the steak  Medium Rare.  The Roast Beef came out PURPLISH GRAY AND I COULDN'T CUT IT WITH MY KNIFE.... sent it back and ordered the steak instead..  Waited one hour for my steak to come out of the kitchen.  My friend meanwhile finished his steak which was OK nothing to rave about, but was still waiting for his vegetable corn to come to the table.  He had ordered glazed carrots which came out of the kitchen brown and carrots are orange so he sent them back and said he'd have corn instead. He was finished his steak when the corn finally came out, but my steak was still a mystery.  Were they butchering the cow out back in order to make my steak?  After waiting one hour I asked for the manager and he really did nothing much but say "I'll go look in the kitchen"....instead of saying " I'm sorry you are waiting so long, what can I do to make it better."... nothing, couldn't care less.  Finally my steak came out and I ate it, just to eat something because after waiting that long I was hungry.   I decided to put in a complaint to management and asked for the GM of the restaurant to call me .... as of this writing he still has not called me to find out what happened, or offer an apology for the terrible food we were served and length of time it took to get it.   Tuscany's restaurant Marilyn's Cafe is terrible.  Sure they have specials which is where they do most of their business, but for regular dinner items.... they serve food that really could make you ill, purplish gray roast beef?  and the waiter brings it out, instead of saying to the cook this doesn't look right.   Will never eat there again and my advice would be don't bother to dine at Marilyn's Cafe, you'd be better off at the IHOP or Dennys, at least there food is the color it is supposed to be and you don't wait an hour for it..... Terrible, terrible dining experience.

QwKmE2N8czdnoKreu-tVCg.text: Food is so gross. Deep fried junk sh*t. Seriously. So disappointing. The service is great tho. I don't understand why this place has a lot of reviews.

GNKwWP_mFNojGKEHoS33yQ.text: I don't see what's the deal about this place, the food is mediocre and if you plan on having a party of six or more then you're going to be charged a "service" fee. I would be fine with that service fee if I had received even a decent waitress. My table had to get up multiple times to get the waitress to get any water or coffee, the food was cold, and as said before, very bland and mediocre, and at least the waitress we got was very rude and neglected all of her tables. Not worth people's time or money...

G4toDClXNE2U9x6TXgsrVg.text: I would give less than 1 if I could , the service really sucks ,the lady of the reception and the lady came to ask us drinks,really haughty,look like they had a fight with somebody last night the food is also flat,no much surprise,last restaurants I would choose to go,

kmOhBw6iRG64UnPA01yjAQ.text: Not bad for s casino restaurant.   We had a dickens of a time trying to find it.  We didn't know it was in a casino and drove by it a couple of times before we realized it.  My wife had a western omelet and I had a waffle with 2 eggs, bacon, and sausage.  Nothing memorable.   It was breakfast.

xlkKjiLUjqCq74lLLUAoUA.text: I was craving a big breakfast and I was not disappointed!!!  The prices are very reasonable and the portions are ample...  I was staying at the Palazzo and had to take a $10 taxi each way for this breakfast and it was better and cheaper than any breakfast I had all week at the Palazzo!

rJENpOLR9DVFB1nHdwif4g.text: Well, it is convenient if you gamble at the Casino, but then you also get the ciggy smoke as the restaurant shares the same space.  Staff was friendly.    Food was :meh; - some items definitely tasted of the can or mix - disappointed in the crab cakes, but the sides were all good and the veggies were fresh.  Agree with some other reviewers here, the cole slaw is the best of the sides.  Breakfast another day was the French Toast plate, OK but I asked for all bacon and got bacon and sausages... and the coffee was nothing special.  Portion size was ample but not overwhelming, best value when using 1/2 off coupons.

gKwfxlD2qYjiZM0N5JalHw.text: We eat breakfast here quite often and dinner less. The french toast complete would be my morning recommendation. If you want real scrambled eggs instead of egg substitute you need to specify country scramble. Service is usually decent but the turn over at the cashier station sometimes causes delays as they are often training new people. Often have specials which are a bargain.

GyBz0-iVQXQcKJwnq1JFMQ.text: If it's the middle of the night/early early morning, this is where you wanna go.  Cheap steak & eggs.  It's not a silly portion either.  Pretty dang big and filling. There wasn't much of a wait when I came..and a group of 9 of us. Though I must say the service took a while to take our orders..and we noticed that other tables were getting their orders taken even when they came in later than us.  Sometimes frustrating, especially if you're starving.  But when the food came out, all was well.  The hash browns were crispy and tasty. The English muffin was buttered and good.  The eggs...hard to mess up eggs. Now the steak.  Mine was fine, some fatty parts that I tried to avoid, but it was expected. But my friend sitting next to me, almost half her piece of steak was fat....so it looked as though she only ate half of it and gave up..but it was because there were so many parts of her steak that would have been just mouthfuls of fat..tasty.

-oJrnEnBkmsfAf-DHtuOnQ.text: Hit this place a bunch of times during our trip to Vegas. Great great great breakfast. The food is awesome, the eggs were fresh, and the service was very friendly and very fast. The corned beef reuben is freakin amazing too. Top notch Reuben I have to say.
