I was very impressed, and I'm usually a Pastrami Reuben kind of guy, so it says a lot when a corned beef reuben does it this well for me. All in all, this place is great, I will definitely eat here again next time I'm in Vegas.

POJCtJJnxi9jgoEh_thLmA.text: The best breakfast we had while visiting Las Vegas. The hash browns were AMAZING. The meat lovers breakfast was also AMAZING. We ate there twice in one week.

phEXDe8UD_YCfZQ2-XMGFg.text: Stayed at Tuscany on a business training event this week and decided to give Marilyn's a try. The service was excellent and my waitress was very friendly and caring. The Fitness Scramble was cooked to perfection and I could not ask for anything more for the price. The coffee was ehh, but I am a coffee snob! Most people around me ordered the Steak and Eggs and it seemed to be a hit! I would definitely recommend giving Marilyn's a try!

LT79tjyqYTVUf8MTYDcLOA.text: I stayed at the Tuscany hotel and this cafe/diner was really convenient with good quality food for affordable price.  Food was really nothing special, but just solid good quality.

SXx1UwcWMV20MOBFLfH68A.text: Went here to eat based on the reviews and I will not go back food was very bad service was terrible.when the food came it was cold asked the server for coffee she never came back for about 20 minutes asked her for cream for the coffee and napkins she never came back had to go to the hostess and ask again after 20 minutes the hostess then came with sour cream instead of creamer.would not recommend this place to anyone

SQbvPLwzgBN5-uNSawd_sQ.text: Great breakfast. We had "the big winner" (2 eggs (ours nicely poached), two sausages, bacon, big hunk of grilled ham, hash browns/grits, 2 slices toast, two pancakes and great service (thanks Elvis) all for $8.99. Coffee$2.29, Lg Juice $3.50. Excellent and not at all greasy.

8eoE3Ic88xA-fUMGwzKh4Q.text: My husband and I love love marilyn's cafe!  He get's the steak and I get the prime rib, we also love the garden salad and shrimp cocktail. This may will be our 3rd year in a row staying at Tuscany (because we love it) and our 3rd year in a row eating at Marilyn's Cafe. Honestly as we plan our trip in Vegas this is always our first anniversary dinner choice. You gotta try it! Delicious!

JgU-Vea8E6rZMicc4r31ww.text: Been here twice and have only ordered one thing: $3.99 steak and eggs. Will you believe me if I say the steak is pretty tasy, even when I'm sober?  Ok, I've never tried it sober but I imagine it would be just as good. Get the sourdough toast and slab the orange maramalade and butter ontop.   Greasy, drunk food on the cheap. Gotta love it.

Jhp_YXma_ByN_xwQ6dQLng.text: Not too bad.  Everyone else's food was ok.  No on really complained EXCEPT for my friend who ordered the OMELET with Jalapeos, Bell peppers and sausage...... but ONLY got Jalapeos, Bell peppers and sausage (with the egg) but NO CHEESE.... he was a little butt hurt....  Our server Jennifer was really nice.  I had the waffles and they were FANTASTIC.  The PATTY sausages are pretty good too.

kwQtuM9TEfmiDHRebmK3pw.text: BEST STEAK & EGGS SPOT IN VEGAS! YEEEAH BUDDY  but they stop serving it at 5am. k go now!!

j0kFXJJZu-QxImylfkLEcQ.text: The atmosphere here was really dreary and depressing. Most of the staff looked absolutely miserable. Our waitress was inattentive and had to be reminded to bring us part of our meal. Seemed like she was drunk, too, but who knows. The drinks that we ordered were on the weak side. Everything took a long time. The food came out hot and was good, and the prices are fair. I want to give them 3 stars because the food was good, but I feel that 3 stars implies that I might return here. Wouldn't go back.

jXuZvdLcRzn26Bf97zH3Pw.text: I can only imagine that most of the 4-5 star reviews here were written by drunken-late-night vacationers staying at the Tuscany.  We had a poorly prepared breakfast with weak coffee and limited service - cannot recommend.

HdYmlQ9BPB4NVf5hLMDQRg.text: There is absolutely nothing wrong with this place. Grease? Yes, lots of it, oozing out of every porous surface and slathered thick and frothy. I must have had four grilled cheese sandwiches over the course of the weekend, each time with mashed potatoes and gravy so I could dip each bite of that buttery-ass sandwich into the gravy. I also had the fish and chips, though ALSO with mashed potatoes and gravy, as well as green beans, which, God bless Marilyn's Cafe, had bits of bacon in it. And grease.  Service was snappy and friendly, even when the place was packed to the gills with geriatrics and hungry drunks. They made a minor error with a to go order but quickly resolved it.  Even if I don't stay at Tuscany again, I think I'd still consider eating every meal here.

7eZZH1eSOG1Thvn5rn86sA.text: We came in around 12:30 am for the steak and eggs special. It was okay. I mean it's definitely worth what you pay for. I really like their toasts. This is located in Tuscany Hotel. I think this is a good and cheap place to go to for a late night munch!

u_IxwjzVbFEPMeYNhd4s8w.text: Great food.  The best waiter ever is James. Very nice courteous funny and sweet. Great food drunk or sober!

DQfs5xxN7bHzz-TONg6B1g.text: I will eat here every time i stay at the Tuscany just for the tomato and basil omelet. All of their food is awesome though. So is their service.

EEvmvRasNrNPI4rrHVA7aQ.text: My girls and I (Katie H. and Kelsey W.) just finished a night at Marquee and wanted some grub after all that dancing. They convinced me to come here for late night food and we got there at around 3:30am Sunday morning.   Based on location and decor, I was not feeling this place. Only thing that saved my hesitation though was the fact that so many people were there at that foresaken hour!  We each got the famous steak and eggs (steak medium and eggs scrambled) and damnnnn was I in for a treat! Eggs done well, steak just the right portion size and texture, a ton of crispy hash browns, and toast slathered in butter beauty. OMG talk about satisfying!   I didn't care about the decor, I didn't care that we went off the strip to get here, and I def didn't care that I was eating that much food in the middle of the night! AND ONLY $4.99?!!! So much beauty in one night.  Woooooo good work Marilyn's Cafe! You made a fan out of a disbeliever!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Eggs

v1EqFRDqug2Z6qZlspyvYw.text: If I could put negative stars I would.  I came here based on the good reviews, I was severely disappointed. I ordered the eggs Benedict and my fiance ordered the steak and eggs. While my fiance said the steak was good, that is where the compliments end. I also ordered the corned-beef hash which arrived with a big long blonde hair in it. Needless to say I was disgusted. My server looked at me and asked if I wanted a new one. No apology, no visit from the manager. Nothing. I said no thank you and tried to eat the rest of my food. My fiance had ordered a bagel, which after asking two times never showed up. After pointing this out to our server she appeared to realize her tip was in jeopardy and wrote us off. With an eye-roll she walked away and did not come back to refill drinks or ask how our food was. My food was cold and a bit salty. Another friend of ours got the fires with gravy. He stated they were just "ok".   I am really not getting all the positive reviews for this place. Service was awful, managers were MIA, no attempt to remedy the problems or care that we were happy in the slightest. Avoid at all costs. There are way too many choices in Vegas to settle for this mediocrity.

D1fx_n6Ai-VpY3HmVFlaKA.text: Wow I'm wondering if the other reviewers ate at the same place I did??? I stayed for 2 long weeks at the Tuscany and  the service at Marilyn's was average the food was a notch below Denny's.  I even told the manager calling ribs or chicken Bar B Que because you pour bbq sauce over them doesn't make them Bar B Que.   I've had five dinners here and one breakfast so I'm not rating this place on one visit.  All my dinners were poor in every way. I had dessert one night and the cake tasted stale.   I sent it back an actually had to tell them to remove it from my bill as they were not going to.  My breakfast meal was a very good omelette    Prices are good here but then again you truly get what you pay for

C1irgS3XThRR0a_iIBsHLg.text: What a pleasant surprise!!   We went to this restaurant after watching a show at the Tuscany Casino.  Staff was very pleasant and the food was really good AND the prices are just amazing.  I had chicken parm and my daughter had Fettuccini Alfredo with shrimps, I had a drink, the check was under 40$!    After being gouged in the strip for dinners, this was a really good find.    I'll make sure to return whenever I'm back in Vegas.    It's worth the 6$ uber ride.

TUztYzb_romuAS7qurw4Hg.text: For value, service, availability and delivery this place gets all the stars!  Open 24 hours at our hotel we dined at Marilyn's twice. Once was "room service" but it's actually just delivery.  We dined in as well and both times servers were kind polite and accommodating. Short order cook is awesome as well. Jason and Julian served us they were both attentive and friendly.  Bowl of oatmeal with Mille brown sugar and raisins is $3 basic breakfast $6.  Cannot be beat!

wFnoTklsblOVxLgQMCSYNQ.text: For their grave shift prices, they were good food. My cousin brought me here and she ordered for us. Just a little past midnight snack. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings were great!
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I think meat was just a tad bit tough or over cooked. But not sure if my cousin ordered well done or medium done.

ozF_wjaxhaNUL2i1dIWzgQ.text: For the past two hours, I've been struggling to understand why (and how) this place is so highly reviewed! I had the Turkey George... Egg white omelette with thinly sliced turkey and an avocado verde sauce. My boyfriend had the Belgium waffle topped with cinnamon apples. My best friend had two chocolate chip/strawberry pancakes with a side of hash browns. My omelette lacked so much flavor and the turkey was painfully dry. The avocado verde sauce was DECENT but, in all honesty, I can do a better job in my own kitchen. My boyfriends waffle wasn't any better. I think he would've been happier with a stack of Eggos. And my best friend described her pancakes as "no better than iHop." Not to mention, her hash browns were drenched in oil. Our meal was not worth the price. I would have rather bought groceries and cooked breakfast on my own in my hotel room.   The ONE upside, (which is why I had to give two stars instead of one), is that they will bring you complimentary bread upon request. The corn bread is to die for and the dinner rolls are delicious as well.  I still wouldn't return. But just to help you out... Request the bread!

fdcDBOfGQchlLGvMnoskpg.text: I ate here with a few friends while in Vegas. The prices were great here and service was helpful. It is located inside of the Tuscany Hotel and Casino. We came in with no wait and was able to sit immediately. I think this is a good spot to eat at the following day after a long night in Vegas. There isn't much to the place when it comes to ambience, but don't let that stop you from striking a good deal on some pretty decent food.

ui9Q3rk1H6hI24Ps8byu4g.text: I wouldn't go for the chicken pot pie, but the $6 burger was amazing value for your money!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $6 burger, awesome value!
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The remnants of Chicken pot pie.

ZixK9YYpjuwybldUyzPzdg.text: We went here on Thursday morning, Thanksgiving for family breakfast. 6 people so we are seated right at the front at a larger table.  Drinks served quickly, order taken in appropriate amount of time.  And then the wait started. We waited just under an hour for food to be served. I have no clue why so long as the place wasn't even full.  Food was alright, nothing exceptional or horrible. We had both breakfast and lunch items. Prices were acceptable. Servers friendly but the wait was painful.  Staff at casino on phone were rude when i asked where the restaurant was located. We won't go back.

TA-bgl-Fwtkbp08MI7hY9A.text: $3.99 Steak & Eggs! The perfect meal when you've had a bit too manys drink after a night of dancing in Vegas. I am definitely coming here again!  Also, WATER! Our waiter was super good at refilling our water, especially after being so dehydrated from all the alcohol.

EXg6Z9Sx-w_BxMfHvNolLg.text: Great alternative to waiting in a long line at Ellis Island for almost the same exact $5.99 steak and eggs deal!   I found the steak to be much better here because it has a less burnt taste compared to Ellis Island. The only thing I didn't really like were the hashbrowns.

DNZKy51Ut-dUGAoSE2pAXg.text: Came just for dessert.  it is not on the menu, but the serving tray full of desserts, you will find something. They have all kinds of desserts. We got carrot cake and apple pie, both with vanilla ice cream.  The server was great.  Desserts were great.

6vprB9GPXEbXhVyKdQ7cVQ.text: Great service and delicious food. I had the French toast with banana strawberry and blueberries. 5,50$. Great value.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast with Red, white and Blue. Very very very good! Around 6$

0Zu5aK3W5K81_gZvhctGRw.text: 4 star food. 2 star service. Average score of 3 stars.  Food came out very slowly. Room wasnt packed and we still waited 1 hour.  Server forgot water and napkins on 2 separate occasions and rarely checked in on us.  If the food was faster, its be a 4 average but for some reason a 5 top that got seated after us was served 20 minutes before we were.

susWdCc6D4OfOdtrnp3xwQ.text: Wow, I haven't posted a review. I've been here a handful of times and I'm always satisfied! Can't wait for my next visit...breakfast late at "night"/extremely early, lol.   Great selections and even better prices!!! A lot of dining places close early, so this spot is awesome for being 24/7. The service is attentive and the food/cappuccino is delicious!   My only real complaint is the overbearing ciggie smell (gross). The only thing that makes that somewhat ok is I'm so hungry I just focus on food (that or I've been drinking...haha)! Oh & bring a jacket you sexy ladies, unless you don't mind all the stares (cuz this is a "dive" restaurant).

_zKf-gbFf4Gn60RlIgYDUQ.text: Looked up a place to have a good and inexpensive dinner, when we found this place on yelp we decided to try it out.  Located in the quaint, friendly and clean Tuscany Suites Casino it is truly a great place to enjoy some very good food, quaint and homely atmosphere. We were sat at our table very quickly, our waiters were very friendly and provided the specials of the day. Our food came out rather quickly and we were very happy with our choices. We had dinner and came back for breakfast the next morning. We enjoyed our food very much and will definitely be going back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Chicken Breast Dinner for $8.99.The chicken was very juicy &amp; flavorful; which our waiter suggested I get, Garlic&amp;Butter
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $4.99 Hamburger Special. Very juicy and cooked to order.

gI5ubE5fWxLy3YVGoYEtVA.text: Breakfast is always the best! I come to vegas at least four times a year, on the way the last place to stop os Marilyn's at the tuscany casino. Food and service is always tops, not to mention the decent prices of the food.

l2bgpYImHCyovGUioAKWYA.text: 24 hours and everything is delicious. I have never heard of ANYONE getting food that wasnt up to par. Noce full menue. Friday nights all you can eat crab legs is always a hit!!

KzzeSEur5W9xElp16-6wDA.text: The food here is pretty good, & we've eaten here a few times during our stay. The first 2 times we did have good service, the 3rd time our waitress was outstanding. I would've given a higher rating overall , although the last time, I phoned the restaurant to order for pickup. The first time calling a female answering the phone, placed me on hold for a good 7-8 mins without picking up again. I proceeded to call back only to have the same person place me on hold again, which seemed even longer this time! I stayed with the call as I thought maybe they're too busy...now I'm thinking they don't like phone orders.They don"t re-answer,. Not great customer service on calls, that's for sure.

XzlgJ9AYwLKPwLYm7GOEgQ.text: Got into Vegas late and didn't want to drive far at 11 at night. They get 3 stars because the portions are huge for the price you pay. They lost two stars because the food just doesn't taste all that well. Come in at certain times for excellent deals. They charge 18% for groups of 8 or more even if half of them are kids.

QIiij8yTWiK2euytSQzMJw.text: This food was by far the worst ever. The powdered eggs look as bad as they look, soggy hash, undercooked pancakes and sour tuna melt were all just as bad. Management is rude and needs to step up on food quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Terrible powdered eggs, soggy hash, undercooked pancakes and sour tuna melt!

hvYm6JiCyt3ho9O98oDpVQ.text: My friends and I walked here from the strip and it took us about 20 minutes following the GPS on our phones. At 1AM in the morning, the walk felt pretty shady. But we made it safely!  After wandering into the Tuscany hotel and casino, we were directed to Marilyn's Cafe. As a group of 5, my friends and I were seated nearly immediately. Once our waiter came around to take our order, he automatically asked if all wanted the steak and eggs. Assumption correct!  At $5.99, the steak and eggs were such a steal! Steak and eggs were both cooked according to personal preferences and they even include toast plus hashbrowns.  Not sure if it was just the late night hunger talking or what, but the steak was delicious! Best $5.99 I spent in Vegas! I'd definitely recommend coming here!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs!

jd6Nk8LXfVdE5XxZxufu-A.text: First, it's a diner. Not to say that you shouldn't expect decent food but these places have a certain kind of menu and in my opinion, it was executed very well. Food was great and extremely inexpensive for Vegas, we're from Orange County and even at diners we're used to unnecessarily high restaurant prices so my boyfriend and I were both pretty surprised at how reasonable it was.  The service, however, is what the five stars is for.  James was our waiter and I'm pretty sure I've never had a sweeter, more helpful gentleman assist us. He was prompt, kind, and enthusiastic. He checked on us constantly even though the place was packed (at 1:30 am too!) and I know they were slammed that weekend since most of the city was booked out completely, including the Tuscany. We even called the manager over at to complement his service and she acknowledged that he always had a great attitude. I would come back for that alone!

GNQ6x7DpOg3vzNWdaB1VtQ.text: As of 11/1/2014: Friday Night is All You Can Eat Crab Legs.  $19.99  The AYCE crab is great and the butter is served with a candle underneath it so it stays warm through out the meal.  This is not a buffet...they actually serve plates of crab to your table.  Friendly and attentive service.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Candle keeps your butter nice and warm.
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Legs AYCE served hot
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $19.99 AYCE On Fridays

2QXGE4oHqeCrH4I2088PNA.text: Loooooooooove  Marilynns , always on point excellant food and staff, forget the strio resataunts tourist traps , im gonna write guy fiery a letter saying "weve been to Marilynns.....we want our money back"  lol the burger at Marilynns distroys any on the strip and its only like 8.49 , dont be a tourist get over to Marilynns and see for yourself

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7nKeChewKNgwhN_HAqARFg.text: Got unlucky with the server but for the prices and the quality of the food... it doesn't even matter! Best part is you can order dinner during lunch hour!

y-GAhWZcBC5TGxgs1KCIzQ.text: Meh, had an OK lunch here. Went with a coworker based on the good reviews, I should have realized many were based on their steak & eggs deal. The place was nice enough, and the waiter was really nice, but the food was really mediocre.  I got the Philly cheesesteak with sweet potato fries. The fries were good, but the cheesesteak was pretty abysmal. It would have been OK if it weren't for the fact that the roll was separated (or maybe so soggy it fell apart) on the bottom, and it just made eating it really difficult. That plus it was very greasy just made it a meh experience.   I was also expecting dirt cheap, but 8.99 for a bad cheesesteak is way too much. Wouldn't recommend it, though the people were very nice!

iPjtKyzy1rhWla3Q0znIyA.text: A rare find in LV: good food, inexpensive.  Wives had the lobster and steak spedial $13.  I had the prime rib $14.  Friend had the strip steak $14.  All was served hot.  The food was delicious and the two sides were selected from a list of 18 items.  I chose the mac and cheese and this was the best I ever had at a restaurant.  May be the best band for the buck in LV

Q4H2TtBrUXT0sBRuPpz_qQ.text: Stayed at the Tuscany for my birthday weekend.  My wife and I went here after we checked in and this place was amazing!  Our server, Melfer, was very attentive and professional.  Food was awesome!  Also came here for breakfast the next day and it was even more delicious than I expected!  We will definitely make this restaurant a staple on our future visits!!

AAM7q0n2UL4-YL1GsRjCXA.text: It's late at night and you're on the strip and you want something cheap and filling to satisfy your drunken cravings!  I usually come here after partying or after a long hard day of work. Staff here is friendly and service is usually good and food comes out good most of the time (Note that I order the same thing almost every time I come here! Lol).   This is 'THE SPOT' to go for some cheap late night steak and eggs. At $5.99 from 12am-5am you can't really complain. Compared to another Cafe, located at a point somewhere south, the service and food quality is substantially better and it's located closer to the Vegas Strip off of Flamingo @ The Tuscany. Recommended spot to go to after the club.  JuL's Tips * Dollar extra to add mushrooms or cheese to your eggs. * Gets busy on weekends (Naturally because of clubs) Don't be shy to wave down a server if you need something they are nice. * After 5am you'll have to wait til 6am for $8.99 Steak & Egg special which runs til 11am. * Food taste better when you're drunk.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf with Mash potatoes and corn.
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelett time
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0AXVjRyG1SqdF7eGcUJAmw.text: We stopped by for brunch on a Sunday around 11am. It was busy, but we still got a table right away. It's a pretty typical diner/cafe inside of a casino, but Marilyn's is a good deal. There are many specials on the boards at the entrance.  The service was friendly and quick. The decor isn't super duper, but it's comfortable. What we're really there for is good cheap eats and that's what we got.  We both got the French Toast Complete special. Food is definitely tasty enough and really good for the price.  If you give Marilyn's a try, you'll be satisfied with the food and happy about how much you spent for it.

a0tNlacoNGpgZT2DorMVvA.text: Nice restaurant, very clean. Staff was very attentive and helpful. Our waiter was funny and the food was good for the price. I would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan with spaghetti

2gXm0iBPUGWrI1RxU-DK_g.text: What a HUGE menu, and this place is open 24 hours! Everything on the menu is a steal, the prices are so good. I've been here a couple of times, its no 5-star dining experience, but its the most bang for your buck around.  I was in a party of 4 and we seated at a very small table, we asked to be moved to a different table. Apparently our new table was in a different waiters zone, but out old waiter (who had not given us anything other than the menus) decided to keep serving us. Both waiters kept repeating the other by asking for our drink orders in succession, each unaware of the other. Once they found out there was a slight verbal disagreement as to who would actually serve us. Made for a bit of an awkward experience for us. Our original server, probably not used to serving this table, neglected us a lot, and we found ourselves asking the server for this area for assistance quite often. Our food took tremendously long, almost 30 minutes to come out, and this was at 1pm....  I would come back again for the menu, hopefully service will be better organized next time.

kI36wHumVBi191EoCbc6ew.text: Wow, I'm speechless at the fact that they serve Steak and Eggs for so cheap! I paid about less than $5. I definitely would suggest to anyone to come here if you're in Vegas drunk and craving steak and eggs.   The service here was good. Nothing to complain about really, but the fact that the table smelled pretty bad when we got seated. I don't know what they use to wipe down the tables and or if it's their table cloth they use. It smelled really bad. It didn't take long at all to get seated for my group party of 11. Also it didn't take long for the food to come. The server didn't give us a hard time at all. There was more food that sounded delicious on the menu, but steak and egg did me good and was very satisfying.  But like I said, if you're ever in the mood for steak and egg definitely come by and check this restaurant out.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $5 for Steak &amp; Eggs!

slvW8r-HCmWYym6L3tkMQA.text: This is a quaint cafe located in rear of the Tuscany Casino. This cafe serves good quality affordable food 24/7. They have a wide ranging menu that can easily satisfy your culinary needs. They have a great steak & eggs breakfast. They have good southern style grits. Enjoy this gem with free parking and great prices for comfort food!

hgAq0ite-IHJZaIw9cf07g.text: Huge menu had breakfast, standard fare cooked well not a long wait with great service.    Wonderful place for simplicity, service and value.  I will go back.

6lw5aBvNmgDCoFjQP_0jUQ.text: Verrryyy friendly staff ! I wish I knew the name of our server, she was really sweet . Black girl , I wanna say her name is AJ ? You go giiiirlllll  Came here w a party of 8, we all got the steak & eggs special (5.95 boyyyeeeee , jump on it) and ofc we all ordered it differently & she handled it well w| no mistakes . & it was really good too , cooked the way I like . Aha , Will def be back

o5hZyTiW8hW8K21eQ3hXjw.text: This is definitely the spot to go after a night of clubbing and walking the strip!   $5 steak and eggs includes steak & two eggs (both cooked to your liking), hash browns, and four pieces of toast with butter and jelly. You really can't beat this meal for the price.  Service was kind of slow (or maybe we were all just starving ...), but expected since this place fills up with people getting back from the club. For the low price, I can wait.  The steak & eggs special isn't on the menu, so just ask for it. It runs from midnight - 5am.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $5 steak and eggs!

HSV_Rjlz6FSrZ_CKQ6I7dQ.text: Finally came on a Friday night to attack this $15 AYCE crab legs special I keep hearing about. I quickly changed my mind after see what everyone else was getting. Pretty basic crab legs that you could get at anywhere. So I decided to skip the AYCE crab legs and try something else.  Order a full rack of BBQ pork ribs. Amazing. Add them to my list of bbq spots. Tender fall off the bone, perfectly cooked, real delicious BBQ sauce. Also came with 2 sides and rolls at your demand, ask for corn bread you'll like them. I forget the price but it was about $13-15. Plenty of ribs to go around.  Steak and egg were ok a bet pricey about $13 regular and $6 during its graveyard special.  The monster burger special is still a good deal at $5 but I guess it wasn't as gourmet as I last thought but still good.  As always excellent service on a busy Friday night.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aWhym6k5ADa4pz79VS5UxQ.text: Everytime I am in Vegas I make sure to stop at Marilyn's Cafe to grab a bite. I always order the prime rib medium rare and the chef always cook it perfectly. The staff are nice and pleasant.  It gets really pack on weekends, which affects the speed of the service, but it's understandable. Great food for reasonable price!

dSRUCD8QG1ro3lq8Xw9PWw.text: I guess when you're drunk at 4 am and need a lil' somethin' for your tummy to soak up excess alcohol that you chugged several hours ago, Marilyn's is your place. STEGGS all day err'day~  I don't remember much from this experience because alcohol and lack of sleep don't mix well and I fell asleep waiting for my food. BUT, when it came, the steak was delicious. And the eggs. And the hashbrowns. I'm surprised I was able to finish everything!!  Service is SLOW SLOW SLOW. We played at the tables while waiting to be seated. I mean, it was early in the morning and there wasn't a huge party but of course, they want you to spend some time gambling. LOL i c ur strategy. Waiting for our food took FOREVER but since I took a mini nap, it was ok.

S7v9rMXeCsl2_JBwpIuH8Q.text: My father and I ate a lunchtime breakfast here today. Absolutely everything we had was delicious. Their hashbrowns (which I got and would definitely suggest getting with the onions, cheese and country gravy) were cooked to perfection. The sourdough toast was reminiscent of Sunday at grandma's. If you're a country gravy kinda person (and I mean, who isn't?!) then you'll be a fan of this joint! The pancakes were light and fluffy. Biscuits were as well. Butter served. My dad got a bowl which included a variety of breakfast options tossed in together and has not shut up about it since! Would recommend to anyone needing a touch of the simple life while in the big city!

YxSagx75OYlRAlFKh8-2ag.text: The service was great. The food was decent. We ordered prime rib, steak, blt, and fried cod. The fried cod had a lot of meat. I've had better prime rib. It was a bit dry. The steak was a bit tough. Not bad not great.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York steak

a6V-DStrKWeqN6ICilcA_Q.text: We loved dining at Marilyn's Cafe inside Tuscany Suites during our visit! The prices were reasonable and the food was great! Even if I stayed at another Hotel I would consider stopping by Marilyn's Cafe.

WNAgAgC9fqZTobRzHBVVTQ.text: Came here on Friday for the AYCE crab legs. The crab legs were fine, but after a while, I got sick of opening up the shells to get the meat...haha. It can get a little busy for the crab legs, so getting a refill on your drink can be a little bit of a challenge sometimes. The staff is nice, though. They will replenish your crab leg supply often, and most of the time before you're done with your last batch. I think it was nice to try once, but since I live across town, I don't think I will need to return. I haven't tried any of the other food, so I don't know if it's any good.

wbMNvalJ2ob1OHRmcARuWQ.text: I'm not sure what all the fuss is about, because we found this place to be rather average. Here's the rundown.   Off the strip so prices are normal for the food that is served. Like Denny's but in a casino.   When we had breakfast there the bus boy must have been on strike, because many of the tables were a mess.   The hostess tried to sit us at a couple messy tables and then found one that had a Bobby pin on it. Apparently she was puzzled that I found that gross.   The waitress we had looked like she was in a perennial state of pissed off!   Overall - This may not be a place that you would go out of your way to have a meal, I know I won't.

WpLghi3qBrq115au5PeLkw.text: I came here one night to try out this place based on a recommendation from a friend... and I honestly wished I never tried it. This has got to be the most boring, uninteresting and slowest restaurant I've ever been to. First of all, my steak took nearly an hour to come out, and it wasn't even all that busy. The steak wasn't even that great... it was the most basic-tasting steak I've ever had. Absolutely nothing fabulous. None of the people who work there are articulate, I could barely understand what my waiter was saying. It's real cheap, I'll give it that, but the service and food is very subpar. I don't see myself coming back to the Tuscany anytime soon.

HvjeOBIThS8mxc4nS9R5-A.text: This Cafe use to be one of the best in town, the service use to be fast and friendly. Recently they took away the large menu they had for late night and made it into one page it's horrible, more than half the stuff we use to order are not available anymore on the late menu. We usually go twice a week I dont think we will go any more. Also lately every time we have been in there the food has not been consistent. Some of the staff is very friendly but not enough for us to go back. Also phone Reception in the whole place is really bad also.

ynpT-JDZvvX7vc7SooM7QQ.text: !!! $5.99 STEAK AND EGGS FROM 12 AM - 5 AM !!!  Next time you find yourself in Vegas and awake after midnight, be sure to pay Marilyn's a visit solely for this special! This is clearly a blessing to late night partiers and midnight snackers alike. It was so great to enjoy a hearty sit down breakfast at 4 am after not having time to eat a proper meal all day. It's slightly off the beaten path of the Strip, but not too far to be inconvenient.  The food itself was average at best, but it was so cheap that it didn't really matter to me. If you care about the quality, then maybe you're better off going elsewhere. My steak had a lot of gristle on it that I had to cut off. The other elements (eggs, hash browns, toast) are hard to mess up so those were fine. I think the quality is comparable to normal diner food. My friend ordered a basket of calamari and it was not good, but then why would you get calamari at a diner?   Service was polite and quick given the hour. This is a great spot for late night comfort food, good and simple.  Food: 2.5, Service: 3, Environment: 4, Price: 5

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. STEAK N EGGS!

bjsur6q1y4xNwTw17yDmhg.text: doesn't offer takeout to anyone other than the hotel guests. Frustrating to go through menu and pick items only to never be served.

VuE-bkShJl4_is6usH-sxw.text: Went on Sunday morning and now Wednesday morning. Good food and service for a great value. Coincidence that I woke up to an Amex email about fraudulent charges on the credit card I had just used at this location a few days prior? Will never know!

EBnq0JH0c9j_oBTpx-4d5Q.text: When we got our food it was cold.  There biscuit and gravy had too much pepper. Coffee was nasty.

LwrN-MLsN3wK97X2VSx0cQ.text: Amazing prices for the portions and quality of food you get! Definitely recommend this hidden gem of a breakfast place in Vegas

cdHXmWoVDShFvsfGBTViCg.text: My family was looking for a late night meal and this popped up.  Kenny provided superior and exceptional customer service.  Never was our waters empty.  The bone in steak was amazing and the cost just made it that much better.  Will visit again on my next trip.

5sPO5E5Oc7nuo1C-TYIodA.text: BEST breakfast sandwich EVER!! Sourdough was grilled perfectly  Eggs and cheese melted to perfection. I will def be coming back every time we r in Vegas! Super friendly staff and quick too!

v8nce3obWw5UT013PBihDw.text: Nice place, way in the back of the casino though. Super Smokey! Your lungs will hate you for it, however the food is tasty and a good value and service is great.

qrBaDObEJ5cORnOaFX4iaA.text: The prices here are very affordable and the portions are huge. Our server was really attentive and the tables were clean. It's located inside of Tuscany Suites. I highly recommend grabbing a quick lunch here if you're on a budget.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-W9BWm0fzYA80UvYp2uphg.text: Best hidden gem off the strip! Located in Tuscany Suites, it's perfect if you want that quick humongous diner breakfast in the wee hours of the morning! I'd definitely choose this place and get steak and eggs with pancakes and potatoes for less than $10 instead of paying more than double somewhere on the strip. It's definitely a no-frills type of place and it's the opposite of fancy/elegant. But sometimes, if you just want cheap, good food that's a step up from Denny's or Norm's... this is the place!

pj9dJ6-ydPWVu3YnRLXR5Q.text: We went for the late night menu. They have a steak & eggs special for $5.99. It was delicious. I also ordered the banana pancakes and that was the reason for this review...they were hands down the best banana pancakes I've ever eaten!!  They were fluffy, perfect homemade batter with slices of sweet delicious banana.  I'd go back again for sure!!

dY5cxwNjPx8xqhYRr7DwZQ.text: Super delicious! Mozzarella sticks are one of a kind  We choose this placed based off of walking distance from our hotel. There was a line of people waited to be seated, which went by super fast. Our drink orders were taken immediately. Menu items are all very affordable and all sound delicious. Food did not take an eternity to reach our table. The waiters constantly checked if we needed anything. Very friendly manager of some sort was also walking the floor making sure everyone was satisfied. Bathroom is outside of the restaurant, but it's literally right next to it so not a problem. Hopefully we return here once more before our Vegas stay is over.

dUZlbnfmCjKRjyzcgqvOsg.text: I went with my wife an kids an we loved our food!!the country fried steak an mashed potatoes put a big smile on my face!!!the mashed potatoes was so good omg lol I always loved this place.nice waiters an the home cooked food is jus good for u!i will be a regular customer for sure from now on.GREAT FOOD

oMvqYk6rZpAaKJn-lb7qMg.text: This is the kind of place you can go to multiple times a day and not get tired of it. My family was visiting from out of town and they stayed at the Tuscany so we had a lot of meals here and every time we had great service and great food all while not breaking the bank. I didn't know that this place existed before but it is now my go to spot. Tonight I had a 12oz NY Strip with 2 sides for $12.99. And it was delicious. Also try the Mac and cheese.

rnD4G7PwWXTmlDSPyaiS_g.text: Located inside the Tuscany hotel this place is a great place to stop. Quality and reasonably priced I would give this place a try. I ordered room service from here as well as had lunch a different there later in the week on my trip. It was so good I went back for round two!  They have a different specials nightly too so don't forget to check those out!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f8rxsbAew6C6jNE-tVDTlw.text: Our favorite dining place in Vegas. Food quality is really good. The bread, the pasta, the steak, everything I've tried here tastes good.  Even my kids enjoyed eating here and asked to come back again when we were looking for places to eat.  The best part? It is so affordable! Feels like 30% cheaper than bay area restaurants!

MtX3uiYR6HfuURDolF_oZw.text: If I could give these place less than a 1 I would. We traveled from Dallas to hang out in Vegas for a few days and for a late night meal we stop at Marilyn's Cafe.  Service flat out suck. We waited over 40 mins for our food, when it was served it came out cold. We ask for the manager and was another waiter came to assist. We were told we could warm your food in the microwave. Tara the manager finally came out to speak with us. We were told by Tara that they were very busy And short staff. And she could reheat our food up in the microwave. That was the best she could do. We decided to keep the cold food but still never received any of the condiments, such as jelly or syrup. Poor customer service.

t2QvjTOv7uvVmsL_cH7oNg.text: This was probably my favorite place to come for crab legs. Unfortunately, now you only get 1 pound for $19.99 and it's no longer all you can eat. We went last Friday, the service was horrible. I asked for a pound and 3/4 (since you can get 3/4 more for $9.99) I was asked, "Are you sure about that?" Yes I'm sure. I wouldn't have asked. I said never mind I'll just take the pound. Before this even was ordered we were sat down and someone asked what drinks we wanted. Then the waiter who really should learn some personality waited on the couple that came in after us. Icing on the cake was we repeatedly had to keep having my husbands drink refilled, yet the couple who came in after us was being waited on hand and foot. Won't be back for a while. Value is awful now and it just wasn't fun.

TrFuVjuAlr_zxr1M9rHlKA.text: Weather in a Friday for the all-you-can-eat crab as I have done for the past 8 years.  Or the crab was not aware it was a $19.95 1 lb special.  the waiter did not alert me to that, because I was ignoring the six by five flyer on the table hidden in the condiment holder.    Crab came out cold and would not break cleanly.  I thought I would plow for this one and ask for hot crab for the next plate.  If I had known it was a $20 plate of crab I would have sent it back.  Ended up ordering a second dinner of chicken cordon bleu.  Much smaller than usual it was previously served as a large portion now it is 2 frozen pucks of deep fried breaded turkey and ham.  my out-of-town friend who had coached into arriving Friday night instead of Saturday morning was also disappointed with his order of crab.  He ordered a New York strip steak of which that was also disappointing.  the best thing on his plate was the yam with butter and brown sugar.    Even the nice plump cornbread of several months ago is now very limited and you only get 4 small slices.    It is apparent that they have cut back on portions, are charging for extra ranch or anything that's not on the table services poor -my water glass sat empty several times. I had to waive down the waiter three times to get attention when he was walking by with eyes straight ahead.  Empty plates and serving utensils stayed on the table until we left waiting for them to be picked up as our second dinners came.    overall it went from one of my favorite place to take out-of-towners to some place I will now avoid to eat.  I hope that the lounge is still a reasonable place but I now doubt it.

qNvRQMybB7yIKUhNgSc4Rg.text: Breakfast experience was 5 star. Obviously you're not at a Michelin restaurant so for what it is, you can't get much better than this. All the breakfast items you could want served 24-7.  Tried 3 types of pancakes, all great.  Luis is awesome!

xfB_EVLTP0NDxBACpQXynA.text: STEAK AND EGGS. That's all you need to order here.. well also come after a night out because it's only $6!! Who cares if the steak is not top cut, it's SIX bucks. Probably the best $6 dollars you will spend in Vegas. It's very close to the strip, I think only one or two blocks away from Las Vegas Blvd. The steak and eggs comes with two eggs, hash browns (ask for extra crispy), and not 1, 2, or 3.. but 4 pieces of toast. Get the sourdough, slab some butter and strawberry jam.. so freaking food. (they put butter on it already, but if you want more butter). The servers are amazing and hospitable, even though they probably see a bajillion drunk people every night. The only thing is that sometime it takes a while for the food to come out. My friends have fallen asleep waiting for their steak and eggs. I always come back to this place at least once every Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nom nom nom

ELkHk7jAIV6PNlCrzp6ojQ.text: After reading some suggestons for cheap eats for breakfast from various posters on Las Vegas message boards, we decided to check it out. I am all for fine dining and cheap eats while in Vegas, LOL!  Hubby ordered biscuits and gravy and I had the eggs benedict (8.99), and it was plain nasty. The Canadian bacon had a rancid oil taste, yuck and the hollandaise sauce wasn't good either. I prefer my hubby's version, yum! Not to mention their coffee was too strong. Slow service, and our waitress showed no care either.  I guess you get what you pay for, but if you really want cheap eats for breakfast in Vegas I'd go with Ellis Island.

Av6sMKwRInUvbQAPkR9RaA.text: The food was great and very affordable. It's open 24/7 and they have a steak and egg special ($6) from 12am - 5am.  The service was awesome every day we went there. You get seated fast and the food comes out in a timely manner.

kuJMmINFv50Lp3IuaKASvA.text: The best thing to come here for is the steak and egg special for $5.99. You get a steak, hash browns, two eggs, and white or wheat toast. It is a great deal, but sometimes it takes a really long time to come through. There were a few times where I felt like it was taking a really long time (30 min+) but I won't complain because the price is extremely affordable.  The service is nice, they usually refill consistently. The entrees tale a very long time to come, especially if you get the steak and eggs.  Upon finishing the meal, you just bring the receipt up to the cash register and someone assists you with the transaction from there.

ny2lVh0uADTys-LBtRC0IQ.text: Oh NOOOOOO! The horror of finding out they no longer have all you can eat crablegs Friday!! $19.99 for the 1st lb and $10.99 for 3/4 refill of crablegs!!! Whaaaaatttttt???!!! Please please bring back all you can eat crablegs Friday!!! I've been coming here since 2010! I'm devastated!

ndxSqGtUFYoy9AP3eQ1wXg.text: Service and atmosphere were both great. Very good coffee and the chocolate chip pancakes were to die for!

puJyMvx8Hmbqa8HU2g-nRQ.text: This review is only for the steak and eggs. Prices keep increasing every time I come (it was like $3.99 back then but now it's $5.99), but it is still the best late-night steak and eggs in town. Note, this pricing only applies after 1am or something super late like that, but hey, it's perfect for those after-clubbing munchies. I've never ordered anything else here.  My steak is always cooked perfectly medium rare. The one at Ellis Island is always overdone. I get my eggs sunny side up with runny yolk. Sourdough toast, which they spread melted butter all over. You don't even need the jam that they give you. And then hash browns to round it all out. Some places give you fried potatoes, which is just not the same.   Located inside Tuscany Suites, which is only a few blocks away from the Strip. Open 24 hours, for obvious reasons. Never a wait. Seriously can't beat that!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Eggs (5/5)

NtMzZ2Khhda0VaShuoJGJA.text: Worst brunch ever. So there is a group I belong to that goes out for brunch once a month. This month we chose Marilyn's. We've been here many times and the food is good. BUT TODAY...we were done eating some of us were paying our check some were still talking. I had walked almost to the front door and our waitress comes running out after us. She said we didnt pay the check. Everyone had separate checks and the 3 of us standing there had just come from the register. So she describes the person who didn't pay. And I told her are u sure? She was at the cash register. SO the waitress sends security to get her in the parking lot. They bring her to the cash register and she tells them I paid IN CASH and pointed at the cashier that was there. So they don't believe her and the waitress is freaking out. My friend asks if there are cameras because she paid. The cashier suddenly remembers that yes she paid but she was busy and put the money aside. So my friend us like soooo are we good? Everyone is like oh ok. No apology. The manager said we had to investigate. NO APOLOGY. ARE YOU KIDDING ME? NOTHING. BEWARE OF EATING HERE. MAKE SURE U GET A RECEIPT WHEN YOU PAY. ESPECIALLY IF YOU PAY CASH. THIS IS A SHADY SHADY PLACE.

062h0rGpVsFIQXMIGlLVLQ.text: Stayed at the Tuscany suites casino hotel. Ordered the grilled salmon for $13.99. The food was decent considering it was located in the casino with all the smoke.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled salmon $13.99

lNXMaHqvctZefujxCJK62w.text: Exactly what we were looking for! Inexpensive, great food and super friendly, fast service. We had omelettes with our own ingredients. Rye and sourdough toast were both flavourful. Hash browns were crispy.  It's a little bit of a walk off the strip but you'll be happy of the walk back to shake down your meal.

BdkhGTYxX8ciZX0k4QkPBw.text: Had the Breakfast special. Food tasted really good. The steak had a little bit of excess fat on it but for that low price it's fine. The waitress was extremely nice but also busy. Would definitely dine again.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

STsbxvJSfqdkCTZH5jyd9w.text: While some Vegas hotel-casinos are known for their grandiose buffets, others are more known for their cheap, late-night steak & eggs specials. Marilyn's is an unassuming diner found within the Tuscany casino. Open 24 hours a day, this special only runs midnight to 6:00 am and is off menu.   Looking back at reviews from a few years ago, the price of the steak & eggs special has been steadily increasing by about a dollar a year. It was $3.99 back in 2011-12, $4.99 in 2013, and now currently $5.99. Still, it's a cheap deal for a 6 oz. NY strip (see what they did there?), 2 eggs any style, hash browns, and toast (wheat, rye, or sourdough). Don't expect too much because the steak isn't like Lawry's across the street, but it'll do for late-night eats.   The best tip I can offer is to order the steak one level rarer than what you usually get. I once received a well-done steak after ordering a medium-rare. My rare order last night came out a decent medium-rare.

-xR-mdBE906keEgIML5cbw.text: STEAK AND EGGS.  The one thing you have to do in Vegas is get steak and eggs at like 3am.    We came on Friday night after XS.  Driving it isn't too far from the strip, about 5 minutes or so and plenty of parking.  It's located in the Tuscany hotel and casino.  PARKING: Free, huge parking lot.  ATMOSPHERE: Has that denny's/ihop feel to it but we got a big booth for 8 of us and were seated right away.  FOOD: Coming at 2:30am they had the steak and eggs special.  I didn't see it on the menu but just ask for it and the waiter will get it for you.  I think it was $4.99 or $5.99 but either way very cheap.  Ask for it more rare than you normally order it because it is pretty thin and they tend to overcook the meat.  I got medium rare and it was only pink.    The platter comes with steak, 2 eggs, hash browns and 4 pieces of toast (you can choose).  I got the eggs over easy and they were runny but not gross.  I got sourdough toast, where they put the butter on it for you and it was SO GOOD.  The hash browns were tasty, not bland and hard but still hot and crispy.  The steak was OK, as you can imagine for such a cheap price, but the flavoring wasn't bad.  It was just slightly tough.  Overall, definitely a must for your trip to Vegas.

NTZpvSnjpaBqfI3TjFpIhg.text: This was a fantastic find! The walk was totally worth it. It just goes to show that you sometimes pay a premium for places on the strip that isn't even worth it. Vegas city blocks are long, but this one is a few away from the strip. We came here for breakfast, and it was delicious and I believe correctly priced for food and the overall value. The staff was on point. While one hostess was helping a customer paying the bill at the register, another one saw us to get us seated at a table. They seem to work well together noticing when refills were needed for beverages. I like that my chicken and waffles were tenders. It's been slightly annoying for me as of late to have to pick apart the chicken from bones. I am pretty sure that if I come back to Vegas again I would definitely stop in here for another meal. My boyfriend actually went back again the next day for breakfast.

Zv-7epQ5NOU739LONvuCmA.text: The food here is delicious. My bbq chicken was sooo tender it fell right off the bone. My mashed potatoes and mac n cheese were creamy and well seasoned. My dinner was only $9.99. My husband's breakfast was only $8.99. You won't regret stopping here.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marilyn&#39;s Omelette, Hash Brown and Toast $8.99
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Chicken, Mashed Potatoes and Mac &amp; Cheese $9.99
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Chicken $9.99 Marilyn&#39;s Omelette  $8.99

64CQ4L_wZMz5GzmAoBkbiA.text: Horrible Experience!  Waitress ignored our table for 10 minutes or more.  Then, we asked the hostess and the waitress acted like we were an inconvenience.    The food was slow to arrive and was mediocre.    Then, the slow waitress was mad when we asked for a refill on coffee.  My husband paid the bill at the counter but the slow waitress ran after us as we left the casino accusing us of not paying even though we did.

z8vgs5FojoHgzo7_4iLZrw.text: My friend and I went here for one reason: the low food costs. This is far from a hole-in-the-wall establishment; this is a "I want a sit-down dinner for less than $10 a person." The menu is your standard casino cafe fair: breakfast, lunch, dinner.   I made the regretful choice of picking dinner (I really love breakfast food). I opted for chicken cordon bleu with a side of mac and cheese and broccoli. I had my doubts about ordering the chicken cordon bleu and I really should have stayed away  and stuck with breakfast. I'm 85% sure my entree was fried along side my friend's chicken tenders. I could hold the chicken breast in my hand and it wouldn't fall apart. The mac n cheese wasn't anything special and the broccoli was standard.   Despite an uneventful dinner, we still ordered dessert. We knew what we were getting into defrosted dessert pies. They were about $5 each and didn't taste the price. The dessert was $3 less than the entree.   Overall, if I was stuck in the area again and wanted a cheap meal, I'd probably go back. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

wI5UyfRJZ5VkzsFHGHbZ0Q.text: Ate dinner here and was not impressed but breakfast was great. Good coffee they kept filled. Had several healthy egg white options and multi grain pancakes that had great flavor

39Cdk0Nf1V04smHF2us3qA.text: A small little diner with a late night special for steak, eggs, hash browns and toast for $5.99. For a very cheap meal, it was pretty tasty.  We all ordered medium rare and each of our steaks came out...MEDIUM RARE!  We all ordered a variety of eggs and it come out just right, my over easy wasn't over cooked and was served with a runny yolk right when I dug my fork into the guy. Wheat toast was toasted to a nice toast & buttered just right. The last piece though...it was drowning in butter where it wasn't melted completely and it was amazing!   Service was super nice. We came in pretty late right when we got to Vegas and they seated us right away and the waitress was a doll.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium rare with over easy eggs and wheat toast

7X8BKao_OkzDsoVNjZUTuQ.text: Sloooow service. Definitely not coming back here since it's not worth it. If you want to have a late night meal go to Tacos el gordo, it's definitely worth it and very affordable.   When we got here I can already see they were busy and understaffed. Took 10 minutes for someone to come up to us and greet us, by then we were already set on the steak and egg deal that I thought was $4.99.   Steak and eggs was nothing  extraordinary, Norms is much better than what I was served. They over buttered my English muffins to the point where I scraped a few good chunks off. The steak was asked for medium rare and was over cooked to well. It was decent but nothing to get excited over. Had to use hot sauce and salt for more flavor. I ordered my eggs over medium since I love it runny and that was surprisingly cooked perfectly. I like combining it with the steak or hash brown, it helps give different texture. Eventually we finished our meal but service was no where to be found for a refill of water. I just grabbed my sister's water and finished it. Eventually we flagged our waiter to get the check and paid our way.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheap late night dinner

h6-iMvC-ll2sWUPt9xCpWw.text: Reasonably priced breakfast in Vegas. No wait and the food was all tasty. Might be a bit difficult to find if you're looking for a standalone building because it is actually inside the Tuscany.

lR9YRmhEwnr9bwsfPoCO2Q.text: This place is one of the most consistent cafes near the strip. They can always fill up your appetite for very small amounts of money. I would say this is the best late night 'steak and eggs' deal in town. (12am - 5am) The steak for a $6 dollar plate is surprisingly high in quality. Their bbq chicken and ribs special is always a hit, and they also have all you can eat crab legs on Friday nights (ends at 10pm). The staff is very nice, although service can be quite slow sometimes.  They do not do the steak and eggs special to go, and they only do call in orders if you are a guest at the Tuscany.   Grant it this is not a high place for fine dining (or even modern fast casual), they seem to deliver every time when one is look for a bite to eat.

uLf5P3yjiTCrkYR-d64S3w.text: I have NEVER had such a good experience in a hotel/casino cafe before. The food here is off the hook! So good that we dined her twice a day our entire stay. My only complaint is that the staff could be a bit friendlier. Especially the night staff.  Had the staff been friendlier, I would have given them 5 stars.

KqpRv6mhqs0wGBtObQtCNQ.text: Wow what a great experience and hidden gem!  So we came here on our way out of Vegas and went based off the Yelp reviews!  Of course since everyone was raving about the steak and eggs we had to try it and it was everything everyone said and more!  Great food great cooked perfectly coffee was very good, and our waitress Riza was soo amazing, super friendly and helpful,  the perfect waitress!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs breakfast!

Irm71mbitxRaR3WNds62jA.text: 3 words. STEAK & EGGS!!  Have a night of clubbing at XS this was the joint to go to with my group of friends. At 3am the place was not as packed, which was good and the food was delicious. 5-6 dollar steak and eggs, who can let that go?  The steak was nicely seasoned and huge!! I couldn't even finish my meal. Maybe because I was exhausted from the night, but this is the go to spot for a night on the strip.

S_Ewwm5b1ztnvsoC2oPUOg.text: Place is pretty neat it's not all crowded as I was expecting due to the casino. The food was delicious will definitely be coming back here tomorrow :) Service was good lady and gentleman were pretty friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. T-bone steak and eggs

8_wSHTsko4BntDFM3cmxlg.text: Stayed at Tuscany hotel and casino while we were in Vegas and this cafe was in the casino.  The best part about it is that it is open 24 hours! So no matter what time of day it is, you can get some decent food that isn't way over priced.  The first visit was for brunch and I have to say their breakfast food is better than their lunch or dinner. I believe breakfast is served all day is the option is always there. For lunch I ordered their prime rib dip with a side of fries. And like I said, it's alright. Their margarita pizza had no basil on it so I have to say I was quite disappointed with that one.  Our servers were nice and honestly I didn't mind coming here everyday since it was so convenient. Would stay here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat lovers breakfast bowl
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancake
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Denver quiche

E8ycOWAYX4y1H21y4_q1og.text: Hailing from the land of the San Gabriel Valley, aka The SGV, where late night cafes were O'plenty... There is place know as ABC Cafe which WAS formerly home to the only $5.99 Steak and Eggs I have known to be in existence... And then they raised their price to $8.99 Which is ludicrous because you know that steak served with frozen veggies and fake instant mashed potatoes ain't worth that damn price... Until LDW '14 my world was about the change.  I've heard many stories of "The Steak and Eggs of Tuscany Suites"... And finally got to experience th for myself this Labor Day Weekend! After night at the nightclub, this was the brightest of ideas to pop into our semi-sober minds! To my astonishment the fabled Steak and Eggs were located at Marilyn's Cafe inside of Tuscany Suites! Stayed there on several occasions and in retrospect, am ashamed I did not take advantage of this when staying only minutes walk from where we stayed.  We were seated immediately and got straight to business! Majority of us went straight for the meal of stories while others went for the Spaghetti and Meatballs which was advertised on the board when walking in.   Once the meals were out and it was finally right before my eyes, I was in amazement of the quality cut of beef they used. Cooked medium rare, just the way I liked it. This was hands down wayyyy under priced! Quality was way better than any steak you would get at any Denny's or Applebee's for 1/2 the price. Me being a good friend... I would recommend this to anyone looking for a quality late night meal!   Oh and don't bother trying anything else... That good. The spaghetti and meatballs aren't anything worth mentioning... But until next time! When the 250 miles are no longer between me and my tastebuds. My wallet will miss you in the meantime.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The stuff of Legends.

pzUH9-LBPtteiTrXbA4nzw.text: This place is a nope!  Took 10 minutes for the waiter to make contact after being seated, then waited 20 minutes for a boot-leather tough t-bone.  Basted eggs were burnt on the bottom.  Still looking for LV's best steak breakfast...

wLE_VOct4srLmu5TSY5lJQ.text: Ate here twice, within the last month.  It's quickly becoming one of my favorite casino coffee shops.  On one visit, I had the NY steak and shrimp, and that was excellent and the price was very reasonable.  On my second visit, I had a reuben sandwich, and that was very very good.  For a coffee shop, it's obvious that the staff takes pride in this cafe, and it even shows in the food presentation.   I hope to be back soon!

cHZXYpougESKGud9-393sQ.text: Steak and Eggs! Steak and Eggs! Steak and Eggs!  Definitely get the steak and eggs. They are bomb and so affordable. You cant get this good of a deal anywhere else on the strip. The sourdough bread was also bomb. I enjoyed everything about my sober late night foodie escapade. The only thing that might be discouraging is the walk to the restaurant. It's a little ways off from the strip, but it's for sure in walking distance.

Sc5uMzcl88TNmy8IelU9FA.text: Food is considerably very good compared to the price. Prices are VERY reasonable and there are a ton of great different choices. Breakfast is so-so but Southern Fried Chicken is a must-try!

Fx-gat-AKVXX_zDydF96vQ.text: I give it a three-star because that says "A-OK."  My wife and I enjoyed breakfast here (once we found it in the rear of the Casino).  I had the Complete French Toast and she had the Meat Lover's Bowl.  Standard breakfast fare, nicely prepared and tasted like it was supposed to - eggs, sausage, bacon and French toast.  My wife's order came with a side of two (2) nice fluffy pancakes.  She said the breakfasts were "Yummy!"  There was enough food that we both ended up taking a sizable portion as carry out.    I had a cup of coffee (I won't get that again - it didn't taste very good and they give you the creamer that comes in those little pull-tab plastic dealies).  Looks like they also take call-in orders as there is a "pick-up take-out" window.  Both meals including the coffee came to just under $22.00.  We would come back again.

yuFvNSg9xOpgkNCw2SS1kA.text: Went here late so food review might be a little off.   The place is good size with nice wait staff and the kitchen was quick.  We had steak and eggs and everyone was happy.  The deal of the night was all you can eat pancakes.   Who doesn't like pancakes at 2am.  Great little find.

ctUWlmkIYfSv7HZCzb190g.text: Great place for normal breakfast in Vegas

0rSAPVyFif2sfWjHgWHwSw.text: $4.99 late night steak and eggs!  We used to take a $25 (one way!) cab ride to South Point for their $2.95 steak and eggs. But since I discovered this spot, I'll definitely be going here instead of alllllll the way to South Point.  It took a while before we got our food, but the wait was worth it. Steak, eggs, hash browns, and sourdough toast. Perfect after a night out of drinking and dancing. Oh, and the fact that it's only $4.99 makes it better.  Check this spot out for the late night s&e cravings. It's located at the Tuscany Inn which is a block behind Bally's. Not far from the main strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $4.99. Perfect food to sober up!

jAKQcxXcmYxdorWXpwewKA.text: Okay so for their $5 steak and egg deal from midnight until 5am, it's almost hard to beat. But to be quite honest I don't think I could come back as the place oozes sketchy people and slow service.   Steak was tasty, eggs made to order, comes with plenty of toast and hash browns all for $5... My mouth is totally drooling but my heart is telling me no. If you can hold your own after the club then by all means, go because the food is awesome for what it costs! I however wouldn't come back. Hope this helps (and makes sense!!!!)

6xhYYloEnK0CCXAi5sIsNg.text: I ate here and I ended up with food poisoning for 14hrs. So sad no one has called me after living them a message.

pCeFpGl4yqtc3c47i24DBQ.text: Was half wasted, finished watching ufc fights and hungry. So 12 of us decided to check this place out. It's a hidden gem. It was $4.99 for steak and eggs after midnight. James was our server who was awesome and I told him he had a crazy dreamy voice and should be on television or radio!  He says I was first person to ever tell him that! lol then was more nicer!! Love it!! So worth it. Go, now.. Have 2 if you can!

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hash browns were bomb.com and steak was perfect!!!
Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $4.99 steak and eggs after midnight

f7OLDPsG72Q42xj6A3Jgcw.text: Average. I had the chicken finger dinner because I too indulge in my childish desires from time to time. They were standard: somewhat dry, very fried, and not something you can quite eat without the assistance of sauces to lessen the scratching of the overly brittled flesh scraping at the inside of your esophagus.  Mac and cheese was dry as well, mushy, and probably has been sitting under the salamander most of today. I suspect it was gingerly microwaved before it brought to us.  Fries: probably the best thing. Crispy enough, well seasoned (which the mac and cheese cannot equally boast), and quick to disappear off of the surface of my plate. Finally dessert: I had the oreo creme cake and my lovely companion had a turtle cheesecake. The oreo creme cake had unfortunately long sucked in the very distinct taste of freezer and was likewise quite cloying (especially with the addition of a saccharine chocolate syrup on the plate for 'decoration'). Turtle cheesecake tasted less like freezer. It was the better of the two for sure.  Overall what we expected. Not a place you're eager to return to.

0qnff8ZQtHvJu5GjjulmxQ.text: Went there for dinner because we just wanted a quiet night at the hotel.  Service was great.  Food was good and had big portions.  We are pretty picky about food so while the food wasn't as seasoned as fancy as we are used too, when you added salt and pepper it was pretty tasty. Had the prime rib, mashed potatoes and spinach.  The price was only $13.99!  Husband had the pork chops and they were cooked like he asked. Didn't have any desert but the tray looked pretty enticing.

PEkmUw71Nv09zXNesgrkgA.text: Had the "Cowboys special" breakfast (only offered during the December rodeo week in Las Vegas).  On a side note, this same breakfast is offered for $8.95 outside of Rodeo week in December and the difference is that you can swap toast for pancakes.  For he Cowboys special I had a Steak, 2 eggs, hash browns, toast and coffee...all for $7.95plus tax.  Amazing value.  Delicious breakfast.  Jose was our server.  Jose is a class act and truly kind gentleman offering excellent service.  Highly recommend this spot for breakfast in Las Vegas.  Open 24 hours.  Tuscany is a great value place to stay as well if looking for a place off the strip at a great price.

xbfF3y2FSCftgGFOblPWNA.text: I have always liked Marilyn's Cafe.  The atmosphere is quiet and secluded from the rest of the Casino (The Tuscany).  I have never had any major problems here and I don't foresee any in the future.  Breakfast anytime you want it... cheap eats... and good service, what else do you want?  Here is my review from my last visit:   - We walk up to the counter and we were seated right away.   - Our drink order was taken and brought out promptly.   - The waitress came over and took our order.      * Side note: I am not one that is really picky but, I eat Ultra Low Carb throughout the week.  So, I ordered a burger with no bun and instead of fries, I asked for a side of bacon.  Of course my friends gave me a little grief - as good friends do from time to time.  Or, in my case, all of the time.    Anyhow, she, said it she'll look into it.  It turned out to be no problem and I was charged the regular price.   - We had ample time between our courses.  So, there was no rushing through the salad / soup because our main meal was on it's way out.   - Our drinks were always full.   - We were checked up on periodically.     - She gave us the desert pitch before handing us our bill.    This is the type of service I want and expect when I choose to eat out.  So, with all of that said, it was a pretty good experience to just hang out with a couple of friends and have a pretty decent meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front of Marilyn&#39;s

NTEnvoQaUeYJYxEZDLzdLg.text: Friendly, fast service with a very wide array of menu choices. Food reasonably tasty and priced. The downside? Smoke from the slot machine area infiltrates the cafe, which is adjacent and open to the casino floor.  Also, one has to walk through the smoky area to even reach this restaurant. No thanks.

V8e9wY99mjNK3xG5b4G_mg.text: This place is great for late night steak and eggs. Just make sure you're aware that they do not split checks in the later hours. Their steak and eggs are delicious and very inexpensive. If your waiter turns out to be James, you're gonna be in great hands because he's a great guy, very professional and genuine. Definitely recommend this restaurant if you want something late at night!

2ttvpxoe5zs5rugBYiZPLQ.text: I didn't make it in this trip for the breakfast, but sampled a steak for a mid afternoon meal.  12oz NY Strip & 6 shrimp.l ($16.99).  Ordered medium rare, the steak came out cooked to order, seasoned right and tasty.  The shrimp were good as well. Available fried or grilled (I chose grilled), they were plump, not over cooked and alao seasoned deliciously.   It was served with two sides of which there are about 20 choices ranging from veggies, fried stuff, loaded Baked Potato and so on.  Service is always good.  If you're here for the first time, try visiting for breakfast.

wNQ8eRr_Yc52GWZR880m5Q.text: If you are in Vegas on a Friday night and craving crab legs then try this place. Just know going in that this is not fine dining and more like a glorified IHOP. It makes sense to go here for $22 p.p. AYCE if that's what you're craving and don't want to pay $50 at fancier buffets. It's located in Tuscany Hotel & Casino.   The AYCE is only on Friday nights and there is a full menu for those not interested in crab.  This place is also open 24/7 and has a $5 steak and eggs.

sNuWlOTpKqdSsR69MSUpKA.text: You have to go on Friday's for their all you can eat crab legs! Best kept secret in town (sorry I'm ruining it.) such quick service, the hosts are awesome at getting you seated quickly, and you get so much food for a good price. I love it here.

PYoE8kMuBywKd0YsyNT9hA.text: After a coworker found this on yelp and tasted the steak and eggs, I felt I had to try this place. One word comes to mind: impressive.   A very warm and inviting atmosphere with a good view of the casino. It's a casual dinner witch is always a plus and also does room service for the hotel.   Avoid a-la-carte items as these appeared a little heavy to me for a dinner. However the special menus(daily and lunch were VERY attractive.  The prime rib was sensational. Something I'd expect out of a higher end steak house. I asked for it rare and got it that way which was very pleasing. The horseradish was a nice balance of spivey and flavor. The greens and mashed potatoes were fresh and cooked just right.   The service was just as good as the food and I'll probably be back a few more times this week!

R5P3ZBB6ygHilHHfOiUlwA.text: The best prime rib deal in Las Vegas.  Prime Rib 10oz with two sides for $14.  If your Filipino like me, they have white rice as a side.  Yes, a medium rare prime rib with white rice, au jus and horseradishes is a Filipinos dream.

LBiw9KyRcPgGqYpwNCVreQ.text: Food was great but there was one rude waitress that ruined my visit here .  My husband and I came to get food for ourselves & his niece, as we pick up our food the waitress that handed us our food commented that it was a lot of  food, & how could we eat that much not even when's  hungry she'll be able to eat that much .  I would have put a name but she wasn't even wearing her name tag .

KCJ9djoLxTMIYwLM_CMMvg.text: Unbelievably good. Had the best 10oz prime rib anywhere for $12.99 and it came with two sides and bread. Had a choice of about 15 sides. Chose the sweet potato waffle fries and green beans. Everything was fresh and well seasoned. Had a brewed iced tea and with tip paid $19. Heard the 4 piece fried chicken for $8.99 is excellent too but the menu said to allow extra 15 minutes because it's made to order. This is my new go to place.

7Piv-08RWbXfKlCEEMzfGQ.text: I've been here about 3 times, but it seems that each time is less memorable than the previous visit.  It's a good deal for the crab, but in my opinion there are so many options in Vegas that surpass Marilyn's Cafe.  Pros:     *  There's an AYCE crab feast for $15.98 per person on Friday nights   *  the AYCE option comes with 2 side dishes    *  Free refills on drinks    *  Service was pretty good.  The manager of the restaurant even came by.   *  Quality of the crab itself was mediocre  Cons:   *  Outdated ambiance   *  No refills on your sides   *  Slow service   *  Raised the price on the AYCE option (previously $12.99)   *  It was cold throughout the restaurant.  Overall:   Since the last time I went here, it seems that they have boosted up the price a bit on the AYCE.  That was the main thing that Marilyn's Cafe had going for them was the crab at a killer price.  Since it's a bit more expensive now (in comparison to before), there are other places throughout the valley that offer AYCE for a little more money (way better quality though and more for your money too).  It also doesn't help that was extremely chilly inside the restaurant.  It made my meal less enjoyable.  I live in the Northwest side of town and it's always a pain to get to Tuscany Suites from home (especially on a Friday night).  I do not think I'll be coming here for their AYCE crab anytime soon.  Perhaps on another night for their regular menu, but I have yet to try that.  I'll definitely update my review once I do though.  From reading other reviews, it seems like they have some other good deals that are worth checking out (such as the Steak and Egss for $3.99... unless they changed the price on that too?)  Tips:   *  Make sure to check out the menu for all the other days.  Different days = different specials   *  Bring something warm to wear.  It was very cold in there.   *  You have to walk out of the restaurant to use the restroom, but its right around the corner.

Udrb5ViLV6jRwyZwE4x2AQ.text: umm where do i begin! Really! steak and egg specials!! DELICIOUS!! SOOOO GOOD! It literally beat any other fine restaurant   in Vegas! I loved it! From my amazing waiter.. (forgot his name but, a white male with lots of energy) to my chocolate chip whip cream pancakes! Ohhh myyy goshhhhh If you dont try them after reading this review I feel bad for you! The location is inside the Tuscany Inn where I was staying and after the amazing nights of partying hard I knew I could depend on toppin my night off at Marilyns! open all night and very affordable!

kxht3LTcvdCR6HfRWif9qQ.text: just tryna get my fix for the week about to eat a whole sea full of crab . with sum sides of loaded baked potato after i eat this ill b slumpted for the evening ...wish i could tell my fellow yelpers about the rest of the menu but unfortunately this all i kno bout this place . didnt even wanna tell yawl this much but i decided to bless yawl with this gem

wwQZ_lI35QUeG9jB6hkH8Q.text: Service was fantastic.  We had the all you can eat crab legs and they kept them coming.  Hard to beat the price.

r2EnVZgAGLWbLDlrg2mv9Q.text: Perfect cure for a late night craving. Looked for a late night steak & eggs joint and found Marilyn's on Yelp. Got a double order of steak & eggs. Each steak was 6 oz, came with hashbrowns, choice of bread (I got sourdough), and eggs (I got egg whites).  The price is the best part of the meal. Single order is $3.99. The steak is definitely no Prime cut Ribeye but what do you expect? I ordered medium-rare. One of the steaks was right on but the second one was well-done. I think it got mixed up with my buddy's 2 steaks. So, the food was pretty good but the price is why I gave it 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Marilyn's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double order steak &amp; eggs
